Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Similar to the Breville Barista Express
Review Description: This new espresso machine from De'Longhi is obviously meant to compete with the Breville Barista Express, which has been the #1 selling espresso machine for a while.  The price and features are very similar.  However, the Breville has more settings than the De'Longhi (For example, the Breville has 18 grind settings while the De'Longhi only has 8).  Also, the De'Longhi only comes with pressurized portafilter baskets while the Breville comes with both pressurized and non-pressurized ones.  Why does that matter?  With a pressurized portafilter basket, it's easier to make espresso that tastes the way you expect even if your grind size or extraction times are not perfect.  With a non-pressurized basket, the grind size and extraction time need to be almost perfect in order for the espresso shot to taste good.  But it takes a lot of time and practice to achieve the "perfect shot".  If you are a beginner and want to make espresso that tastes good without too much effort, the De'Longhi is probably the better machine for you.  But if you are willing to spend the time to improve your skills and you want a machine that has more adjustments and options, then I would go with the Breville.  But you can make great-tasting espresso with either machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I am blown away at the quality of this machine.  We got is on sale at a rediculous price, but even at list $800 this is a great deal.  The built in burr grinder is quiet and grinds to a perfect espresso consistency.  The tamper is nice and heavy- near commercial grade, as is the portafilter and milk decanter.This thing makes perfect espresso, indistinguishable from what you”d get in a shop, and looks great on the counter.The front of the machine has buttons/dials for the following:Dose level dial: used for different bean roast levelsSingle shot/double shot buttonOk button: to start espressoTemp button: to toggle 3 brewing temperaturesDual for: espresso, americano, hot waterButton for steamer/frothierIt’s very intuitive and easy to use.  We LOVE it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: What a difference a little machine makes
Review Description: I had been using a manual ROK Espresso machine for a few years, and was generally pleased with the results. When I got this machine and tasted the first espresso it made, using the exact same beans I had been using with the ROK, it was like night and day. The flavor was far more complex, long lasting, and magical. It was like going from grape juice to $100 wine - I'm not exaggerating. I have since started making Latte's and have surprised myself with the amount of perfect froth I can make - it reminds of when I worked at a giant tech company's office and used their $3500 machine. I'm already doing artwork with it, it's so perfect. So I could not be happier with this machine - also it's so compact that it fits on top of my small freezer. This allows me to have the milk wand hang over the edge of the freezer. Some people have commented that the wand is placed such that it is difficult to pull the pitcher away - but this solves that - not sure it's really a problem either as I haven't tried it on a countertop. I am not an espresso expert, but I have been following the guidelines for grinding and dosing, and have gotten excellent results with both dark (Illy) and medium (Lavazza) roast beans so far.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I was sad when my last DeLonghi broke (after many years of regular use). I toyed with cheating on them and trying another company but I’m so glad I didn’t. I’m not a huge coffee snob, so I might not be the best judge, but I love the grinder and the ease of use. It is ready to go quickly and easy to control the mess after you’ve done it a couple times. Fresh espresso waft is wonderful.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: IT DOES NOT WORK AS EVERYONE SAYS, it is low quality, you are only paying for design and metal (stainless steel?) As they deceive the buyers, NEITHER IS THE BRAND, NOR ANY OTHER DELIVERS THE TEMPERATURE THAT THEY SAY TO HAVE TO EXTRACTION (198 degrees F to 200 degrees F) A GOOD Espresso COFFEE, I have already checked several brands and IT DOES NOT GO FROM 146 degrees to 150 degrees F, EVERYTHING IS NOT MORE THAN PURE PROPAGANDA TO SELL YOUR PRODUCTS

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Espresso drinks were very weak, and it stopped working after less than 3 weeks
Review Description: I have been in the habit of drinking 2 large mugs of coffee every morning for several years.  I bought this espresso machine to replace my $20 percolator that finally stopped working after over 5 years of daily use.  I read the product manual to learn how to draw espresso shots.  The espresso had a strong flavor, and the steam wand made nice frothy milk, but the drinks did not seem very caffeinated, even after I played with the settings, and I found I had to drink 5 double shots of espresso to come close to the caffeine of my 2 mugs of coffee.  This turned into a considerable time investment, as it is much more work to draw espresso shots then it is to brew a cup of percolated coffee.  But the lattes tasted really good, so I persevered.  After just a day under 3 weeks of daily use, the grinder stopped working.  I read up and determined that this was most likely due to a clog.  I watched a video in which someone easily removed the bean container to clean out the grinder, but my bean container was stuck, and I was unable to remove it, and neither were 2 other people who tried to help me with it, and it seemed like applying any more force would cause more damage.  As such I am returning this product, and I have invested in a new percolator.  I will not invest in another home espresso machine after this.  I need my morning coffee, but I can live without the hassle and unreliability of an espresso machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I use this product for espresso, Americano and cappuccino.  Espresso and Americano are fabulous.  Still can't get the foamer working right for a good cappuccino.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Haven't bought a single cup from Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts ever since we purchased this espresso machine. It took a few tries to calibrate the grounds but once that was set, it was all smooth sailing. The tamper has a good weight to it, and although the tapping mat was a little small, it was all you needed anyway. True that the only drawback was that it was hard to remove beans from the grinder since it was built-in but it didn't really bother me much since we've been using the same kind for a while now and we just refill when it was empty.We got it at a reasonable price from Treasure Truck.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Followed the start up instructions, including the YouTube video where it says to run 4 espressos before drinking your first one.It's took flushing almost the whole thing with water, plus 5 additional espressos before that plastic taste began to subside....or maybe I'm just used to it now. Kinda of like a smelly car.  Will update later.  Got this for a steal so for the price well probably keep it.  It looks good too.Wish it didn't have to plastic piece in the portafilter.What I'm gathering is this is very much an entry level Espresso Machine. And I'm probably just suffering entry level stuff.If I get into this I'll probably get a Rocket. If there wasn't this plastic taste I'd of considered Delonghi, but they're out of contention now

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This was exactly what I was looking for. Perfect grind every time and delivers the perfect espresso shot. My favorite feature is being able to just turn the dial and press OK for a great americano to start my day. The only issue I see is the hopper does not come off. If you like to switch beans regularly, this may be an issue. I tend to just use espresso beans and not switch, so this issue does not bother me at all. Very happy with my machine after 2 months use.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: This is a fantastic espresso machine!
Review Description: I researched like crazy and initially bought their much lower priced model. It was extremely difficult to figure out and I immediately sent it back and got this one. This machine pulls a perfect shot each time and is so easy to use. I love it! You can make Americanos with the flip of a button too!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We LOVE this Espresso machine.  We had a nespresso for the past several years and finally upgraded.  REALLY GREAT COFFEE..

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: So far Love it.  Great crema, great taste, easy to use.
Review Description: We like the easy options, once you get the grind and tamping figured out, it makes amazing expresso, cappuccino and coffee drinks, very easy to use. Great Crema.  Make sure that when you tamp it, ground coffee is below the line on the interior of the basket before putting attaching it to make your coffee drink.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Returned this. It’s the size of a small car, took a long time to assemble, and would require a degree from a barista college to operate it. Much much much too complicated.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Works great! Love the coffee

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Arte is decent entry level, but still love the Maestro
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   De'Longhi La Specialista Maestro Machine ($1,299.95) and Arte Machine ($699.95). I have been spoiled with the Maestro, however it does take up a lot of space.Some features I liked about the Arte1. Requires less space2. Has an on/off switch on the side of the unit3. Easy and quick to set up and start brewing4. Comes with all the accessories needed5. Costs $600 less than the MaestroSome features that I did’t like about the Arte1. The bean container is fixed on the unit, so if you want to change out coffee beans it’s a bit harder than the Maestro which has a removable bean container.2. You have to push in the sump to start the grind, it’s automatic on the Maestro when you lock the sump in place.3. There’s not much clearance on the steam wand, almost spilled froth since you have to remove it an angle, while on the Maestro it sits higher on the unit.4. Extra parts, like tapper, mat and holder are separate, not stored on the unit. I do love the automatic built in tapper on the Maestro.The Arte Machine is very comparable with the Breville Bartista Express which is $100 less than the De’Longhi and has a place for the tapper on the machine.It really comes down to features, space and budget. Both are great machine, as they are easy to use. Of course I really like the Maestro but the Arte is a good entry level machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great upgrade to home coffee corner

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Solid espresso machine - might be worth upgrading one model higher though
Review Description: De'Longhi has three machines in the Specialista series. The top model, is twice as much as this one, so it's not really worth considering if you are already thinking of getting an espresso machine in this price range. The mid-tier machine is the Specialisita Prestigio which is only $100 more. That extra $100 might be worth spending for some folks, or not worth it at all for others.MAJOR DIFFERENCES-Height/size-Manual tamping vs. automatic tamping (this machine is manual)-Small cup stand vs. flip down tray-Steam wand control mechanism (this machine has an on/off button, the Prestigio has a turn knob on the side)-Heating system is shared in the Arte and separate in the Prestigio, meaning the mechanism to heat and extract espresso is not the same as that which steams milk (supposedly shorter time between extraction and frothing)WHY YOU MIGHT WANT THIS MACHINE (La Specialista Arte)This machine is much smaller than the Prestigio. It can fit under standard height mounted cabinets fairly well.Manual tamping gives you more control and would likely be a better option if you plan to use different beans often because fine-tuning your grind and dose with automatic tamping is a big pain.A little more left-handed friendly since there is no knob for the frothing wand. Also I expect would be a bit easier to use one handed or with limited mobility. It's still a tight fit to get the portafilter into the spot to extract the espresso but on the Prestigio you have to do that twice (first to grind then to extract). The Arte using a button for the frother is also easier. However the power button is on the left side toward the back which might be worse if you are using your right-hand only.WHY YOU MIGHT WANT THE PRESTIGIO INSTEADUpgrading one step up by $100 gives you automatic tamping which is less messy. If you plan to stick to one type of bean or not planning on switching too often then this is a good option. If you have someone in the home that is less espresso savvy that extra feature makes it a little more accessible to them and would make them more inclined to make their own drinks.Drop down holder for espresso cups is nice, one less piece of equipment to lose or keep track of.Better bean hopper which is also removeable making it easier to clean the grinder.So yeah, which one is right for you will probably depend primarily on the size which is the biggest factor for me. Also, how important is manual vs. automatic tamping. And finally, the $100 price difference.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: So far Love it.  Great crema, great taste, easy to use.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This DeLonghi works beautifully to make your favorite espresso, latte, cappuccino or Americano. It’s a near-pro machine that is still capable of fitting on your counter and weighs less than twenty pounds even as it allows you to make coffee house-quality coffee creations.Move up a bit in price from DeLonghi and you can get built-in tamping, a feature that enables the novice to get things right without a lot of trial-and-error and wasted coffee. This machine lacks the auto-tamping, but it does come with a set of tools and a thick rubbery tamping pad that helps with the process.Conical burr grinding starts your mixture off right. You must choose between eight grind settings—and fresh ground is always better than pod coffee.Three water temperatures are available in addition to the eight grind settings. Getting grind, temperature and tamping right require practice and familiarity with the espresso beans and style you are going for, but it also makes this a more satisfying machine to use when you’ve got it down than the three-times-the-cost fully-automatic machines. Getting the frothed milk for your latte right via the frothing wand is a further skill to be acquired, one I’ve not fully mastered.This is a beautiful machine, well worth a spot on your counter if you love espresso. You will likely need to use it every time espresso is made. It’s a machine that requires skill and experience and you can’t just turn it over to your guests. But with practice, you’ll be thrilled with your coffee results.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is really like having a professional barista right in your kitchen. It's fantastic. Everything is professional quality and the machine is beautiful. There is a conical grinder (stainless steel, not ceramic burr) with eight different settings.You can use whatever cup you like using-- the height of the base base is adjustable.There are three temperature settings that maintain precise water temperature during brewing for perfect bean extraction. One of the features that I really like is that I can start steaming my milk immediately-- no waiting until the coffee is half brewed, like in previous machines.The steamed milk is much better than any frother that's used separately. It's genuinely steamed, not just frothed. I used to have espresso machines that would break after a while and we switched to Nespresso for a long time. That was good but, honestly, I think I forgot how fantastic excellent espresso and steamed milk really is.And, when I talk about real espresso, I'm not talking about Starbucks-- this surpasses anything you get at a chain. This is like the coffee you get at a fine italian restaurant once or twice a year, when you can't believe you're drinking something so fantastic.I love this machine. Fantastic. Absolutely the best machine I have. Much better than previous espresso machines, way better than nespresso. We use a Technivorm Moccamaster for our regular coffee, but I know we'll be using this machine more often than we expected to.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Returned this. It’s the size of a small car, took a long time to assemble, and would require a degree from a barista college to operate it. Much much much too complicated.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Works great! Love the coffee

Review Description: This DeLonghi works beautifully to make your favorite espresso, latte, cappuccino or Americano. It’s a near-pro machine that is still capable of fitting on your counter and weighs less than twenty pounds even as it allows you to make coffee house-quality coffee creations.Move up a bit in price from DeLonghi and you can get built-in tamping, a feature that enables the novice to get things right without a lot of trial-and-error and wasted coffee. This machine lacks the auto-tamping, but it does come with a set of tools and a thick rubbery tamping pad that helps with the process.Conical burr grinding starts your mixture off right. You must choose between eight grind settings—and fresh ground is always better than pod coffee.Three water temperatures are available in addition to the eight grind settings. Getting grind, temperature and tamping right require practice and familiarity with the espresso beans and style you are going for, but it also makes this a more satisfying machine to use when you’ve got it down than the three-times-the-cost fully-automatic machines. Getting the frothed milk for your latte right via the frothing wand is a further skill to be acquired, one I’ve not fully mastered.This is a beautiful machine, well worth a spot on your counter if you love espresso. You will likely need to use it every time espresso is made. It’s a machine that requires skill and experience and you can’t just turn it over to your guests. But with practice, you’ll be thrilled with your coffee results.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is really like having a professional barista right in your kitchen. It's fantastic. Everything is professional quality and the machine is beautiful. There is a conical grinder (stainless steel, not ceramic burr) with eight different settings.You can use whatever cup you like using-- the height of the base base is adjustable.There are three temperature settings that maintain precise water temperature during brewing for perfect bean extraction. One of the features that I really like is that I can start steaming my milk immediately-- no waiting until the coffee is half brewed, like in previous machines.The steamed milk is much better than any frother that's used separately. It's genuinely steamed, not just frothed. I used to have espresso machines that would break after a while and we switched to Nespresso for a long time. That was good but, honestly, I think I forgot how fantastic excellent espresso and steamed milk really is.And, when I talk about real espresso, I'm not talking about Starbucks-- this surpasses anything you get at a chain. This is like the coffee you get at a fine italian restaurant once or twice a year, when you can't believe you're drinking something so fantastic.I love this machine. Fantastic. Absolutely the best machine I have. Much better than previous espresso machines, way better than nespresso. We use a Technivorm Moccamaster for our regular coffee, but I know we'll be using this machine more often than we expected to.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Delonghi La Specialista Prestigio is such a beautiful machine, it is a mid-range coffee machine, stainless steel material is easy to use and clean, the back and bottom tray have a little plastic.  From the front of the machine, you have the power button in the upper left corner, but remember to make sure you turn on the switch on the back of the machine-you have the button on the left. Your coffee grind dosage level can be done according to the type of brewing you want  Adjust from light roast, medium roast, medium deep roast and deep roast.My main purpose of this machine is to make lattes and cappuccinos.  The steam wand is powerful enough to quickly produce thick velvet milk that will not get too wet.  This is great for coffee drinks and children's drinks, so we can easily make steamers for children.  I would be happy if the angle of the steam wand had greater flexibility, but even in our small space, we can make it work.  The integrated grinder and smart tamping station are great; this feature really makes the process of making espresso in the morning smooth.  I really appreciate how much grinding chaos is reduced by the grinding machine/compacting station compared to traditional machines. In traditional machines, grinding and compacting are a separate step.  Although it does take a few attempts to set the grinding and grinding amount correctly, the process is not difficult.  It is well documented in the manual, and once you figure it out, it's easy to switch between different coffees.  The ease and consistency of making high-quality drinks for the whole family is a welcome addition to our day!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I love the Arte for my apartment. It has a relatively small footprint for a machine that has a built in grinder. I am actually a die-hard French presser as I love the complex taste and texture of the infusion that gets the most out of the natural oils in the bean. I also have a De'Longhi Nespresso Vertuo machine for a quick convenient brew in a hurry. However, the pods get expensive and the variety of coffee available is limited.GRINDER: There are indeed more compact machines than the Arte, however, they do not a have a built in grinder. This one is an 8-level conical burr, stainless, not ceramic. This may matter to you as it does to me -- I do have a preference for slow-grinding ceramic burr as it is more durable and there is less transfer of heat that changes the flavor of the grind. Most will say its not a significant difference. I think for an espresso, it's not a big deal either, but for a more nuanced French press, ceramic burr at slow speed is the way to go. I do like that this is not a blade grinder which can be inconsistent. Beans must be weighed or measured to exactly what you need in your portafilter -- it will not automatically output the correct amount, but will stop when all the beans you have put in have been ground. 14 grams is about perfect for my 2-shot brew.PORTAFILTER, TAMPING & PRESSURE: The portafilter for this machine is 51mm. Standard commercial machines are 58mm in diameter. The Arte comes with a manual tamping 'station' which is essentially a rubber mat that has a dual base base that perfectly fits your portafilter and tamper. The upgrade Prestigio machine is about $150 more in cost at the time of writing but has a built in smart tamper that applies the correct pressure to pack your grind. Note that the Arte has a double wall portafilter basket where the inside has fine mesh holes, and the outside has larger holes. This allows for pressure to be regulated better with varied manual tamping, giving better consistency to your brew at 15 bars. I believe the Prestigio has a single wall basket. I love that this has a collared tamping guide that locks over the portafilter which minimizes mess when the grind is delivered, and makes for easy tamping and grind distribution inside the collar. It's really easy to lock on and remove.CUSTOMIZATION: The brew is easily programmable. You can customize your volume, strength, and pre-infusion, and internal brewing temperature. There is a guide inside the manual with recommendations for different roast levels. I did some experimentation and it really does make a difference even with an incremental change. If the flavor output is not to your liking, persist and keep playing with the settings that will optimize the flavor of your specific bean. There are preprogrammed outputs for espresso, long black (regular, aka Americano), and plain hot water.STEAMING WAND: The milk steaming wand creates beautiful, velvety micro foam and is perfect for latte art. The texture is much better than superficial foam created with even my Nespresso Aeroccino. I do wish that the wand would articulate to a higher angle as the clearance from the countertop is limited but adequate. I do like that it folds completely backward and out of the way when not in use, and it also moves forward directly over the drip tray so you can purge the wand without making a mess all over your counter or needing to do it into a cup or cloth.DESIGN:  It's a beauty in stainless and black, built solidly of good quality materials.SIZE: Compact for all the features it has. It will accommodate a cup up to 4.5" tall on the main drip tray. There is also a separate smaller drip tray to bring up the height for little espresso cups. The water tank on the back has a large capacity and flips open at the top so you can fill without removing. It will eliminate the need for a separate milk steamer/frother, and grinder. Total footprint and space is 14.37" x 15.87" x 11.22". It even fits underneath my overhead cabinets.PERFORMANCE: Overall, this is a great machine that even my son says outputs a good quality brew with good efficiency and decent ergonomics for a compact unit -- he works at a coffee stand and uses commercial grade machines all day long. This actually makes my Nespresso machine obsolete for me as this outputs much better espresso with more options for types of coffee and is easy to use, quick, and convenient at a lower cost per cup. However I will not get rid of my rudimentary French press, not my ceramic slow burr grinder as they offer a different flavor profile. It's like the difference between flame-grilling, or slow cooking a beef roast.OTHER: Although there seems to be a ridged 'tray' of sorts on the top surface, this does not function as a cup warmer like some other espresso machines have. There is no cup warmer with this machine.For an all-in-one space saving espresso machine, the Arte from the Specialista line is an excellent option. I love having this in my kitchen. Recommend.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: A GREAT manual coffee machine produces bonafide espresso and outstanding milk froth.
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   DeLonghi has a long-standing reputation for well-made coffee machines. Their machines are made with the user in mind, which produce a unique cup of espresso at a push of a button while admiring the elegant, compact design that is the signature style of the DeLonghi brand.I truly think La Specialista is a successful machine that produces bonafide espresso and outstanding milk froth. BUT, you have A LOT to learn about this complicated machine. On a sliding scale, the Delonghi La Specialista is not a automatic espresso coffee machine.If you’re looking for a coffee aespresso machine that doesn’t require much work, this is not your machine.If you considered yourself as a real coffeeness, you truly are investing in an all-around coffee experience that doesn’t stop at a shot of espresso when purchasing one of their creations. I’ve been using it over a month, it did take a while to sort out the right settings to make a good long black for me. After a few mistakes over a small number of days it is now pretty well sorted. I've had a blast making espressos, lattes, iced lattes, and coffee with this machine.The all stainless steel build quality with it's glossy black front panel is sleek, contemporary, and classy. The modern knobs and a traditional pressure gauge as the centerpiece, the Delonghi La Specialista is quite the looker. The left is dedicated to grinding beans, compacting and dosing, while the right is where you’ll find the brew head, automatic milk wand and hot water outlet. The updated grinder from the older La Specialista is a great improvement. You can dial in the grind with much better precession.I do enjoy making coffee from freshly ground beans rather than having to buy coffee pots for my old machine. The other thing to note is both new models use non-pressurised baskets, compared to the old model had pressurised. Non-pressurised is so much better.The water tank is a very generous 84.5 fluid ounces. Although it’s located at the back of the machine, lifting it out from the top is easy. I also give DeLonghi hybrid a perfect 10 for its milk froth. The automatic steam wand puts in a faultless performance. It does everything right.Cleaning is also an easy shot. Some components are dishwasher safe and wipe clean machine with a damp cloth.If you've never owned a manual coffee machine before, I recommend you get on YouTube and look up some how to videos.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I am an amateur espresso maker and don’t have a ton of experience using espresso machines. I had a low-dollar starter machine to see how often I would actually use it before investing in a higher quality machine. I wanted a machine with more functionality than my base model machine, but also needed it to be user friendly because I am inexperienced. This DeLonghi La Specialista Arte is wonderful! It was packaged very carefully and no parts were damaged. The instruction manual lists roast settings so I knew exactly what grind and temperature to use for my beans to brew my perfect cup. It has 8 grind settings, several heat settings and allows me to choose my shot size and drink type. It does require manual tamping, which is really no big deal to me. It pulls a consistent cup every time and brings out the beautiful flavor of my beans. My only complaints are that 1) the bean grinder is not removable, so changing out beans proves to be a bit difficult and 2) the frother wand is positioned quite low and I have difficulty removing the milk cup without having to tip it spilling out some of the liquid. But I rarely change out the beans and don’t froth milk that much, so these two things aren’t a big issue to me all though worth noting. I use this machine several times a day and am in espresso heaven!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Intimidating at first, but very easy for a novice like myself.
Review Description: Let me just say I had bought a delonghi a very long time ago for an ex it was almost a decade ago and I wasn’t into coffee or espressos at the time. Now fast forward time & with having two kids I was ready to take the plunge on one of these machines for myself. I’ll admit I was intimated by it. It’s on the smaller level of machines out there, but still a bit of a counter space eater. Which I lack in my smaller home. I was recently gifted a Nespresso from my sister who upgraded hers and while I enjoyed the ease of use with hers - minus the expensive capsules or going out of my way to refoil them. I’ve actually packed hers up getting ready to put it upstairs when I’m lazy out of bed lol.Anyhoo, This doesn’t require much. I leave it on “Americano” mode x2 for setting to get my 8oz for the most part. It’s like making a regular cup of jo. Unfortunately, it’s not tall enough to use my 20oz tumblers. I need to do a mug transfer if I do. It is I guess noisy- it kinda reminds me of a muse song that madness lol as it starts up. I will say the frother I don’t care for. I used my Nespresso frother since I felt it didn’t require me to do much ( pictured coffee).

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Entry level machine with decent features for it's price class
Review Description: This is espresso machine is relatively easy to setup and start brewing with and comes with pretty all the accessories you need to get started. A couple of bonuses with it is that it is much more compact than more expensive models and has a much more conveniently placed power switch. And of course the main bonus of being significantly cheaper than more feature rich models.One of the top downsides to this particular machine for me is that the grinder is not removeable. I had gotten used to the convenience of being able to take it off when needing to refill the beans on my previous machine. Also, several accessories are not stored on the machine itself. Making it necessary to find a spot for them separately.Overall though, this is a great introductory espresso machine if you are just learning to use them and don't want to fully invest in more expensive, feature packed models.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine has many features that are worth noting. First, setup was easy enough with the instructions manual included. The manual has a "roast chart" with guidelines to show you which settings are optimal. I really like that this espresso machine includes a tamping guide so you don't waste any precious coffee grinds. This model has 3 options: Espresso, Americano or Hot Water. I've used the hot water tap several times for making tea, it's so quick and easy. This machine brews delicious espresso. My caramel macchiatos taste better than those overpriced versions I normally go out to get. The machine has been easy to clean. The bottom tray pops in and out easily. I love making latte art and the steam wand is able to create nice milk foam. There isn't anything I dislike about this machine and would recommend it to anyone wanting to make their own espresso at home.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This coffee machine quickly became our family member, no less. I drink a lot of coffee and used to have Breville barista express. It was good, but it required a lot of maintenance and occasionally glitched. Not the case with this one! It has everything you need to make a coffee shop grade coffee. I absolutely adore it and will be a loyal customer for years to come.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great Espresso Machine - Working on my at-home Barista Skills!
Review Description: I like this De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine.  I am newer to home espresso machines but love a great tasting cup of coffee or espresso.  It has 8 grind settings and 3 temperature settings to work toward that perfect cup.  This definitely requires practice and familiarity with time, initially I had issues with it overfilling.  Also two things that I didn't like as much was the grinder is fixed - it makes it harder to clean and swap out different beans.  Also the steam wand doesn't move very much at all and its hard to clear and not spill.  Overall it is a quality machine and it has quite a few settings to get you to that great espresso at home.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I never experienced a smoother espresso in my life. Life is too short to drink bad sour coffee. I used Lavazza Super Creama. You can set the right grind for the coffee with six adjustability features. I appreciate the fine craftsmanship, and the machine's versatility is tremendous. Buttons are smooth and well made. The device has a double boiler, which speeds up the healing process by around 10 seconds. The group is lightweight, and I am considering replacing it in the near future, but not a big deal. Espresso Booster is great. I wish there would be an indication on when to descale it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Like any De'Longhi, I do find there's a little bit of a learning curve here, but once you've got it, this makes perfect coffee each time.  Honestly, I find the YouTube videos to be the best at teaching you to use this.Once you get the hang of it, it's simple to use and to clean.Perfect temp and the latte art wand is fun to use!Simply love this!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: If you are as obsessed with your morning coffee as I am then perhaps you too will worship this thing as much as I do. I've always ground my own coffee, even before I got this and was using my French press. The fact that the grinder is part of the machine makes it so much easier and more practical though. The quality of the espresso this machine produces makes it worth the price of the product. I love that it has three different temperatures you can choose from for the ideal temperature to brew your coffee. I now have a lovely morning coffee routine that starts my day right.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Classic Look and Simple to Use
Review Description: I have to admit, I was really intimidated by this machine.  It say in it's box for several weeks before I got up the nerve to actually put it to use.  I was totally wrong.  This is incredibly simple to use.  I get from beans in to dump my grinds in probably 6 minutes flat.  The espresso is top notch.  It is a well made and incredibly attractive machine.  It screams class.  It has never clogged, is easy to clean, and makes a great drink.  Not sure what else you could want.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Yes, this little bad boy is pretty expensive but I'm an avid coffee drinker. I drink coffee all day.This isn't your typical maker and it extracts just right and twice you're the bean buyer, you know and control how fresh your beans are.It's like having your own little Starbucks at home.It’s easy to set up and use. You can play around and design your froth but more importantly, enjoy the aroma and taste of your espresso.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: It's like having a coffee shop right in the kitchen.
Review Description: This is an amazing machine. Everyone in the house is able to make their favorite drinks and they're just as good as if they were bought from the coffee shop! My collage age kids have their friends asking for drinks every time they have them over as well. It's like having a coffee shop right in the kitchen! Love it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: There are a decent amount of features and buttons but once you get the hang of it it makes some awesome coffee and I've grown quite fond of it lol!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I put this thing in my office and everyone is loving it. It's being used non-stop. Looks great and produces fantastic espresso. It's been a huge hit. Honestly no complaints here, just enjoying my espresso every day! :)

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Performs similar to my less expensive machine
Review Description: I don't really get the hype and the expensive price for this De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine. This is probably because I already have a similar but much less expensive espresso machine. I was looking for something that actually delivers the thick foamy top like the product pictures, but unfortunately, this also doesn't give me that thick foam that I was looking for. For $700, I was also expecting the milk frother to have been automatic, and not just to the side so that I would have to still manually turn it on and hold it there until the heater heats up the milk and then foam it up. Overall, I would say that I was expecting much more for the price.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: do not buy, quality is poor. broken alreadybought 1-21-22, broke 3-21-22  terrible quality for such an expensive item  will not own anothe one

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Good option for a good cup of coffee without barista training
Review Description: This De'Longhi is a great unit if you are wanting to make a good cup of coffee at home.  I'm no barista so I appreciate that the unit is easy to use and the directions were easy to follow for set-up and operation.  The milk frothier is powerful and really makes your latte.  So far it has been easy to use, clean and maintain.  If you are thinking about it..you should get it.  Elevate your cup of coffee!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Delonghi La Specialista Prestigio is such a beautiful machine, it is a mid-range coffee machine, stainless steel material is easy to use and clean, the back and bottom tray have a little plastic.  From the front of the machine, you have the power button in the upper left corner, but remember to make sure you turn on the switch on the back of the machine-you have the button on the left. Review Description: I am an amateur espresso maker and don’t have a ton of experience using espresso machines. I had a low-dollar starter machine to see how often I would actually use it before investing in a higher quality machine. I wanted a machine with more functionality than my base model machine, but also needed it to be user friendly because I am inexperienced. This DeLonghi La Specialista Arte is wonderful! It was packaged very carefully and no parts were damaged. The instruction manual lists roast settings so I knew exactly what grind and temperature to use for my beans to brew my perfect cup. It has 8 grind settings, several heat settings and allows me to choose my shot size and drink type. It does require manual tamping, which is really no big deal to me. It pulls a consistent cup every time and brings out the beautiful flavor of my beans. My only complaints are that 1) the bean grinder is not removable, so changing out beans proves to be a bit difficult and 2) the frother wand is positioned quite low and I have difficulty removing the milk cup without having to tip it spilling out some of the liquid. But I rarely change out the beans and don’t froth milk that much, so these two things aren’t a big issue to me all though worth noting. I use this machine several times a day and am in espresso heaven!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Intimidating at first, but very easy for a novice like myself.
Review Description: Let me just say I had bought a delonghi a very long time ago for an ex it was almost a decade ago and I wasn’t into coffee or espressos at the time. Now fast forward time & with having two kids I was ready to take the plunge on one of these machines for myself. I’ll admit I was intimated by it. It’s on the smaller level of machines out there, but still a bit of a counter space eater. Which I lack in my smaller home. I was recently gifted a Nespresso from my sister who upgraded hers and while I enjoyed the ease of use with hers - minus the expensive capsules or going out of my way to refoil them. I’ve actually packed hers up getting ready to put it upstairs when I’m lazy out of bed lol.Anyhoo, This doesn’t require much. I leave it on “Americano” mode x2 for setting to get my 8oz for the most part. It’s like making a regular cup of jo. Unfortunately, it’s not tall enough to use my 20oz tumblers. I need to do a mug transfer if I do. It is I guess noisy- it kinda reminds me of a muse song that madness lol as it starts up. I will say the frother I don’t care for. I used my Nespresso frother since I felt it didn’t require me to do much ( pictured coffee).

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Entry level machine with decent features for it's price class
Review Description: This is espresso machine is relatively easy to setup and start brewing with and comes with pretty all the accessories you need to get started. A couple of bonuses with it is that it is much more compact than more expensive models and has a much more conveniently placed power switch. And of course the main bonus of being significantly cheaper than more feature rich models.One of the top downsides to this particular machine for me is that the grinder is not removeable. I had gotten used to the convenience of being able to take it off when needing to refill the beans on my previous machine. Also, several accessories are not stored on the machine itself. Making it necessary to find a spot for them separately.Overall though, this is a great introductory espresso machine if you are just learning to use them and don't want to fully invest in more expensive, feature packed models.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine has many features that are worth noting. First, setup was easy enough with the instructions manual included. The manual has a "roast chart" with guidelines to show you which settings are optimal. I really like that this espresso machine includes a tamping guide so you don't waste any precious coffee grinds. This model has 3 options: Espresso, Americano or Hot Water. I've used the hot water tap several times for making tea, it's so quick and easy. This machine brews delicious espresso. My caramel macchiatos taste better than those overpriced versions I normally go out to get. The machine has been easy to clean. The bottom tray pops in and out easily. I love making latte art and the steam wand is able to create nice milk foam. There isn't anything I dislike about this machine and would recommend it to anyone wanting to make their own espresso at home.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This coffee machine quickly became our family member, no less. I drink a lot of coffee and used to have Breville barista express. It was good, but it required a lot of maintenance and occasionally glitched. Not the case with this one! It has everything you need to make a coffee shop grade coffee. I absolutely adore it and will be a loyal customer for years to come.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great Espresso Machine - Working on my at-home Barista Skills!
Review Description: I like this De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine.  I am newer to home espresso machines but love a great tasting cup of coffee or espresso.  It has 8 grind settings and 3 temperature settings to work toward that perfect cup.  This definitely requires practice and familiarity with time, initially I had issues with it overfilling.  Also two things that I didn't like as much was the grinder is fixed - it makes it harder to clean and swap out different beans.  Also the steam wand doesn't move very much at all and its hard to clear and not spill.  Overall it is a quality machine and it has quite a few settings to get you to that great espresso at home.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I never experienced a smoother espresso in my life. Life is too short to drink bad sour coffee. I used Lavazza Super Creama. You can set the right grind for the coffee with six adjustability features. I appreciate the fine craftsmanship, and the machine's versatility is tremendous. Buttons are smooth and well made. The device has a double boiler, which speeds up the healing process by around 10 seconds. The group is lightweight, and I am considering replacing it in the near future, but not a big deal. Espresso Booster is great. I wish there would be an indication on when to descale it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Like any De'Longhi, I do find there's a little bit of a learning curve here, but once you've got it, this makes perfect coffee each time.  Honestly, I find the YouTube videos to be the best at teaching you to use this.Once you get the hang of it, it's simple to use and to clean.Perfect temp and the latte art wand is fun to use!Simply love this!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: If you are as obsessed with your morning coffee as I am then perhaps you too will worship this thing as much as I do. I've always ground my own coffee, even before I got this and was using my French press. The fact that the grinder is part of the machine makes it so much easier and more practical though. The quality of the espresso this machine produces makes it worth the price of the product. I love that it has three different temperatures you can choose from for the ideal temperature to brew your coffee. I now have a lovely morning coffee routine that starts my day right.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Classic Look and Simple to Use
Review Description: I have to admit, I was really intimidated by this machine.  It say in it's box for several weeks before I got up the nerve to actually put it to use.  I was totally wrong.  This is incredibly simple to use.  I get from beans in to dump my grinds in probably 6 minutes flat.  The espresso is top notch.  It is a well made and incredibly attractive machine.  It screams class.  It has never clogged, is easy to clean, and makes a great drink.  Not sure what else you could want.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Yes, this little bad boy is pretty expensive but I'm an avid coffee drinker. I drink coffee all day.This isn't your typical maker and it extracts just right and twice you're the bean buyer, you know and control how fresh your beans are.It's like having your own little Starbucks at home.It’s easy to set up and use. You can play around and design your froth but more importantly, enjoy the aroma and taste of your espresso.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: It's like having a coffee shop right in the kitchen.
Review Description: This is an amazing machine. Everyone in the house is able to make their favorite drinks and they're just as good as if they were bought from the coffee shop! My collage age kids have their friends asking for drinks every time they have them over as well. It's like having a coffee shop right in the kitchen! Love it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: There are a decent amount of features and buttons but once you get the hang of it it makes some awesome coffee and I've grown quite fond of it lol!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I put this thing in my office and everyone is loving it. It's being used non-stop. Looks great and produces fantastic espresso. It's been a huge hit. Honestly no complaints here, just enjoying my espresso every day! :)

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Performs similar to my less expensive machine
Review Description: I don't really get the hype and the expensive price for this De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine. This is probably because I already have a similar but much less expensive espresso machine. I was looking for something that actually delivers the thick foamy top like the product pictures, but unfortunately, this also doesn't give me that thick foam that I was looking for. For $700, I was also expecting the milk frother to have been automatic, and not just to the side so that I would have to still manually turn it on and hold it there until the heater heats up the milk and then foam it up. Overall, I would say that I was expecting much more for the price.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: do not buy, quality is poor. broken alreadybought 1-21-22, broke 3-21-22  terrible quality for such an expensive item  will not own anothe one

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Title: Good option for a good cup of coffee without barista training
Review Description: This De'Longhi is a great unit if you are wanting to make a good cup of coffee at home.  I'm no barista so I appreciate that the unit is easy to use and the directions were easy to follow for set-up and operation.  The milk frothier is powerful and really makes your latte.  So far it has been easy to use, clean and maintain.  If you are thinking about it..you should get it.  Elevate your cup of coffee!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This thing is great. I use it multiple times a day and comes with everything you need to make the perfect cup.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Best home espresso machine ive tried so far. Feels well made and the tamp guide is one of the easiest to use without much clean up. Id definitely recommend to everyone. This gives the best selling home espresso machine a run for the money by the ease of use, quick guide for types of beans being used and has a very good frother. So far ive made coffee that has a very close taste and flavor as some of the expensive coffee shops with a few tries and some syrups. Definitely worth it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: i specifically searched for a 220V espresso machine - this came up, I bought it $600+ and it is only 110V now I have to return it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: While I am by no means a coffee connoisseur, I have owned a fancy De'Longhi coffee machine for over 20 years and it has worked well. This Arte model is one of the cheaper ones from the La Specialista line. Comparing this machine to other more expensive brands, you will of course find more plastic parts and fewer options.Pros: 1. For a manual expresso machine, this was easy to use. I just followed the included instructions for the initial cleaning then to make the first cup of coffee. 2. The taste of the coffee is the most important of course. I didn't have any espresso specific beans for my first test so I just used my regular beans from Costco. Wow! The first americano out of this machine tasted so much better than from my drip coffee maker. 3. This machine looks good and fits under my cabinets. 4. The grinder has 8 levels and works great. 5. The steam wand is not pannarello so you will have to hold the cup just so to get the foam to your liking. Many old school baristas prefers this. For me, I am more of a latte person, so for me, this wand works great. 6. Detachable and dishwasher safe parts means the clean up is easier.Cons: 1. De'Longhi should have include the automatic tamper in this model (like in their La Specialista models) 2. They should have also included unpressurized baskets as well. 3. You see the nice looking cups in the listing? Na, none are included. 4. The water tanks is in the back of the machine which means refilling is inconvenient.In conclusion, this is a good manual espresso machine for beginners. It has all the basics and is forgiving so you will get a good cup of coffee without having perfect skills.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We have used this product for a full week now. We made the switch from a programmable drip to this machine.Pros:  we really enjoy the flavour of the coffee. We have found it easy to adjust based on different types of beans. The Machine itself feels solid. Cleans nicely.Cons: need to make a new batch each time (first world problems). The grate (to catch spills etc) on the bottom feels cheap and scratches easily. Not the same quality as the rest of the machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Je voulais faire un cadeau à ma conjointe, elle adore le café mais il n'est jamais assez fort pour elle.J'ai magasiné longtemps en ligne car je voulais m'assurer d'avoir une machine de qualité sans que ça m'en coûte 1500$.Delonghi est une référence dans les machines à café expresso, lorsque j'ai vu ce modèle automatique avec plusieurs réglages pour l'intensité et sous les 1000$ j'ai décidé de l'acheter et je n'ai pas été déçu.Facile à opérer même pour un amateur, le bac d'eau a l'arrière est suffisamment grand pour plusieurs café, le mouleur fonctionne très bien et le café est bien chaud.La buse de vapeur pour le lait est merveilleuse elle bouge dans tous les sens et réchauffer le lait est rapide et efficace.Tel que mentionné dans le livre d'instruction ça peut prendre quelques essais pour trouver le café parfait alors ma femme qui est très pointu sur la force du goût a réussi à trouver le siens assez rapidement car la double dose d'expresso qui se trouve déjà dans les réglages sur le devant avec la cup rempli au maximum et la température interne de l'eau chaude au minimum a suffit à la remplir de joie.Facile d'entretien, look d'enfer et un café comme notre tendre moitié le désir que vouloir de plus!Seul point négatif mais tout de même normal est le bruit assez assourdissant du jet de vapeur pour chauffer le lait qui a fait sursauter mes invités lors d'une visite où nous avons voulu les impressionner avec cette machine expresso qui disons-le a bien réussi à satisfaire tout le monde.Je vous la recommande assurément

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have always wanted an espresso machine. I finally decided to purchase the De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine. It was a great purchase. We immediately threw away our coffee machine.  The accessories included are top notch. Although, the water retention area is a thin plastic and I hope it does not crack in the future and has to be replaced...I will never go back to grinding and brewing our coffee, the De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine does it all. We love our morning coffees and now that we both work from home we can enjoy our morning coffees just like on the weekend.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: It is really good once you dial in your espresso to your liking.I moved up from a "living basics" machine (so not really a fair comparison here) but ever since I've got it, I haven't felt the need to drive over to my Starbucks.I haven't been to Starbucks in almost 2 months. I used to go daily :D

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Café americano expresso cappuccino…chocolat chaud tisanes et thé

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Hace buen cremado a pesar que la lanceta solo tiene una salida de vapor

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This machine works great. You can actually adjust the strength of the coffee

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Ça fait du bon café!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: J'aime beaucoup cette machine à café, facile d’utilisation.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Café exquis chaque matin wow

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Excellent choix ! Très contente

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This isn't our first De'Longhi espresso machine so I have some experience across their range and have a good feel for what to expect and I'm finding this machine a great value for the money.  The main difference isn't in the core performance, but rather in materials I find.  This model uses more plastics than our older machine and up close inspection isn't as impressive as more expensive models but from a few feet away it's not super obvious that it's a more budget option and honestly I've seen machines that cost four times as much still use plastics in places I thought there shouldn't be any, only that they were coated in a stainless-look paint so even if you spend a LOT more you still can't get away from the plastics these days.  You also give up things like digital displays and controls but at the end of the day, these are things that you stop thinking about a week after using a machine.  If this were a superautomatic and everything else remained the same about heating performance (which is great) and construction it would probably be a machine with twice the sticker price.The operation despite having "basic" controls is intuitive and it's still very much an easy to use machine that I find hard to make a bad drink from.  I have no real complaints about usability but a couple of situational niggles that apply to my kitchen that may not apply to yours.  The main one is that the machine is quite chunky both width and height wise for a manual unit, it takes a bit more horizontal room than other options.  Our upper cabinets are slightly lower over the counter than standard due to the upper cabinets being a bit taller than average and the raised hopper on this is something that is more difficult to fill without pulling the machine out from under the cabinets every time.  Overall though, it's still not the biggest manual out there and most people should have no problem housing it in the kitchen I think.The grinder works really well, actually, I think it works better than a $2000+ superautomatic I've used in the past.  The hopper doesn't seem as prone to getting beans stuck in it but I have been buying beans that I specifically choose for low oil for years now to avoid problems with automatic grinders.  The straight forward hopper design does seem to help though as our previous machine has a lot off weird crevices in the hopper area that force me to get in there and spread them around frequently.  The number of grind settings I think is more than adequate to get the drink you want though it is less than some other options, I suggest starting with setting 5 and adjusting from there.  I don't often use milk and have never been very good at using steam wands but the one on this model seems to work well, give you good control and produces steam very quickly turning on and off quickly without much delay and with more than enough quantity to make short work of it - I didn't feel like it got out of control on me.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Pros- High-quality, super automatic and espresso-machine combo- Intuitive setting options and functions- Sleek design - looks good on the countertop- Built-in, easy to use milk froth- Easy cleaning and operation- Very quietLa Specialista is a beautiful and successful machine that produces an amazing espresso and milk froth. As with all hybrids, the machine is divided into two workstations. The left is dedicated to grinding beans, compacting, and dosing, while the right is where you’ll find the brew head, automatic milk wand, and hot water outlet. I am, by no means, a professional espresso maker, but I do enjoy a good espresso martini and I do love my Starbucks. The machine comes with easy to read and follow instructions that will help even the inexperienced barista produce a well brewed beverage. This machine is more than perfect for the novice espresso maker. I love that it comes with a milk frother, as my favourite thing to drink is a latte. The machine itself is beautiful and something that I absolutely LOVE having on my counter top permanently. I have tried a variety of different roasts, brands, and coffee beans, and have yet to be disappointed in the espresso and coffee drinks that come out of the machine. An added bonus to the machine is that I often enjoy a cup of tea in the afternoon or evenings, and I no longer need to use a kettle of any kind, as this machine dispenses hot water for tea with the push of a button. No, it is not as fast as an automatic machine, and it has a slight learning curve, but once you start using it and drinking the coffee, you will understand the value in taking a few extra minutes. I HIGHLY recommend watching product videos on making espresso and frothing milk in order to perfect the art.  I highly recommend this to anyone who drinks specialty coffee and likes having a great consistent cup every time. Love it a latte!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This Delonghi La Specialista Arte is easy to use and makes terrific drinks come to life. It's easy to use and there is a little learning curve involved. Most of that will just be dialling in the grinder to get the right consistency. But with this burr grinder, it's easy to do this. Right from the start, I was getting the optimum extraction pressure dead center, as indicated by the pressure gauge. All the espresso shots had a gorgeous caramel-coloured crema that was the perfect colour, not under-extracted nor over-extracted. These shots were great. Taking the additional step of turning your espresso shots into lattes and cappuccinos could not be easier and faster thanks to the improved milk frother. It turns your milk into the perfect, textured espresso companion within about 30 seconds or less. The advanced milk frother does well with almond and cashew milk too.The dedicated temperature feature is great because allows me to adjust my brew temperature according to the type of coffee I am using. There are three temperature levels to select from which are simple and quick to use. For example, for light roasts, I will select a higher temperature in order to get a more precise extraction. On the downside, the water tank is in the back and is, therefore, a little more difficult to access than front-facing ones. On my counters, I have to pull the machine towards me, in order to properly grab the water tank. But despite this little drawback, the machine still produces incredible espressos, lattes, cappuccinos, lungos, and americanos that are simply delicious and high in quality. Full marks from me!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We've been using De'Longhi espresso machines for a few years now and have always liked them. They have always worked exactly as expected and without any hick-ups. This is no exception. It's well made, easy to use and has all the features a decent machine needs.There is only one item that we don't care for, so I'm going to get it out of the way first. This machine, when compared to the others, does not create as much creama. When comparing the machines, the only thing I find different is that the basket which holds the grounds does not have a single pinpoint hole through which all the coffee is forced. It seems that this tiny whole means more pressure is put on the water that then foams the coffee. The other machines are all set up that way. Here the basket has the usual screen on the bottom, and that's it. The other machines have another layer underneath the screen which is where the tiny hole is.The grinder works well, and there is enough adjustment to change up how the beans are ground which is needed depending on what kind of beans are used different roast levels.The biggest difference between this machine and the one we were using is that the older machine has the tamper built-in. As soon as the beans are ground up, we pull down a lever, and the tamping is done. Here the filter holder slips into a collar, and then together, they are slipped underneath the grinder. The collar acts as a sort of funnel. Once filled, the filter/collar combo is pulled out, the collar stays on, and the manual tamper is employed to tamp the grounds down. It's only one extra step, but I have to admit I do like having the tamper built into the machine. If I never had the older machine and only used this, I wouldn't even know it was an option, and I would be completely happy.The coffee it makes is very, very good. Having the ability to make Americano (run the process twice) or make two espresso shots is a big benefit. We did have to play with the three temperature settings for a few days t get that plus the size of grounds sorted but once set, there is no more fussing. Altogether it wasn't a complicated exercise. We just needed to experiment and find what made the best cup for us. There are two different sized filters that will fit into the holder, single shot and double, so we can choose what best suits the shot we're making. All of the De'Longhi machines we have came with the two different sizes.There is one more item that makes this very competitive when compared to the older machine; this runs about half the cost.Like the others, this is a big machine and takes up a fair bit of counter space, and because of the bean hopper on the top, it also doesn't fit under our cabinets, so open counter space is required. To the top of the hopper, it measures 17 inches.The rear-mounted water reservoir can be removed for filling, but it opens up wide enough with a flip-top lid, so we just fill it while on the machine. It's easier in our case.All said and done. This is a very good deal for a machine that makes perfect shots every time.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I am new to Espressos but my husband has been a fan for years so we decided to try out this De’Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine. I wanted to get this particular one for 2 reasons 1) in my opinion, De’Longhi is the best and 2) I had been reading about how easy this one was to use and I’m all about that! I have a newborn and a toddler so I don’t have time to fuss around with learning how to use a new machine or waiting forever for it to make coffee. This one is super quick, extremely easy to use and has very straightforward settings and controls.The set up was a breeze and we were able to make our first espressos right after the initial clean. It has a built in grinder with 8 different levels it also features a built-in milk frother for the most delicious at-home lattes ever!I love the aesthetics of this machine and it looks gorgeous (and very high end) sitting on my counter. It fits underneath my cabinets and surprisingly, doesn’t take up too much space. The water tank is at the back of the machine which makes it look not as wide/bulky but it can be a bit of a pain to fill. I also love that it dispenses hot water (perfect for tea drinkers) eliminating my need for a kettle and therefore saving more valuable counter space.There are a few other great features that I want to highlight such as how the components are all dishwasher safe for a quick clean up and that the machine itself is very quiet when it runs. The buttons and dials on the front are straightforward and user friendly making it easy for beginners and busy people. I am thrilled with this mode and would highly recommend it to anyone out there that wants an Espresso and Latte Machine at home. You can be your own barista and save so much time and money by making your own!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This thing is great. I use it multiple times a day and comes with everything you need to make the perfect cup.
