It has all the basics and is forgiving so you will get a good cup of coffee without having perfect skills.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We have used this product for a full week now. We made the switch from a programmable drip to this machine.Pros:  we really enjoy the flavour of the coffee. We have found it easy to adjust based on different types of beans. The Machine itself feels solid. Cleans nicely.Cons: need to make a new batch each time (first world problems). The grate (to catch spills etc) on the bottom feels cheap and scratches easily. Not the same quality as the rest of the machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Je voulais faire un cadeau à ma conjointe, elle adore le café mais il n'est jamais assez fort pour elle.J'ai magasiné longtemps en ligne car je voulais m'assurer d'avoir une machine de qualité sans que ça m'en coûte 1500$.Delonghi est une référence dans les machines à café expresso, lorsque j'ai vu ce modèle automatique avec plusieurs réglages pour l'intensité et sous les 1000$ j'ai décidé de l'acheter et je n'ai pas été déçu.Facile à opérer même pour un amateur, le bac d'eau a l'arrière est suffisamment grand pour plusieurs café, le mouleur fonctionne très bien et le café est bien chaud.La buse de vapeur pour le lait est merveilleuse elle bouge dans tous les sens et réchauffer le lait est rapide et efficace.Tel que mentionné dans le livre d'instruction ça peut prendre quelques essais pour trouver le café parfait alors ma femme qui est très pointu sur la force du goût a réussi à trouver le siens assez rapidement car la double dose d'expresso qui se trouve déjà dans les réglages sur le devant avec la cup rempli au maximum et la température interne de l'eau chaude au minimum a suffit à la remplir de joie.Facile d'entretien, look d'enfer et un café comme notre tendre moitié le désir que vouloir de plus!Seul point négatif mais tout de même normal est le bruit assez assourdissant du jet de vapeur pour chauffer le lait qui a fait sursauter mes invités lors d'une visite où nous avons voulu les impressionner avec cette machine expresso qui disons-le a bien réussi à satisfaire tout le monde.Je vous la recommande assurément

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have always wanted an espresso machine. I finally decided to purchase the De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine. It was a great purchase. We immediately threw away our coffee machine.  The accessories included are top notch. Although, the water retention area is a thin plastic and I hope it does not crack in the future and has to be replaced...I will never go back to grinding and brewing our coffee, the De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine does it all. We love our morning coffees and now that we both work from home we can enjoy our morning coffees just like on the weekend.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: It is really good once you dial in your espresso to your liking.I moved up from a "living basics" machine (so not really a fair comparison here) but ever since I've got it, I haven't felt the need to drive over to my Starbucks.I haven't been to Starbucks in almost 2 months. I used to go daily :D

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Café americano expresso cappuccino…chocolat chaud tisanes et thé

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Hace buen cremado a pesar que la lanceta solo tiene una salida de vapor

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This machine works great. You can actually adjust the strength of the coffee

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Ça fait du bon café!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: J'aime beaucoup cette machine à café, facile d’utilisation.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Café exquis chaque matin wow

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Excellent choix ! Très contente

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This isn't our first De'Longhi espresso machine so I have some experience across their range and have a good feel for what to expect and I'm finding this machine a great value for the money.  The main difference isn't in the core performance, but rather in materials I find.  This model uses more plastics than our older machine and up close inspection isn't as impressive as more expensive models but from a few feet away it's not super obvious that it's a more budget option and honestly I've seen machines that cost four times as much still use plastics in places I thought there shouldn't be any, only that they were coated in a stainless-look paint so even if you spend a LOT more you still can't get away from the plastics these days.  You also give up things like digital displays and controls but at the end of the day, these are things that you stop thinking about a week after using a machine.  If this were a superautomatic and everything else remained the same about heating performance (which is great) and construction it would probably be a machine with twice the sticker price.The operation despite having "basic" controls is intuitive and it's still very much an easy to use machine that I find hard to make a bad drink from.  I have no real complaints about usability but a couple of situational niggles that apply to my kitchen that may not apply to yours.  The main one is that the machine is quite chunky both width and height wise for a manual unit, it takes a bit more horizontal room than other options.  Our upper cabinets are slightly lower over the counter than standard due to the upper cabinets being a bit taller than average and the raised hopper on this is something that is more difficult to fill without pulling the machine out from under the cabinets every time.  Overall though, it's still not the biggest manual out there and most people should have no problem housing it in the kitchen I think.The grinder works really well, actually, I think it works better than a $2000+ superautomatic I've used in the past.  The hopper doesn't seem as prone to getting beans stuck in it but I have been buying beans that I specifically choose for low oil for years now to avoid problems with automatic grinders.  The straight forward hopper design does seem to help though as our previous machine has a lot off weird crevices in the hopper area that force me to get in there and spread them around frequently.  The number of grind settings I think is more than adequate to get the drink you want though it is less than some other options, I suggest starting with setting 5 and adjusting from there.  I don't often use milk and have never been very good at using steam wands but the one on this model seems to work well, give you good control and produces steam very quickly turning on and off quickly without much delay and with more than enough quantity to make short work of it - I didn't feel like it got out of control on me.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Pros- High-quality, super automatic and espresso-machine combo- Intuitive setting options and functions- Sleek design - looks good on the countertop- Built-in, easy to use milk froth- Easy cleaning and operation- Very quietLa Specialista is a beautiful and successful machine that produces an amazing espresso and milk froth. As with all hybrids, the machine is divided into two workstations. The left is dedicated to grinding beans, compacting, and dosing, while the right is where you’ll find the brew head, automatic milk wand, and hot water outlet. I am, by no means, a professional espresso maker, but I do enjoy a good espresso martini and I do love my Starbucks. The machine comes with easy to read and follow instructions that will help even the inexperienced barista produce a well brewed beverage. This machine is more than perfect for the novice espresso maker. I love that it comes with a milk frother, as my favourite thing to drink is a latte. The machine itself is beautiful and something that I absolutely LOVE having on my counter top permanently. I have tried a variety of different roasts, brands, and coffee beans, and have yet to be disappointed in the espresso and coffee drinks that come out of the machine. An added bonus to the machine is that I often enjoy a cup of tea in the afternoon or evenings, and I no longer need to use a kettle of any kind, as this machine dispenses hot water for tea with the push of a button. No, it is not as fast as an automatic machine, and it has a slight learning curve, but once you start using it and drinking the coffee, you will understand the value in taking a few extra minutes. I HIGHLY recommend watching product videos on making espresso and frothing milk in order to perfect the art.  I highly recommend this to anyone who drinks specialty coffee and likes having a great consistent cup every time. Love it a latte!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This Delonghi La Specialista Arte is easy to use and makes terrific drinks come to life. It's easy to use and there is a little learning curve involved. Most of that will just be dialling in the grinder to get the right consistency. But with this burr grinder, it's easy to do this. Right from the start, I was getting the optimum extraction pressure dead center, as indicated by the pressure gauge. All the espresso shots had a gorgeous caramel-coloured crema that was the perfect colour, not under-extracted nor over-extracted. These shots were great. Taking the additional step of turning your espresso shots into lattes and cappuccinos could not be easier and faster thanks to the improved milk frother. It turns your milk into the perfect, textured espresso companion within about 30 seconds or less. The advanced milk frother does well with almond and cashew milk too.The dedicated temperature feature is great because allows me to adjust my brew temperature according to the type of coffee I am using. There are three temperature levels to select from which are simple and quick to use. For example, for light roasts, I will select a higher temperature in order to get a more precise extraction. On the downside, the water tank is in the back and is, therefore, a little more difficult to access than front-facing ones. On my counters, I have to pull the machine towards me, in order to properly grab the water tank. But despite this little drawback, the machine still produces incredible espressos, lattes, cappuccinos, lungos, and americanos that are simply delicious and high in quality. Full marks from me!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We've been using De'Longhi espresso machines for a few years now and have always liked them. They have always worked exactly as expected and without any hick-ups. This is no exception. It's well made, easy to use and has all the features a decent machine needs.There is only one item that we don't care for, so I'm going to get it out of the way first. This machine, when compared to the others, does not create as much creama. When comparing the machines, the only thing I find different is that the basket which holds the grounds does not have a single pinpoint hole through which all the coffee is forced. It seems that this tiny whole means more pressure is put on the water that then foams the coffee. The other machines are all set up that way. Here the basket has the usual screen on the bottom, and that's it. The other machines have another layer underneath the screen which is where the tiny hole is.The grinder works well, and there is enough adjustment to change up how the beans are ground which is needed depending on what kind of beans are used different roast levels.The biggest difference between this machine and the one we were using is that the older machine has the tamper built-in. As soon as the beans are ground up, we pull down a lever, and the tamping is done. Here the filter holder slips into a collar, and then together, they are slipped underneath the grinder. The collar acts as a sort of funnel. Once filled, the filter/collar combo is pulled out, the collar stays on, and the manual tamper is employed to tamp the grounds down. It's only one extra step, but I have to admit I do like having the tamper built into the machine. If I never had the older machine and only used this, I wouldn't even know it was an option, and I would be completely happy.The coffee it makes is very, very good. Having the ability to make Americano (run the process twice) or make two espresso shots is a big benefit. We did have to play with the three temperature settings for a few days t get that plus the size of grounds sorted but once set, there is no more fussing. Altogether it wasn't a complicated exercise. We just needed to experiment and find what made the best cup for us. There are two different sized filters that will fit into the holder, single shot and double, so we can choose what best suits the shot we're making. All of the De'Longhi machines we have came with the two different sizes.There is one more item that makes this very competitive when compared to the older machine; this runs about half the cost.Like the others, this is a big machine and takes up a fair bit of counter space, and because of the bean hopper on the top, it also doesn't fit under our cabinets, so open counter space is required. To the top of the hopper, it measures 17 inches.The rear-mounted water reservoir can be removed for filling, but it opens up wide enough with a flip-top lid, so we just fill it while on the machine. It's easier in our case.All said and done. This is a very good deal for a machine that makes perfect shots every time.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: I am new to Espressos but my husband has been a fan for years so we decided to try out this De’Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine. I wanted to get this particular one for 2 reasons 1) in my opinion, De’Longhi is the best and 2) I had been reading about how easy this one was to use and I’m all about that! I have a newborn and a toddler so I don’t have time to fuss around with learning how to use a new machine or waiting forever for it to make coffee. This one is super quick, extremely easy to use and has very straightforward settings and controls.The set up was a breeze and we were able to make our first espressos right after the initial clean. It has a built in grinder with 8 different levels it also features a built-in milk frother for the most delicious at-home lattes ever!I love the aesthetics of this machine and it looks gorgeous (and very high end) sitting on my counter. It fits underneath my cabinets and surprisingly, doesn’t take up too much space. The water tank is at the back of the machine which makes it look not as wide/bulky but it can be a bit of a pain to fill. I also love that it dispenses hot water (perfect for tea drinkers) eliminating my need for a kettle and therefore saving more valuable counter space.There are a few other great features that I want to highlight such as how the components are all dishwasher safe for a quick clean up and that the machine itself is very quiet when it runs. The buttons and dials on the front are straightforward and user friendly making it easy for beginners and busy people. I am thrilled with this mode and would highly recommend it to anyone out there that wants an Espresso and Latte Machine at home. You can be your own barista and save so much time and money by making your own!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: It’s pretty much a given that an Espresso machine with a built-in grinder and several other features is never going to be a particularly small, so it’s not a huge surprise that this is a pretty hefty unit that requires a decent amount of counter space. Once you have it unboxed and set up, which isn’t too hard, you’re probably going to want to keep it in one place as it’s not light or easy to move.I’m a very simple person when it comes to my tastes in coffee and espresso, so this unit already has more options than I would ever need. You’ve got multiple choices for drink size, intensity of the coffee, and much more, as well as a steam wand. You can even use the wand to make latte art, but I’ve never been able to actually pull that off. There are three presets for espresso, Americano and just simple hot water, which will probably cover what 90% of people need a machine like this for.Having a built-in grinder is one of those features that will be absolutely invaluable to most people. It makes life much easier and in my experience this one has worked extremely well (with minimal noise). Being able to select from 8 different options for grinding lets you customise what you need depending on your beans, how strong you want your espresso to be, and more. If you like the best coffee, grinding it fresh is a must, but if you don’t need or want a grinder, this isn’t the ideal option.In terms of cleanup, having some parts be dishwasher safe is a huge bonus for me, and it also comes with some barista tools that help you keep things neat and tidy while making your espresso. Overall I think this machine does a good job of holding your hand and making it easy to go from coffee beans to a delicious espresso with very little effort. If you have the counter space and you want to be able to make a good espresso at home, this is a good place to start.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We used to not be into espresso until my wife's coworkers at her new workplace got her into espresso. Over time, this new acquired taste spread to me through osmosis and we both garnered a liking for the perfectly brewed espresso shot. This meant that coffee was no longer only consumed for its effects but now also for its taste. We always bought our espresso outside and enjoyed drinking it together while sitting down in a coffee shop somewhere but since the pandemic began, this tradition was harder and harder to do. The same cup of espresso isn't the same when you have to wear a mask between sips.We knew that there are machines out there that can make professional barista-level espresso at home but we always thought they were complicated to operate. I mean, after all, a barista is a professional that acquires the necessary skills to produce the perfect coffee beverage using specialized tools from their toolbox. This is why it came as a complete surprise to us that an all-in-one machine can produce the perfect espresso shot and it doesn't take a college course consumed over a semester to learn how to use it.The controls of this machine are intuitive but reading through the instructions manual is necessary to get you started. To provide a high-level summary, the coffee beans are first ground up in the included grinder. Then they are transferred to to the tamper where they are compressed. Then hot pressurized water is forced through the grounds to extract all the goodness from them.This espresso machine is featured with 3 brew temperatures. The difference between this model and the slightly higher models is the exclusion of the built-in tamper. This model does not come with the lever-style tamper built into the machine itself. This isn't a huge deal, especially if you enjoy the manual tamping process. It does however come with a steaming wand to froth milk to the perfect consistency for making latte art.This machine's stainless steal finish fits perfectly on any modern kitchen's countertop space. It looks, feels, and functions like a professional piece of equipment. Aside from the economics of saving money over the long-term by not having to purchase espresso from coffee shops, the process of making them at home has become so enjoyable that it's almost its own treat. We would definitely recommend this espresso machine, if you have the available countertop space for it that is!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: If this review provides useful info to you, please consider marking it "Helpful" as it is so meaningful to reviewers like myself!Tl;dr - This espresso machine has fantastic value, with very few drawbacks. Some of the materials aren’t the most premium, but as long as it brews great espresso (which it does), that is what matters to me!I come from using another De’Longhi espresso machine which is about double the price of the Arte. Looking at the value the Arte provides, it would be a no-brainer to go with this one.To be honest, I love a good latte and enjoy my daily coffee in the morning, but would not classify myself as a coffee aficionado. That being said, I certainly can tell when an espresso is not the best quality. This espresso machine makes it easy to make your own espresso at home, even for beginners. Coffee is hot, aromatic, and tastes great.There aren’t many drawbacks to this machine, however it isn’t perfect. The build quality is nice, but some of the plastics could be metal to make it feel more premium. Other than that, I was quite impressed with the quality of this machine. There are some customization options, such as 3 temperature settings, 8 grinding levels, and a steam wand to make the perfect latte.Overall this is an instant recommendation if you’re looking for a beginning espresso machine. It provides great value and makes a fantastic espresso.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Full disclosure I have never tried an espresso before getting this machine and certainly had never tried making one on my own. Yes I know, that in itself is a huge crime.  But I am a coffee lover so I knew I needed to give this a try.  And boy was I missing out.  The flavor and aroma, amazing!The instructions for set up were clear, colored photographs that were easy to follow.  The colored guide even had information on what grind to use for the coffee beans you are using.  We ran hot water through it twice to do the cleaning before beginning and washed all of the washable parts in hot soapy water.Because I was so new to this type of machine it took me a couple of tries to get things figured out and to make the perfect cup.  I also didn't own any espresso mugs/cups so bare with me using the regular mug.The espresso came out a beautiful caramel color as it was brewing and was the perfect consistency and flavor (again my first espresso so I have nothing to compare it to other than knowing it tasted amazing)!  I then brewed a couple of americano's for myself and my daughters boyfriend.  Again, amazing quality, amazing flavor and the perfect brew.It took me a couple of tries to get the milk frothed properly but once I figured it out it worked well on subsequent uses.I like that this unit has a water tank attached so I do not need to fill it every single time I go to make something.  I also like that I can get a cup of hot water if I want to have a tea or hot chocolate and that eliminates the need to have my kettle on my counter all the time.The unit itself is very well made, and looks very nice.  It fits on my counter under my upper cabinets with room to spare, which I like because I can push it back against the wall neatly.  The grate on the bottom for catching water spillage is plastic, this is by far the cheapest looking/feeling part of the whole machine, but so far I haven't had any issues with it.The grind is amazing, it makes great grind every single time.Such great quality machine that looks great, is high end, makes a perfect cup and is quiet sounding.This product is a 10/10 for me.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Cette machine à espresso est tout simplement extraordinaire. Je ne peux plus me passer de cappucino maintenant. D'abord, elle est très facile à utiliser. Les images permettent de bien comprendre les options de la machine. Nous buvons plutôt des lattés ou des cappucinos, mais nous sommes même addict à nos cafés matinal.Positifs:- Pour une machine manuelle, elle est facile d'utilisation- Machine au look moderne- Le moulin à grain offre une grande variété de choix de moulure pour votre café (8)- Le café est frais et goûteux.- Les pièces sont facilement nettoyables- Le mousseur à lait à vapeur est facilement maléable et permet de chauffer le lait et de le mousserselon ses goûts, soit plus mousseux ou peu mousseux.Négatifs :- Le panier à espresso est maintenu sous pression, donc lorsqu'il est temps de retirer le café du panier, il est difficile de le faire .- Il faut compresser soit-même le café moulu- Les superbes verres à espresso présent dans la publicité ne sont pas inclus.- La réserve d'eau est à l'arrière, donc si vous placez la machine sous un cabinet, il sera difficile de la remplir.- Nous avons essayer d'utiliser du café déjà moulu puisque nous aimons les cafés à saveur. Par contre, il est difficile de le compresser suffisament pour atteindre une pression suffisante lorsque le café coule. Le goût n'est donc pas aussi fort et goûteux.En conclusion, c'est une machine espresso manuelle très efficace pour les débutants. N'ayant jamais eu de machine à espresso, nous sommes plus que ravi de savourer nos lattés, cappucinos et américano grâce à cette machine De'longhi.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: During my college days, I part timed as a barista in a small cafe, and loved my time there. This De'longhi brings back fond memories and annoyed moments of cleaning up coffee grinds from everywhere.I drank brewed filtered coffee all my life, except when I worked at this cafe, and it feels good buying bean, grinding, tamping and drinking a decent double shot of espresso. Compared to two giant cups of coffee that gets cold quickly!Things I like about this machine:-Simple to get the process down, tricky to measure dosage and temperature for your specific beans. Everyone has a preference, but not often is it brewed to be easy to drink.-Feels high quality, every single part feels solid-Grinder is much quieter then my ceramic burr, it works very well for a consumer level product, makes fine grinds-Dosing tool and tamp is more useful then I realize-Can make consistent shotsThings I wish were better-The rubberized feet are not grippy enough, when I lock the portafilter, it sometimes moves the whole machine. Using a shelf liner (the grippy kind) fixed it but locking in the filter is a two handed task. One to hold the machine and the other to lock it in.-The rear water reservoir is hard to clean and hard to see water levels. A less narrow side water reservoir (in a cube shape) would be easier. A small LED that lights up the water level when turned on would also be helpful.-The storage on the top is barely useful, more space would be nice-No knock box, I know, I know, that would add to cost but literally its the last thing you need!-Wet puck, hard to dispose of, but I think this is just a grinder issue....still need to play around with the dosage and grind level*No comments:-Steam wand seems to work well, lactose intolerant, don't think I'll use it but its cool ya?Overall, this is a fantastic consumer level espresso machine for a small home, or  an apartment. It really adds a flair to the kitchen!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is a big machine, even though it's small for an espresso machine, and isn't something you're going to be hiding away in your cabinets... so it is good that the body is quite attractive. It looks elegant and "clean" on my countertop which isn't always the case with small appliances.The top feeding grinder proved to be a bit of an annoyance because we placed it under our cabinets. We ended up putting this on a slider to be able to pull it out more easily for filling for both the beans and water.  I wish that Delonghi incorporated some of their design smarts (ie, side loading water tank) from their superautomatics that I have been using under a cabinet comfortably into this. That said, this is very possibly a me problem as I could always pop this on the counter unobstructed by cabinetry.The machine produced a pretty good shot of espresso and we enjoyed using it. It was very easy to use and I liked that I was able to use it without having terribly good technique or skill. Cleanup is fairly easy - technically, key parts are dishwasher safe but it's so much easier to clean it up manually.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We've used De'Longhi coffee machines for years and I've always appreciated their style and attention to detail. The Specialista Arte is a head-turner for sure and it fits well in any setting. Included in the box are quite a few components, including a great quality tamper, frothing cup, descaling tablets, water hardness testing strips, a tool to clean the nozzle on the frother, a manual and quick start guide, a tamping mat, and both a single-serve and double-serve basket. It did take some time to clean the components and get the machine ready, which turns into a negative for anyone who wants to make a quick coffee - you will have quite a few components to clean and wipe doen every time you use it.  This differs quite a bit from our fully automatic De'Longhi Dinamica, which requires very little daily cleanup. But the Specialista is made for people who enjoy the experience of making a wonderful cup of espresso.The unit has several settings to dial in the perfect coffee. You have a grind setting below the hopper, a "dose" knob to add more or less coffee to the portafilter, and a temperature button (three levels).It will likely take several tries before you get the perfect cup of coffee, since each variable can have a profound impact on the quality of the cup you make. The quick start guide has some very helpful information in this regard and gives you some default settings to try for different roasts. It took us about 4 tries to get a very good espresso.The water storage container is at the back of the unit and can be removed to fill if needed. Unfortunately, this machine does require you to go through all the steps to make coffee - there is no "automatic" setting on this, so some family members may not appreciate that. But for anyone who's willing to put in the time to get the settings right (must be done for every different coffee you buy) then they will be rewarded with excellent results.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The instructions that come with this item are very good and clear with lots of pictures and diagrams.  I want to commend the manufacturer as this is a step that many companies skip.  I would not have been able to set it up and get it working without those instructions or downloading a video on how to set the product up.  The instructions even suggest how coarse and fine you should grind your coffee along with the dose level depending on which type of coffee it is.  This is not something that I would have considered in the past. Once I had a few minutes to read the manual, I followed the instructions and the setup proceeded quickly and I was able to do the initial rinse and then brew a heavenly tasting cup of strong coffee.  If I could give this ten stars, I would.  The odd thing is that I used the same coffee that I always use and it tasted better through the grinding and brewing. I followed the guide to how to grind and brew the particular type of coffee (medium roast Columbian). In addition to the grind and dosing you can also adjust the temperature.The process is two steps.  You grind the coffee beans in the built in grinder.  It serves up a dose of coffee into the portafilter where you tamp it down with the provided tamping tool and then insert it into brewing portion of the machine where you can select espresso, a regular cup of coffee (Americana) or just hot water.This will get a lot of use in my house and it provides a cup of coffee that tastes as good as the one that comes out of a machine that costs double or triple what this one costs.  This is an excellent, excellent product.Addendum:  I have been using this to try different coffees that I have tried previously once again and it does make the coffee taste better than it does in a regular coffee brewer.  Coffee that I thought of as bland has a much better taste, and I even find that I like coffee without sweetener or milk when it comes out of this machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Pros:- Excellent build quality. A mix of high quality plastics and metals- Relatively compact design when compared to the higher end De'Longhi Specialista Maestro- Provides everything you need for manual espresso and cappucino making at home along with all the customizability that comes with the manual experience- Conical bean grinder works great, produces very consistent results across the different grind levels- Parts are all dish washer safe, making clean up easy- Great value for money when comparing this to something like the Breville barista expressCons:- Some of the ergonomics aren't the best. Because of the compact design, this also means that everything is set up a little closer together than I'd like. In particular the milk frothing wand isn't in a great position, and I find I have to angle my milk frothing pitcher quite a bit to get it out, causing it to spill milk sometimes if my pitcher is particularly full- No ability to remove the bean container, making it a bit tougher to swap out beansOverall:I've been really happy with this manual espresso and cappucino maker from De'longhi. I've had a number of their automatic machines at this point, so it's been exciting to try out their manual espresso maker. Bean grinding is still manual with the high quality, built in conical grinder, but tamping your coffee grounds and frothing your milk are all on you now. It definitely gives you a greater level of customizability to your drinks and can be a lot of fun. With the ongoing pandemic, WFH is definitely sticking around, so I do find I have a bit more time in the morning to enjoy the actual coffee making process, and this has been a great way to facilitate that. Build quality is excellent and beyond some minor quality of life issues, this is a really great budget option to get into a more manual coffee experience without breaking the bank on the higher end maestro model + save you a fair amount compared to the Breville Barista Express. 100% would recommend!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: If your looking for Barrista quality coffee without stepping out your door then this machine is for you.-Very user friendly and fast-This espresso machine is a real beauty, barrista coffee quality without stepping out your door.-This machine is compact and produces excellent espresso and cappuccino drinks, it is also very user friendly.-It has a built in grinder that you add the whole beans to, then it's customizable so you can set it to your desired level for the consistency of the ground beans you want.- The instruction manual clearly explains how to go about customizing the best coffee for you should it be which beans to use, it's consistency or the strength of coffee you desire.-It heats up extremely fast, just turn it on and it's ready to go.- This brand originated in Italy from as early as the 1990s its known for making outstanding machines as evidenced by their long history of making coffee makers they are well known throughout the coffee world.This machine does a really good job at extracting the flavours from the coffee beans used to give you the perfect cup of Java!!!However when cleaning it make sure to read the manual properly as only certain parts are dishwasher safe.It's definitely an investment at close to $700.00 but for avid coffee lovers it's the perfect machine. We absolutely love it 😍😍😍

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   It's hard to review this product within the confines of an Amazon review. I need to distill my impressions into a relatively short text.Pros:- Quality grinder, the grind seems to be very uniform, and can achieve pretty fine grind.- Has water tank level sensor. My previous machine could not detect when it's out of water.- Quality seems to be pretty high. The portafilter and the tamper have quite a bit of heft to them, and are pleasant to use.- No mess under the grinder.- Space saving, due to not needing a separate grinder.- Goes into energy saving sleep mode after a time out. My previous machine would stay hot for hours if I forgot to turn it off.- Has a nice storage compartment under the lid on the top, for all the small accessories.- Water reservoir is easy to detach and reattach without completely sliding the machine out and turning.- Good design of the froth wand. It can be swung "overboard" for dipping in and out of milk, and can be brought over the main drain area, so that you could submerse it in water for cleaning.- There is enough control for grind quality, and quantity.- There is good control of temperature.- All functions (grinding, extracting, frothing) are quieter than on my previous machine.Cons:-  Very little control over the amount of water used for espresso extraction. Basically, only two amounts are provided (single and double). I would prefer a handle that would allow adjusting the amount of water to be a bit more or less. Or even a fully manual mode, where I would turn the water flow off myself.- It's next to impossible to switch out the beans. The hopper is not removable, so you'd have to flip the entire machine over to remove the remainder of the beans.- I would prefer design without the need for the dozing funnel. It's a part that I am not convinced is really needed.- The water reservoir is very flat, it will be very hard to wash inside it, since my hand (and, I think, even smaller hands) cannot get inside. This may be an issue if you don't use the machine for some time, and may want to wash the water tank.Overall, I'm sure that this machine is far from being "perfect", for somebody who's crazy about coffee. However, it's definitely a step up for me from my much cheaper machine. I'm still trying to find the settings that suit me best, but this would be true with any new machine.I'm quite happy with this espresso machine so far.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: First of all, thank you to Vine and deLonghhi for making the machine avaIlable.A good entry level manual machine.You need basically three or four things to make a good coffee. You need a good fresh bean roasted to suit your taste. A good grind, not too fine, not too coarse (which is why if you have one of those, blade type, grinders, you should toss it in the garbage), water under pressure at the right temperature, and time. This machine does it all basically, and does it well .All of the controls are labelled with easily understandable picto-grams and are, with the manual, quite simple to use. Take the time to actually read the manual, and to experiment/fine-tune.You can make virtually any kind of coffee you desire, and with a bit of practice, really excel.A couple of words of advice. Use bottled watered, and be assiduous at cleaning, after usage and on a regular basis.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This definitely is overkill for people who just want their caffeine fix, but for a coffee lover this is definitely a great investment. With the pandemic we find ourselves stuck at home, and the desire to go buy a coffee is completely gone. Just the thought of having to get dressed and go outside just does not sound that appealing to me anymore.Using the instruction manual, setup was very straight forward. The instructions were clear, and I like that the buttons you need to push are large and attention grabbing. They help remove the guesswork as to what you should be pressing, and made setting it up a breeze. I am no expert, but I found this easy to use.The coffee that this machine produces is very bold and flavourful. The espresso was very strong, and will definitely put hair on your chest. The milk frother also made foam surprisingly quickly, and I was having a little too much fun doing latte art.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine is a fine addition to my kitchen. It makes excellent coffee while being small enough to take that much space.I work from home so having coffee in the mornings is a must. De'Longhi is best known for its coffee machines, and after trying it for a couple of months, I can't say that I can go back to my old coffee pods. The difference between a coffee pod and a freshly brewed one is a lot, so from now on, I only use this machine for all my coffee needs.The espresso machine is straightforward to use and very user-friendly. I had it up and running in no time, and it was easy to learn all the settings. This machine can make multiple types of coffee if you desire, I stick with my regular coffee, and it does an excellent job. I have no issues with this machine whatsoever, so it gets 5stars.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: - This De’Longhi Espresso Machine is an excellent machine. It has everything you need to make a great cup of coffee, from espresso to americano, hot or cold. The construction is really nice and solidly built. Some parts like the portafilter, tamper, milk pitcher are made with good heavy weight steel. Other parts like the tray are made of thin plastic.- The machine has the grinder built in. So you can buy coffee beans and just pour them in the container. The grinder is pre-set to 1 or 2 espresso shots so all you have to do is select the shot setting and the grinder will stop automatically so you will get a perfect level every time. The grinder also has adjustable Fine to Coarse to suit different coffee beans.- Overall, the machine is simple and easy to operate. I love it. Now I can make a fresh coffee/latte every morning. Now I just have to practice frothing milk and pouring to make some nice latte art. Definitely recommended.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The De'Longhi La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine oozes quality and is a fine machine. I'm not a coffee obsessed individual but love a nice coffee, latte or Cappuccino. The machine looks beautiful on our kitchen counter and you can tell it's the price it sells for ($650+ at the time of this review). The water tank is at the back of the machine and we fill it up with filtered water for improved taste. The machine needs an initial cleaning before use and it did seem overwhelming to me at first to use it whole following the instructions but as with a lot of things in life you get better with experience and this is no exception. It's a fairly quiet machine especially given the good grinding power it has for coffee beans and the milk frother works great as well. Overall it's a great machine and recommended.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This coffee machine is a great first step into the higher end units. It has a built in grinder standing 17.5 inches tall on your counter and with a decent footprint wide as well so make sure you have the to first. You can do everything from customizing the grind with 8 different settings to the temperature of the brew. You're able to dip your toes into the latte art fad as well if you have time. It's a great machine for guests and to play with to get your perfect coffee. I absolutely recommend this bring at a much more affordable price point than their top of the line machines and still allows you customizability.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   You will have a grinder, coffee maker and tea at the same time.You can make different roast coffee. From the purest coffee to the most gourmet. The grain can be selected easily.It is having a professional machine in your home. Can it be used for a small business? Of course.Fair downsidesYou can only make one or two cups of coffee at the same time. But it's pretty quick in the process, so your guests won't have to wait that long.From my perspective if it is worth having one of these at home if you are a coffee lover.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Awesome machine to use and admire. Grinds coffee well and makes a great espresso which we then make into lattes with the built in milk frother/steamer. The whole process is fast and easy I hope it lasts long time because I’m hooked. Clean up is a breeze and it accommodates short and tall mugs.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: It’s pretty much a given that an Espresso machine with a built-in grinder and several other features is never going to be a particularly small, so it’s not a huge surprise that this is a pretty hefty unit that requires a decent amount of counter space. Once you have it unboxed and set up, which isn’t too hard, you’re probably going to want to keep it in one place as it’s not light or easy to move.I’m a very simple person when it comes to my tastes in coffee and espresso, so this unit already has more options than I would ever need. You’ve got multiple choices for drink size, intensity of the coffee, and much more, as well as a steam wand. You can even use the wand to make latte art, but I’ve never been able to actually pull that off. There are three presets for espresso, Americano and just simple hot water, which will probably cover what 90% of people need a machine like this for.Having a built-in grinder is one of those features that will be absolutely invaluable to most people. It makes life much easier and in my experience this one has worked extremely well (with minimal noise). Being able to select from 8 different options for grinding lets you customise what you need depending on your beans, how strong you want your espresso to be, and more. If you like the best coffee, grinding it fresh is a must, but if you don’t need or want a grinder, this isn’t the ideal option.In terms of cleanup, having some parts be dishwasher safe is a huge bonus for me, and it also comes with some barista tools that help you keep things neat and tidy while making your espresso. Overall I think this machine does a good job of holding your hand and making it easy to go from coffee beans to a delicious espresso with very little effort. If you have the counter space and you want to be able to make a good espresso at home, this is a good place to start.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We used to not be into espresso until my wife's coworkers at her new workplace got her into espresso. Over time, this new acquired taste spread to me through osmosis and we both garnered a liking for the perfectly brewed espresso shot. This meant that coffee was no longer only consumed for its effects but now also for its taste. We always bought our espresso outside and enjoyed drinking it together while sitting down in a coffee shop somewhere but since the pandemic began, this tradition was harder and harder to do. The same cup of espresso isn't the same when you have to wear a mask between sips.We knew that there are machines out there that can make professional barista-level espresso at home but we always thought they were complicated to operate. I mean, after all, a barista is a professional that acquires the necessary skills to produce the perfect coffee beverage using specialized tools from their toolbox. This is why it came as a complete surprise to us that an all-in-one machine can produce the perfect espresso shot and it doesn't take a college course consumed over a semester to learn how to use it.The controls of this machine are intuitive but reading through the instructions manual is necessary to get you started. To provide a high-level summary, the coffee beans are first ground up in the included grinder. Then they are transferred to to the tamper where they are compressed. Then hot pressurized water is forced through the grounds to extract all the goodness from them.This espresso machine is featured with 3 brew temperatures. The difference between this model and the slightly higher models is the exclusion of the built-in tamper. This model does not come with the lever-style tamper built into the machine itself. This isn't a huge deal, especially if you enjoy the manual tamping process. It does however come with a steaming wand to froth milk to the perfect consistency for making latte art.This machine's stainless steal finish fits perfectly on any modern kitchen's countertop space. It looks, feels, and functions like a professional piece of equipment. Aside from the economics of saving money over the long-term by not having to purchase espresso from coffee shops, the process of making them at home has become so enjoyable that it's almost its own treat. We would definitely recommend this espresso machine, if you have the available countertop space for it that is!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: If this review provides useful info to you, please consider marking it "Helpful" as it is so meaningful to reviewers like myself!Tl;dr - This espresso machine has fantastic value, with very few drawbacks. Some of the materials aren’t the most premium, but as long as it brews great espresso (which it does), that is what matters to me!I come from using another De’Longhi espresso machine which is about double the price of the Arte. Looking at the value the Arte provides, it would be a no-brainer to go with this one.To be honest, I love a good latte and enjoy my daily coffee in the morning, but would not classify myself as a coffee aficionado. That being said, I certainly can tell when an espresso is not the best quality. This espresso machine makes it easy to make your own espresso at home, even for beginners. Coffee is hot, aromatic, and tastes great.There aren’t many drawbacks to this machine, however it isn’t perfect. The build quality is nice, but some of the plastics could be metal to make it feel more premium. Other than that, I was quite impressed with the quality of this machine. There are some customization options, such as 3 temperature settings, 8 grinding levels, and a steam wand to make the perfect latte.Overall this is an instant recommendation if you’re looking for a beginning espresso machine. It provides great value and makes a fantastic espresso.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Full disclosure I have never tried an espresso before getting this machine and certainly had never tried making one on my own. Yes I know, that in itself is a huge crime.  But I am a coffee lover so I knew I needed to give this a try.  And boy was I missing out.  The flavor and aroma, amazing!The instructions for set up were clear, colored photographs that were easy to follow.  The colored guide even had information on what grind to use for the coffee beans you are using.  We ran hot water through it twice to do the cleaning before beginning and washed all of the washable parts in hot soapy water.Because I was so new to this type of machine it took me a couple of tries to get things figured out and to make the perfect cup.  I also didn't own any espresso mugs/cups so bare with me using the regular mug.The espresso came out a beautiful caramel color as it was brewing and was the perfect consistency and flavor (again my first espresso so I have nothing to compare it to other than knowing it tasted amazing)!  I then brewed a couple of americano's for myself and my daughters boyfriend.  Again, amazing quality, amazing flavor and the perfect brew.It took me a couple of tries to get the milk frothed properly but once I figured it out it worked well on subsequent uses.I like that this unit has a water tank attached so I do not need to fill it every single time I go to make something.  I also like that I can get a cup of hot water if I want to have a tea or hot chocolate and that eliminates the need to have my kettle on my counter all the time.The unit itself is very well made, and looks very nice.  It fits on my counter under my upper cabinets with room to spare, which I like because I can push it back against the wall neatly.  The grate on the bottom for catching water spillage is plastic, this is by far the cheapest looking/feeling part of the whole machine, but so far I haven't had any issues with it.The grind is amazing, it makes great grind every single time.Such great quality machine that looks great, is high end, makes a perfect cup and is quiet sounding.This product is a 10/10 for me.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Cette machine à espresso est tout simplement extraordinaire. Je ne peux plus me passer de cappucino maintenant. D'abord, elle est très facile à utiliser. Les images permettent de bien comprendre les options de la machine. Nous buvons plutôt des lattés ou des cappucinos, mais nous sommes même addict à nos cafés matinal.Positifs:- Pour une machine manuelle, elle est facile d'utilisation- Machine au look moderne- Le moulin à grain offre une grande variété de choix de moulure pour votre café (8)- Le café est frais et goûteux.- Les pièces sont facilement nettoyables- Le mousseur à lait à vapeur est facilement maléable et permet de chauffer le lait et de le mousserselon ses goûts, soit plus mousseux ou peu mousseux.Négatifs :- Le panier à espresso est maintenu sous pression, donc lorsqu'il est temps de retirer le café du panier, il est difficile de le faire .- Il faut compresser soit-même le café moulu- Les superbes verres à espresso présent dans la publicité ne sont pas inclus.- La réserve d'eau est à l'arrière, donc si vous placez la machine sous un cabinet, il sera difficile de la remplir.- Nous avons essayer d'utiliser du café déjà moulu puisque nous aimons les cafés à saveur. Par contre, il est difficile de le compresser suffisament pour atteindre une pression suffisante lorsque le café coule. Le goût n'est donc pas aussi fort et goûteux.En conclusion, c'est une machine espresso manuelle très efficace pour les débutants. N'ayant jamais eu de machine à espresso, nous sommes plus que ravi de savourer nos lattés, cappucinos et américano grâce à cette machine De'longhi.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: During my college days, I part timed as a barista in a small cafe, and loved my time there. This De'longhi brings back fond memories and annoyed moments of cleaning up coffee grinds from everywhere.I drank brewed filtered coffee all my life, except when I worked at this cafe, and it feels good buying bean, grinding, tamping and drinking a decent double shot of espresso. Compared to two giant cups of coffee that gets cold quickly!Things I like about this machine:-Simple to get the process down, tricky to measure dosage and temperature for your specific beans. Everyone has a preference, but not often is it brewed to be easy to drink.-Feels high quality, every single part feels solid-Grinder is much quieter then my ceramic burr, it works very well for a consumer level product, makes fine grinds-Dosing tool and tamp is more useful then I realize-Can make consistent shotsThings I wish were better-The rubberized feet are not grippy enough, when I lock the portafilter, it sometimes moves the whole machine. Using a shelf liner (the grippy kind) fixed it but locking in the filter is a two handed task. One to hold the machine and the other to lock it in.-The rear water reservoir is hard to clean and hard to see water levels. A less narrow side water reservoir (in a cube shape) would be easier. A small LED that lights up the water level when turned on would also be helpful.-The storage on the top is barely useful, more space would be nice-No knock box, I know, I know, that would add to cost but literally its the last thing you need!-Wet puck, hard to dispose of, but I think this is just a grinder issue....still need to play around with the dosage and grind level*No comments:-Steam wand seems to work well, lactose intolerant, don't think I'll use it but its cool ya?Overall, this is a fantastic consumer level espresso machine for a small home, or  an apartment. It really adds a flair to the kitchen!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is a big machine, even though it's small for an espresso machine, and isn't something you're going to be hiding away in your cabinets... so it is good that the body is quite attractive. It looks elegant and "clean" on my countertop which isn't always the case with small appliances.The top feeding grinder proved to be a bit of an annoyance because we placed it under our cabinets. We ended up putting this on a slider to be able to pull it out more easily for filling for both the beans and water.  I wish that Delonghi incorporated some of their design smarts (ie, side loading water tank) from their superautomatics that I have been using under a cabinet comfortably into this. That said, this is very possibly a me problem as I could always pop this on the counter unobstructed by cabinetry.The machine produced a pretty good shot of espresso and we enjoyed using it. It was very easy to use and I liked that I was able to use it without having terribly good technique or skill. Cleanup is fairly easy - technically, key parts are dishwasher safe but it's so much easier to clean it up manually.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: We've used De'Longhi coffee machines for years and I've always appreciated their style and attention to detail. The Specialista Arte is a head-turner for sure and it fits well in any setting. Included in the box are quite a few components, including a great quality tamper, frothing cup, descaling tablets, water hardness testing strips, a tool to clean the nozzle on the frother, a manual and quick start guide, a tamping mat, and both a single-serve and double-serve basket. It did take some time to clean the components and get the machine ready, which turns into a negative for anyone who wants to make a quick coffee - you will have quite a few components to clean and wipe doen every time you use it.  This differs quite a bit from our fully automatic De'Longhi Dinamica, which requires very little daily cleanup. But the Specialista is made for people who enjoy the experience of making a wonderful cup of espresso.The unit has several settings to dial in the perfect coffee. You have a grind setting below the hopper, a "dose" knob to add more or less coffee to the portafilter, and a temperature button (three levels).It will likely take several tries before you get the perfect cup of coffee, since each variable can have a profound impact on the quality of the cup you make. The quick start guide has some very helpful information in this regard and gives you some default settings to try for different roasts. It took us about 4 tries to get a very good espresso.The water storage container is at the back of the unit and can be removed to fill if needed. Unfortunately, this machine does require you to go through all the steps to make coffee - there is no "automatic" setting on this, so some family members may not appreciate that. But for anyone who's willing to put in the time to get the settings right (must be done for every different coffee you buy) then they will be rewarded with excellent results.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The instructions that come with this item are very good and clear with lots of pictures and diagrams.  I want to commend the manufacturer as this is a step that many companies skip.  I would not have been able to set it up and get it working without those instructions or downloading a video on how to set the product up.  The instructions even suggest how coarse and fine you should grind your coffee along with the dose level depending on which type of coffee it is.  This is not something that I would have considered in the past. Once I had a few minutes to read the manual, I followed the instructions and the setup proceeded quickly and I was able to do the initial rinse and then brew a heavenly tasting cup of strong coffee.  If I could give this ten stars, I would.  The odd thing is that I used the same coffee that I always use and it tasted better through the grinding and brewing. I followed the guide to how to grind and brew the particular type of coffee (medium roast Columbian). In addition to the grind and dosing you can also adjust the temperature.The process is two steps.  You grind the coffee beans in the built in grinder.  It serves up a dose of coffee into the portafilter where you tamp it down with the provided tamping tool and then insert it into brewing portion of the machine where you can select espresso, a regular cup of coffee (Americana) or just hot water.This will get a lot of use in my house and it provides a cup of coffee that tastes as good as the one that comes out of a machine that costs double or triple what this one costs.  This is an excellent, excellent product.Addendum:  I have been using this to try different coffees that I have tried previously once again and it does make the coffee taste better than it does in a regular coffee brewer.  Coffee that I thought of as bland has a much better taste, and I even find that I like coffee without sweetener or milk when it comes out of this machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Pros:- Excellent build quality. A mix of high quality plastics and metals- Relatively compact design when compared to the higher end De'Longhi Specialista Maestro- Provides everything you need for manual espresso and cappucino making at home along with all the customizability that comes with the manual experience- Conical bean grinder works great, produces very consistent results across the different grind levels- Parts are all dish washer safe, making clean up easy- Great value for money when comparing this to something like the Breville barista expressCons:- Some of the ergonomics aren't the best. Because of the compact design, this also means that everything is set up a little closer together than I'd like. In particular the milk frothing wand isn't in a great position, and I find I have to angle my milk frothing pitcher quite a bit to get it out, causing it to spill milk sometimes if my pitcher is particularly full- No ability to remove the bean container, making it a bit tougher to swap out beansOverall:I've been really happy with this manual espresso and cappucino maker from De'longhi. I've had a number of their automatic machines at this point, so it's been exciting to try out their manual espresso maker. Bean grinding is still manual with the high quality, built in conical grinder, but tamping your coffee grounds and frothing your milk are all on you now. It definitely gives you a greater level of customizability to your drinks and can be a lot of fun. With the ongoing pandemic, WFH is definitely sticking around, so I do find I have a bit more time in the morning to enjoy the actual coffee making process, and this has been a great way to facilitate that. Build quality is excellent and beyond some minor quality of life issues, this is a really great budget option to get into a more manual coffee experience without breaking the bank on the higher end maestro model + save you a fair amount compared to the Breville Barista Express. 100% would recommend!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: If your looking for Barrista quality coffee without stepping out your door then this machine is for you.-Very user friendly and fast-This espresso machine is a real beauty, barrista coffee quality without stepping out your door.-This machine is compact and produces excellent espresso and cappuccino drinks, it is also very user friendly.-It has a built in grinder that you add the whole beans to, then it's customizable so you can set it to your desired level for the consistency of the ground beans you want.- The instruction manual clearly explains how to go about customizing the best coffee for you should it be which beans to use, it's consistency or the strength of coffee you desire.-It heats up extremely fast, just turn it on and it's ready to go.- This brand originated in Italy from as early as the 1990s its known for making outstanding machines as evidenced by their long history of making coffee makers they are well known throughout the coffee world.This machine does a really good job at extracting the flavours from the coffee beans used to give you the perfect cup of Java!!!However when cleaning it make sure to read the manual properly as only certain parts are dishwasher safe.It's definitely an investment at close to $700.00 but for avid coffee lovers it's the perfect machine. We absolutely love it 😍😍😍

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description:

   It's hard to review this product within the confines of an Amazon review. I need to distill my impressions into a relatively short text.Pros:- Quality grinder, the grind seems to be very uniform, and can achieve pretty fine grind.- Has water tank level sensor. My previous machine could not detect when it's out of water.- Quality seems to be pretty high. The portafilter and the tamper have quite a bit of heft to them, and are pleasant to use.- No mess under the grinder.- Space saving, due to not needing a separate grinder.- Goes into energy saving sleep mode after a time out. My previous machine would stay hot for hours if I forgot to turn it off.- Has a nice storage compartment under the lid on the top, for all the small accessories.- Water reservoir is easy to detach and reattach without completely sliding the machine out and turning.- Good design of the froth wand. It can be swung "overboard" for dipping in and out of milk, and can be brought over the main drain area, so that you could submerse it in water for cleaning.- There is enough control for grind quality, and quantity.- There is good control of temperature.- All functions (grinding, extracting, frothing) are quieter than on my previous machine.Cons:-  Very little control over the amount of water used for espresso extraction. Basically, only two amounts are provided (single and double). I would prefer a handle that would allow adjusting the amount of water to be a bit more or less. Or even a fully manual mode, where I would turn the water flow off myself.- It's next to impossible to switch out the beans. The hopper is not removable, so you'd have to flip the entire machine over to remove the remainder of the beans.- I would prefer design without the need for the dozing funnel. It's a part that I am not convinced is really needed.- The water reservoir is very flat, it will be very hard to wash inside it, since my hand (and, I think, even smaller hands) cannot get inside. This may be an issue if you don't use the machine for some time, and may want to wash the water tank.Overall, I'm sure that this machine is far from being "perfect", for somebody who's crazy about coffee. However, it's definitely a step up for me from my much cheaper machine. I'm still trying to find the settings that suit me best, but this would be true with any new machine.I'm quite happy with this espresso machine so far.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: First of all, thank you to Vine and deLonghhi for making the machine avaIlable.A good entry level manual machine.You need basically three or four things to make a good coffee. You need a good fresh bean roasted to suit your taste. A good grind, not too fine, not too coarse (which is why if you have one of those, blade type, grinders, you should toss it in the garbage), water under pressure at the right temperature, and time. This machine does it all basically, and does it well .All of the controls are labelled with easily understandable picto-grams and are, with the manual, quite simple to use. Take the time to actually read the manual, and to experiment/fine-tune.You can make virtually any kind of coffee you desire, and with a bit of practice, really excel.A couple of words of advice. Use bottled watered, and be assiduous at cleaning, after usage and on a regular basis.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This definitely is overkill for people who just want their caffeine fix, but for a coffee lover this is definitely a great investment. With the pandemic we find ourselves stuck at home, and the desire to go buy a coffee is completely gone. Just the thought of having to get dressed and go outside just does not sound that appealing to me anymore.Using the instruction manual, setup was very straight forward. The instructions were clear, and I like that the buttons you need to push are large and attention grabbing. They help remove the guesswork as to what you should be pressing, and made setting it up a breeze. I am no expert, but I found this easy to use.The coffee that this machine produces is very bold and flavourful. The espresso was very strong, and will definitely put hair on your chest. The milk frother also made foam surprisingly quickly, and I was having a little too much fun doing latte art.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine is a fine addition to my kitchen. It makes excellent coffee while being small enough to take that much space.I work from home so having coffee in the mornings is a must. De'Longhi is best known for its coffee machines, and after trying it for a couple of months, I can't say that I can go back to my old coffee pods. The difference between a coffee pod and a freshly brewed one is a lot, so from now on, I only use this machine for all my coffee needs.The espresso machine is straightforward to use and very user-friendly. I had it up and running in no time, and it was easy to learn all the settings. This machine can make multiple types of coffee if you desire, I stick with my regular coffee, and it does an excellent job. I have no issues with this machine whatsoever, so it gets 5stars.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: - This De’Longhi Espresso Machine is an excellent machine. It has everything you need to make a great cup of coffee, from espresso to americano, hot or cold. The construction is really nice and solidly built. Some parts like the portafilter, tamper, milk pitcher are made with good heavy weight steel. Other parts like the tray are made of thin plastic.- The machine has the grinder built in. So you can buy coffee beans and just pour them in the container. The grinder is pre-set to 1 or 2 espresso shots so all you have to do is select the shot setting and the grinder will stop automatically so you will get a perfect level every time. The grinder also has adjustable Fine to Coarse to suit different coffee beans.- Overall, the machine is simple and easy to operate. I love it. Now I can make a fresh coffee/latte every morning. Now I just have to practice frothing milk and pouring to make some nice latte art. Definitely recommended.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: The De'Longhi La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine oozes quality and is a fine machine. I'm not a coffee obsessed individual but love a nice coffee, latte or Cappuccino. The machine looks beautiful on our kitchen counter and you can tell it's the price it sells for ($650+ at the time of this review). The water tank is at the back of the machine and we fill it up with filtered water for improved taste. The machine needs an initial cleaning before use and it did seem overwhelming to me at first to use it whole following the instructions but as with a lot of things in life you get better with experience and this is no exception. It's a fairly quiet machine especially given the good grinding power it has for coffee beans and the milk frother works great as well. Overall it's a great machine and recommended.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: This coffee machine is a great first step into the higher end units. It has a built in grinder standing 17.5 inches tall on your counter and with a decent footprint wide as well so make sure you have the to first. You can do everything from customizing the grind with 8 different settings to the temperature of the brew. You're able to dip your toes into the latte art fad as well if you have time. It's a great machine for guests and to play with to get your perfect coffee. I absolutely recommend this bring at a much more affordable price point than their top of the line machines and still allows you customizability.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   You will have a grinder, coffee maker and tea at the same time.You can make different roast coffee. From the purest coffee to the most gourmet. The grain can be selected easily.It is having a professional machine in your home. Can it be used for a small business? Of course.Fair downsidesYou can only make one or two cups of coffee at the same time. But it's pretty quick in the process, so your guests won't have to wait that long.From my perspective if it is worth having one of these at home if you are a coffee lover.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9155MB La Specialista Arte Espresso Machine
Review Description: Awesome machine to use and admire. Grinds coffee well and makes a great espresso which we then make into lattes with the built in milk frother/steamer. The whole process is fast and easy I hope it lasts long time because I’m hooked. Clean up is a breeze and it accommodates short and tall mugs.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: From a beginner’s point of view
Review Description: Written entirely by a espresso-maker novice. I am, however, quite the Starbucks lover. I am married to an ex-barista who is quite the snob about drinking coffee at home. I am not as picky, but I know a good cup of coffee when I have one in front of me. I figured between the two of our tastes and experiences that we could provide a well-rounded review. Setup was fairly simple. After yelling at my husband to read the instructions for the fifth time, it got cleaned & put together in about 20 minutes. This machine does not include the water softener filter so if you deal with hard water, plan to buy one in addition to the price of this machine. We’ve made two drinks so far and both have been amazing. We’ve made an iced caramel macchiato and a vanilla latte. The flavor is strong and brewed just right. Even for me, with no experience working an espresso machine, it was easy enough to figure out. Prep, brew, & clean up time took a total of 6 minutes from whole beans in the grinder to finished grinds in the trash. To compare to how much you’re spending on coffee already, when broken into daily payments over a year, it ends up being about $2.05. Way less than a grande or vente Starbucks drink price and according to the hubs way better in taste! I spent maybe $15 on Starbucks coffee beans, more almond milk, and some caramel drizzle that will last me over a month. Although it’s a lump sum in the beginning, you will be glad you made the investment. This machine is well worth it.UPDATE ON 8-11-19:I’m updating my review to add a few very important notes that I have learned since I posted my original review:1. Any coffee beans are “espresso” beans. This is probably basic knowledge to some, but I didn’t know that! I spent a good 30 minutes in publix looking for “espresso” beans. Lol.. live & learn.2. Watch all the YouTube videos! Making the perfect shot of espresso takes practice. I went to Costco & bought a big bag of beans and made about twenty shots just trying to perfect my skill!3. Only put the beans in the grinder before you go to make a cup. It makes for a much fresher tasting espresso.4. If you’re going to be making lots of espresso, invest in a good set of espresso glasses. I originally was using a stainless steel shot glass I had and my finger tips about burned off! I ordered JoyJolt double walled espresso glasses (the 2 oz ones) on Amazon and they have been a lovey addition to my morning espresso routine.5. The machine will stop grinding depending on where you turn the knob. I have found for a single shot of espresso, turning the grinder knob to the center and just a tad to the left that it makes the perfect amount for a great shot of espresso.6. The closer the espresso glass is to where the espresso is coming out is important! It creates a thicker level of crema.That’s about all I can think of right now. It truly is an amazing machine and I have enjoyed waking up knowing I get to go downstairs to this bad boy.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: EDITED TO SAY: $$$$ BUYER BEWARE!!!!! After only 5 months of very light use, my water sensor is broken. My water tank is full, but it is telling me to add water and I am unable to make coffee altogether. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!$$$  So much so that I deleted my initial 5 star review and reduced it to one star!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: If you are considering getting this machine... read on so you have a sense of what to expect.  If you have already, I sincerely hope your experience is better than ours.We have had this machine for about a year and a half.  About 4 months ago, the grinder stopped working.
