The more you use it the more comfortable you will become with the functions. I highly recommend buying the knock box and espresso shot glasses!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: My wife bought this machine from Amazon about 9 months ago. We haven’t had any of the maintenance problems other users have had. I haven’t seen any reviews here from an “unwilling” household member, so I wanted to post this. We have had the same automatic drip coffee maker for over 10 years, so this was a serious upgrade for us. As a guy who “just wants a cup of coffee” in the morning, I was very skeptical that I could grow to love this machine. We have limited counter space and so didn’t want to have both. But my wife promised she’d make the coffee every morning, so I consented. Her promise lasted about two months, so indeed I was stuck using the machine as expected (and making hers as well)! Now I drink cappuccino every morning, because the taste is better than coffee (Americano) and it takes the same amount of time. That’s my chief complaint with this machine, the active time spent using it. You can't set it to be ready when you wake up, and the operation is active; you can't just push a button and walk away. So my experience is not in comparison to any other espresso maker, but compared to a “normal coffee maker.”I also wanted to share a few tips to getting the time down from 8 minutes to 4 minutes including clean up. This is for people who have been using the machine for a few months so you know what I’m talking about.1. Use the shelf of the machine for the milk foaming. If you use enough milk (we use heavy cream/almond milk), the steamer tube will reach into the milk while in the included steel “pitcher”. I have found no difference in milk/foam consistency if I stir the milk around or just let it sit. I use this time (usually takes 2 steam cycles) to empty out the grounds and clean up the filter holder.2. I use a small metal spoon to clean out the grounds from the filter rather than banging it, which has been faster and makes less of a mess. I’ve been doing this for the past 4 months and have not noticed any scrapes to the filter or filter cup. The sooner you do this after use the easier it is.3. We remove and rinse the filter after each use. This was very annoying for me as I have big fingers and it’s nearly impossible to grip the tiny rubber tab to pull the filter out. Then my wife showed me a trick: just use a small corner torn off from a paper towel to pull the tab. It gives you just enough grip to easily pull out the filter, and works every time.I clean the filter and cup while the milk is foaming and this has made coffee making into only a minor annoyance rather than the serious one it was before.My other complaint is the noise that the foamer makes. Surprisingly, the way that you orient/tilt the milk pitcher makes a big difference. Play around with it until the noise is reduced. I used to wake up the whole house with what I would call the “shrieking beasts of hell”, but now they have mostly been tamed.Overall, I’m happy with the purchase, but it took some getting used to.PS:  In case anyone is wondering, each steam cycle adds about 30ml of water to your beverage. I weighed the milk pitcher before and after steaming. Yes, I'm a nerd.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Leaks water from the boiler outlet. Useless machine.
Review Description: Leaks water at the boiler outlet. I’ve meticulously cleaned this area to no avail.De’Longhi service is impossible to get on the phone.Water coming out of the sides renders the Specialista useless and a waste of $800.My Breville that I gave to my daughter was so reliable!Praying that De’Longhi will read this and respond.Update: Delonghi contacted me. They did a video call and I demonstrated the issue. They are sending a box for me to ship them the unit for service.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Less then a month old and every time it brews a coffee it makes this loud noise. Not sure what it is but very upsetting for a product that cost over $500 it should not have any problems this soon.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: mine works perfectly , it brews a perfect expresso with a perfect  cream and flavor ,  the integrated taping system works flawlessly and with minimal mess , the grinder and froth system worked great  ,  the extraction process is incredible you can feel you are having a high quality coffee.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: We are big-time espresso drinkers and have worked to get the best home coffee for quite some time.  We have found it with this De’Longhi.  I have a Nespresso Innissa for quick espressos and a Barista-style espresso machine I got on Amazon, but the De’Longhi sails far above either of those machines.  And so it should at this price point, but I do believe this machine would be hard to beat in the sub-$1000 category of home espresso machines.  A fantastic feature that really makes a difference is the built-in tamper.  Tamping usually makes a mess on the counter but this machine with the pull of handle on the side does it before you remove the portafilter.  I got lucky to set the grind right the second time so that the coffee, once tamped, was right at the level line indicated to get a great brew.  I set my grind to #4 for my coffee beans and that seemed to work well also.  Another excellent feature of the De’Longhi is the pull down tray to place your cup(s) on.  Keeping your cup close to the drip also aids in getting the best crema on your espresso.  I ran a cup through both of my espresso machines using the same beans and you could really taste the difference the De’Longhi made.  The coffee (same coffee) actually tasted better!  I think it goes to show the technology in these higher-end machines and the superior extraction process.  I know this isn’t a cheap decision but if you are going up to that sub-$1000 price range, I don’t think you can beat this machine.  I will also add that it is just gorgeous looking in terms of design and really impresses on the kitchen countertop!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: De'Longhi Espresso Machine with Built In Burr Grinder
Review Description: This arrived just in time for a visit from family, someone who actually owns and uses an espresso machine, and who loves espresso coffee. My husband loves espresso, but orders from a local restaurant when he's in the mood and he is no barista.I'm a tea drinker, so yeah, what do I know. For the review I can tell you this, husband and visitor loved the results from the first shot. The beans ground in moments (just the right amount, automatically), the tamper is built in and tamps just right, the coffee brewed beautifully, and had the nice crema that apparently espresso drinkers appreciate for a silky touch.So I can't talk to the taste, but I can say that this is a well built machine and heavy, although there is some plastic involved. Still, it's a high quality appliance. The controls are self-explanatory (although reading the manual would be helpful for the uninitiated).This appliance will be much appreciated in our New England home by the visitors who are accustomed to a daily jolt or two of Cafe Cubano. We're ready.UPDATE Aug 13 2022: And on this day the grinder died. An hour spent cleaning the hopper and grinder parts and no luck. Downgraded to three stars and those remain because it really does make great coffee I'm told, and it still brews.But turns out it's a complicated process even for some people who know how to use an espresso maker, impossible for those who haven't without the instructions and no one bothers with instructions, they just barrel ahead.Be prepared to be the sole barista when guests arrive.FURTHER UPDATE: We sent it to an authorized repair company and they fixed it. From now on if someone wants an espresso they can wait until we prepare it for them.Still three stars. Five for the delicious coffee, so sayeth the coffee drinkers who have enjoyed a pour.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Best home espresso I have had
Review Description: I have spent a lot of time and money in pursuit of the best coffee I can make at home.  I have machines and accessories for just about every way of preparing coffee, to include 3 espresso machines, and a stove top (Mokka).  For the past few years we have been using a Phillips Saeco machine.  It is very easy, and also very good, but it does consistently pour a little water into the cup before it dispenses coffee... so it is good, but less than ideal.Some years ago I read on Coffee Geek that your grinder can make as much of a difference as your machine/ method of preparation.  I went through half a dozen grinders before I found one which lasted for more than a month or two past warranty (and there were several expensive grinders from well known companies).  The machine which lasted, the one we still use 6 or 7 years later, is a De'Longhi.  I also have a toaster oven from De'Longhi in my garage.  We used it for over 20 years, replacing it only this year with an air fryer, but held onto the De'Longhi in case that gives out.  All that said, I know that De'Longhi makes solid equipment which performs well and is reliable.  In fact, I sent my son a De'Longhi espresso machine when he graduated from college and then got stranded in California, by the shut downs.  Sensibly the next machine I would look at would be a De'Longhi.This machine does take more effort than the one we had been using, but it is an all in one machine.  It has a conical burr grinder which dispenses into the portafilter.  There is also a built in tamper.  The portafilter is then moved to where the water is expressed.  You can adjust the coarseness/ fineness of the grind and the amount of coffee ground/ dispensed as well as the amount of water and temperature.  A chart is provided with suggestions based on the roast.  There are also options with respect to how much froth is produced.This machine provides a lot more control than the Saeco and the amount of water, speed, heat are determined based on grind and dose settings.  The end result was espresso which was much better than I have been able to make with the other machines I have had.While the machine is not automatic, everything you need is provided, with recommendations for getting the best from each type of roast, but you can choose the grind and amount based on personal preferences, and store some of those choices with the "my" button.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: Very impressive. It’s all stainless steel and is ready for decades of use because the stainless will look good for the life of the espresso machine without rusting away like other materials would have. And with all the other pieces and parts fitting perfectly well and made to last just like the stainless it can and will be passed on hopefully to another espresso lover just like myself. The instructions were informative and easy to read and understand and the pictures helped me immediately with setup and use. It grinds the beans to exacting specifications for this machines use. It does the tampering to required pressure as well with just a push of a button. I’m getting better and faster everyday in its use and with it doing most of the work for me with probably one hundred percent more accuracy than me. Each and every espresso I let it make for us is the perfect cup every time, all the time. It does get noticed immediately sitting on our counter the moment eyes set on it as it’s brilliant brightness and ultimate quality stands out against every other appliance we have. Definitely starts many a conversations. I’m fully satisfied with the quality of and the functionality it provides us daily. Update (24 December 2021) added a picture of the pressure dial getting into the optimal zone. Once dialed in we were rewarded with a great tasting five star experience!! Update (17 February 2022) We definitely are still enjoying the espresso machine and it’s ease of use but when it needs to be descaled everything comes to a screeching halt for 45 minutes. I turned it on this morning to prepare it for our drinks and we are just sitting around now waiting for it to descale. Maybe a switch so it’s not always need descaling at the critical time we need it the most. But still 5 stars. Five Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!! Update (March 7 2022) I stand corrected, as long as the knob is in any other position other than the descaling mode when the light comes on it will still continue to make espressos until AFTER the morning rush and can be descaled at our leisure later that day or night. We are still happy with the daily operation of the machine!!  Still 5 Stars. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: De'Longhi La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine, Stainless SteelMy husband has been wanting a good espresso machine, so we went ahead and got this when it was offered. After using it 2 or 3 times a day for the past two weeks, I can say without any exaggeration that it looks and performs exactly like a professional espresso machine and has everything you need to make espresso drinks that taste *exactly* as good as the best coffee houses. Although I could write a full report detailing why I believe it is an outstanding machine, I'll limit this to a just-the-facts paragraph. First off, it is fast, and you can have a double-espresso latte made within 5 minutes of turning it on. It is also the cleanest real espresso machine that I've ever used; the grinder doesn't leave coffee grounds anywhere and any small amounts of powder from the tamper collect straight down into the drip tray. The tamper is connected to the tamping lever with a spring which ensures that you don't over- or under-tamp the basket. The brewing has a perfect amount of automation, by which I mean that you still have a good control of the coarseness of the grind and the brewing temperature. One thing that really stands out to me is that it has a gauge that gives you feedback on the brewing pressure which gives you direct feedback to use for adjusting the grind coarseness for the specific beans that you're using. Selecting between a single or double shot is as easy as pressing a button and switching between espresso, Americano, or single serving of regular coffee in just a turn of a knob. For the Americano, it even automatically adds the right amount of hot water. The steam wand is really impressive because the control knob activates a pump that pulses water into the steam chamber which eliminates having to drain the wand of condensate and also ensures that there is the right amount of steam pressure. I could easily go on about this machine but suffice it to say that it really is that impressive! Highly recommend!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Best Expresso Machine on the Market
Review Description: A friend of mine owns this espresso machine and always has the coffee ever at his house. For the longest time I still couldn’t justify spending this much on a coffee machine, however I’m here to say that the D’longhi Specialista is worth every penny plus some. Aesthetically, this machine looks excellent on your countertops. Performance wise, this expresso machine is impressive and makes some of the best coffee you will ever have. The grinder on the top is great so that I don’t have to use my extra coffee grinder and the coffee is always super fresh. It portions out the exact amount needed for a cup of expresso based on your selection. It is a bit tricky to get the hang of initially, but the instructions are clear (plus their are videos online) and once you get the hang of it, it’s not complicated at all. It’s just going from a Keuirg to a fancy machine like this takes a bit of practice. I can make a double shot of expresso and foam/ steam my milk and no longer need to make a coffee run to get the coffee I desire. You can even pick the temperature that you want which is nice. Machine is tall, so if you have an older 1950’s home with shorter cabinets you will need to measure to be sure it fits under cabinet. We are not done renovating yet so cabinets are still short and I have to remove grinder accessory to push it so it sits flush under cabinet.Overall, I would highly recommend this. It is an expresso machine that you will get your money’s worth out of and the quality is top notch.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: Personal note: I like coffee, and love espresso. But some in my household are absolute coffee fanatics. My wife and my daughter have the knowledge and are the real critics. One daughter works as a barista in a private high end coffee shop and is used to expensive equipment. That said...We all think this is a great machine.Everything about it feels and looks like quality, it is well designed, and it works well.Unboxing and setting it up was fairly simple.  As is typical (I guess) it took a few days of tweaking to fine tune it to our coffee preferences, but even the trial and error "fails" were drinkable.A big plus is the tamping. It is manually done... sort of. Well, it's foolproof. Hand tamping can be a learned skill (that I never quite mastered), but this doesn't require that. There is a lever on the side of the machine (like a slot machine) which is mechanically set to tamp to the right density. Works great, even when I do it!The milk frother is the real deal (though I'm not the big user), and works well. We (they) can make just about any coffee drink known to man now.There are also auto settings for americanos and regular coffees, but we really stick to the double espresso setting.Love it! Highly recommend!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: More user friendly than our previous machine, doesn't fit under our cabinets just barely
Review Description: EASY TO USEWe have had our Gaggia espresso machine for years. In those years I have repeatedly tried to get good at making espresso (my partner is the espresso maker in our house).  Every time, I give up.Part of that is because it feels too easy to make a mistake and part of that is because its a huge mess. Particularly getting the grounds from the grinder, and then temping them down. I know that probably sounds finicky and whiny to folks who really love their espresso but I hate it and it led to our counters never feeling clean.The fact that grinding and tamping is in the machine is infinitely better. It keeps our counters cleaner but it also means that when we get new beans, my partner can do all the fiddling to get the exact right grind and dose and then we just leave it that way for me to make my own drinks. Despite using this machine for over a month, I still don't know the principles behind getting the perfect pull, and I am totally okay with that. I am making more espresso drinks now than I ever did with the Gaggia. I don't know if purists find that annoying, but the added features make it a lot more user friendly. I am even pretty confident if my mom came to visit, I could show her how to do it once and then she could just make her own drinks.SIZEBecause the photo I took has the Gaggia in front of the De'Longhi it makes the Gaggia look a bit bigger than it actually is. It is definitely narrower, but a tiny bit taller. It used to live under our cabinet and had a fairly small footprint on the counter. The De'Longhi is more substantial and can't fit under the counter. If you took off the lid to the bean hopper, you could totally put it under the counter but that would leave the beans unprotected from the air and they would go stale. If your cabinets are a bit taller you might be okay but I think they are generally hung at a standard height. Because of that, we have it half under the cabinet with the hopper sticking out. There's only one real place in our kitchen that it fits that way, which is right next to the sink. While I think I'd prefer to have it on the left side of the sink which is impossible to do, this is okay - not ideal but okay.OVERALLIn the end, this is a nice compromise for my partner and I. He's super into making espresso and getting things as perfect as possible. I'm not interested in that at all, I just want good coffee. This is an excellent way for both of us to have what we want without me having to bug him for every drink. I also use the hot water function for tea every morning which means I can put my kettle in the cabinet. There is a way to change how much water comes out with the hot water function I believe but I haven't fiddled with it yet.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: Have you ever been to a small, craft coffee shop and gawked at their machines that they use? Well...gawk no more.  This machine is it!  It will grind your beans, tamp your grounds, drip your brew, and froth your milk.  All this in a sleek, majestic exterior that is common to everything Delonghi sells.This is NOT a coffee maker for the average Joe.  As long as you understand that, you won’t waste your money here.You’ll have to practice to know what level of grind is best for different beans.  I keep track in Excel.The auto-tank feature is clutch.  I used to pack my own stainless steel Nespresso pods and has trouble producing consistently packed pods.  This machine automates all that.It looks super cool on your counter top.  And unlike Nespresso, no proprietary pods required.A masterpiece.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Intimidating for newbies, but makes tasty coffee
Review Description: I have never had a machine like this before, and am a newbie when it comes to making the "perfect" cup of espresso, so full disclaimer, this review is written by someone that knows next to nothing about this.  Having said that, this machine is beautiful and looks very expensive (which, it is).  It does not have too many parts to keep track of so that's good, but it does have more bits then I'm used to having to maintain, so it is a bit of an adjustment for me.  Putting it together out of the box wasn't that bad.This draws a LOT of power.  I don't know too much about these things but I know it blew a breaker right away.  I had to move appliances around in my kitchen for sure.I watched the videos on You Tube on how to work this machine and was enjoying several lattes right right away (I wanted to practice).  What I'm not really understanding is how to get the espresso I'm making match the diagram of a "perfect" espresso.  According to the pictures, I'm "over-extracting".  I've followed the instructions on how to correct this but nothing I do seems to change the look of the espresso coming out of the machine.  I guess it's no big deal because whatever this is making is delicious and a billion times better then the coffee I was making before, and I'll watch more videos and try and figure it out.I don't love:You can't froth milk and make espresso at the same time.  I guess that makes sense but I wish you could.There is no clearance for a decent sized mug.  I know us Americans make giant coffees, but hey, this is being sold to Americans so please make it a little but taller.  You can't remove the grill to give more clearance and make the machine work.There isn't much clearance for the frothing wand and it doesn't really move that much.  I don't feel like I can froth that much milk at a time.So basically, my main complaints right now are that I want to make giant beverages and this machine forces me to have portion/quantity control, which all is a #firstworldproblem!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Great espresso maker with a learning curve
Review Description: The De’Longhi La Specialista is a great espresso maker.  It had a bit of a learning curve, though. So first… The unpacking itself was impressive. The packaging was done so well I barely could get the tightly packed machine out of the attractive and well-designed box.  The machine and its parts were packed within some seriously dense foam and the smaller parts were packed within a much smaller well-designed box within the main box.  The machine and parts were wrapped in a plastic wrap that ensured that even a small blemish could not occur during packaging or shipping.  The box contained all the parts necessary to make all types of one- and two-shot drinks: 2 espresso filters to make a single or a double espresso, descaling tablets, a stainless-steel milk pitcher, and a cleaning brush, and single-use descaling solution.My friend and I removed the parts from the box and we began the very small amount of assembly and setting the unit up on my countertop.  I decided to fill the bean hopper before I installed it onto the top of the machine.  I lay out a cloth and filled the hopper and once I started to move the hopper to the top of the machine, beans fell out of the bottom of the hopper onto the countertop.  Yes, the bean hopper has an open bottom.  That made us realize that you cannot remove the bean hopper while there are beans in it and it is installed on the top of the machine because they will spill out over the top of the machine and onto your counter and floor.  The bean hopper must be visibly empty to remove it from the top of the machine or you must vacuum the beans out of the hopper before removal from the machine or later vacuum the beans off the counters and floor.After that fiasco, I decided I might want to refer to the Quick Start Guide for the remaining setup items.  If in doubt, read the manual/quick start guide. The Quick Start Guide is helpful but in no way takes the place of the full manual.  My initial test results were poor.  But, after reading the full manual and still getting less than optimal results in grinding and brewing, I decided that the full manual does not take the place of the many YouTube videos available to help with settings and operation of the machine.  After reviewing several YouTube videos, I got to action, made some adjustments, and had much better results.I really like the integrated grinder with Sensor Grinding Technology which provides consistent grinding and the Smart Tamping Station perfect pressure tamper.  It took some looking at YouTube videos for me to understand the grinding operation and how to adjust the grind to get the optimal grind for crema but once I tinkered with it and did several test grinds and test shots of espresso, I better understood the adjustment needed to get the optimal shot and crema with the coffee beans I was using.  I believe it will be easy to adjust the grind to suit any other coffee bean I might choose in the future should I decide to change the brand and type of bean.  Understanding and using the tamping mechanism was a breeze.My favorite part of the machine is the Immediate Start function.  Yes, you can power the machine on and start grinding immediately.  While you are grinding, the machine is readying itself for the brewing, preparing hot water for Americano and/or milk frothing.  It uses two independent heating systems so there is no waiting time between the espresso and the milk preparation.  The Advanced Latte System is super easy to use and I was able to make the perfect foam the very first time I tried.  There are two options for milk – foam and flat.  The only downside is I wish the stainless-steel milk frothing pitcher were larger.  It only holds enough for a small latte.  I will definitely be purchasing a larger pitcher.The overflow tray offers a warning by use of a piece of floating plastic that sticks up through the tray as the tray fills.  By the time this happens, the tray is difficult to remove and balance to get it to the sink to empty.  Since it is easy to remove and check for fullness, I would suggest you remove it and rinse it before it gets to this level.  Some of the buttons function to give water for rinsing and steam for other parts of the machine for cleaning.Overall, the great design of this espresso maker makes this piece of equipment fancy up my countertop.  It’s just a gorgeous amalgam of stainless steel that looks luxurious and professional at the same time.I do think some things could be better.  For one, the milk steamer pitcher is small – very small – only 12 oz.  That may sound big enough but it only holds enough milk and foam for a half-full mug of latte.  But that is an easy to resolve issue by purchasing a larger pitcher.  The bean hopper should have some type of mechanism that would allow it to be removed without losing all of the beans.  I would think some type of an operable lever that could close off the hopper might be a plus.  I also think the height of the bean hopper can be a problem with top cabinets that are not abnormally high.  Mine are about 17-1/2”, pretty close to new Cabinet standards, and the hopper lid does not fit on the hopper and fit under my cabinet.  It’s just a little too tall. I am using a small piece of plastic to cover the hopper when it is under the cabinet.  This could be a major problem for some because many cabinets are much lower than mine.  Also, the low upper cabinet might get in the way of operating the tamper lever.  In addition, the drip tray could use an early warning system instead of a “too late” system to notify the user that it is full.  And, lastly even though the water fill chamber holds quite a bit of water and the machine seems efficient in its use of the water, I would appreciate it if the water fill chamber was on the side for easier filling and access.Since my machine has only been in use a couple of days, I have not yet descaled.  I’m certain I will provide lots of use and therefore opportunity to see if it continues to function well.  If not, the machine has a one-year parts and labor warranty. I will amend this review if I find any major flaws or if this espresso maker does not hold up as I think it will.  So far, I am very pleased with this De’Longhi La Specialista espresso maker.Let Amazon donate to your favorite charity! Use Amazon Smile (smile.amazon.com) when you order and Amazon will donate to the charity of your choice when you make a qualifying purchase. Check out how Amazon Smile works at https://smile.amazon.com/gp/chpf/about/ref=smi_se_rspo_laas_aas. My shopping is donating to my favorite charity, Canines for Independence at no cost to me. Awesome!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: I had heard people raving about DeLonghi home espresso makers before, so I jumped at the opportunity to grab one when it arose. A few years ago, I started working from home, and I got in the habit of going to Starbucks every morning to have a few minutes of human interaction before returning to my home office. By early August, I realized I had spent over $900 year to date on coffee, decided it needed to stop, and picked up a Keurig. It saved me a ton of money, but it wasn't nearly as good as espresso drinks. Enter the DeLonghi!Size/Space: First thing's first - before you jump in and order one yourself, figure out if you have anywhere you can put it! The unit itself is about 16" wide, 16" deep (with power cord), and 17-1/2" high. The height is a big one, because the standard clearance from kitchen countertops to cupboards is 18" - however, if the kitchen has been remodeled, the counter tops may have been upgraded to a thicker surface than older materials - I found my cupboards were only 17-1/4 to 17-1/2" above the countertops, and it wasn't possible to slide this under the cupboards, so I had to find a new home. Now, even if you DID put it under the cupboards, you may find that you don't have sufficient access to remove the water reservoir on the back or access the bean hopper on top without pulling the unit out, which can be a little bit challenging in its own right. Height issues aside, you should be aware of the width - it's about 16" wide total, but you can't sandwich this right up against a wall - you need clearance on BOTH. I'd say you need about 3-4" minimum on either side to operate the tamper (left) and the knob for the steam wand (right). Minimum, I'd say you need 20" of space, or it needs to be next to items on the counter that are shorter than the knobs (I have mine on one edge of the counter, and a knife block next to the machine that is short enough to easily operate the knob and steam wand)Setup: Initially, it can be a little challenging to figure out how to use it, but after doing it once, it's easy. Fill the Reservoir in back (filtered water recommended), Fill the bean hopper with your preferred espresso beans and turn the base of the hopper to the preferred grind setting (1-8, the guide that came with the machine suggested about a 4 for a medium roast which was a very good starting point). Turn the unit on with the Portafilter detached. The Portafilter has interchangeable single shot or double shot baskets - putting the basket in the first time is a little difficult because the springs are new, give it a good press/smack with your palm. Now, *IF* you're making a double shot, choose the "x2" button on the face of the machine first. Choose your extraction temperature on the face - it's indicated with 3 horizontal bars, and pressing the button cycles between 1, 2 and 3 bars - DeLonghi recommends 2 bars for Medium Roast beans. Finally, you'll have to adjust the "dose" (amount of ground beans) with a dial. You may need to waste some grind/beans the first time to get it right - start low and adjust the dose until, when tamped, the grind is even with the stamped ring inside the portafilter basket (adjusted for both single and double shot baskets)Daily use: Once you get that set up above dialed in, it's pretty easy - turn the machine on, insert the Portafilter - the machine will automatically grind the beans into the filter. Once the grind is finished, the machine will flash the tamping indicator to let you know to pull the arm to tamp the grind - just pull the arm to the indicated full pull line, and you're set. Remove the portafilter and insert it into the brew head, set your cup/mug under it, and press the "Ok" button (could have been called start). You'll have espresso within about 60 seconds of turning the machine on. I had a perfect shot the very first time I used the machine, and I was shocked. I worked at a Starbucks 25 years ago, and I vividly remember needing to adjust my tamping pressure a few times nearly every time I started a shift until I had it right. Now that I've been using this about 2 weeks, I continue to adjust a little, but I haven't yet had anything that resembled a *bad* shot - just ranging from good to perfect.Steaming: This is one area where I'm not thrilled with the machine. The dial on the right hand side of the machine has two settings - on or off. You turn the dial all the way until it clicks to start the steam, and then you click it off to stop, and starting the steam isn't instant - it builds pressure before releasing it. I would have preferred the knob work as an adjustable valve to control the flow. The other thing I don't love about the wand is that it is TOO vertical. 17.5° from vertical is as far as you can move it, so it's not as easy as I'd like to get a good vortex in the pitcher to incorporate the foam. I was able to adjust to this after a couple days, so if you get your technique down, it works fine. I think a small change to the wand would make this much nicer though.Side note: get yourself a clip-on dial thermometer for your pitcher for steaming milk. Using a thermometer will keep you from scorching your milk. They can be found, with clip, for as little as $9 - but it may be worth spending a few dollars more. This is a detail that I think DeLonghi is missing - it would be great if they included a clip with thermometer properly sized/fit for the included pitcher - the thermometer I bought is a bit long for my liking.Cleaning: This is perhaps the area that can be burdensome - I'm pretty much the only one drinking espresso in the house (unless my mother-in-law is visiting), so it can be a little time consuming to clean the Portafilter, Pitcher, and Steam Wand every morning after making myself a latté - but all told, the process takes 5 minutes - less time than stopping in a coffee shop, and much less once you factor in time getting there and back.Final Verdict: While the size of this machine caused some early consternation, once I found a home for it, I quickly grew to enjoy it. Early on, I doubted that I'd use it daily, but there's only been one day since setting it up that I didn't use it - and that was only because I woke up to a colossal work disaster that left no time for even the smallest of luxuries. The quality of the espresso has far exceeded my expectations! As for time and convenience, a few years ago I dated someone with a Nespresso machine - and I don't think there's a whole lot of time savings in using the Nespresso versus using this to make proper espresso - using the Nespresso pods probably saves 1-2 minutes, and most of that is really in clean-up.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: This makes the best tasting espresso I’ve ever had. Seriously perfect. Like, I almost cry with the first sip every. single. time. I also love the bean hopper and how easy the tamping process is with this. There are many challenges, however, with the rest of the machine. The first being that it draws so much amperage, that it flips the circuit almost every time I use it. We live in a new custom home with a brand new electric system. From the street, to the box, to the wiring. I’ve never had a breaker trip. Even when using multiple large appliances at the same time. It’s a pain. Next disappointment is the steam/wand. It’s really lame. It doesn’t build much steam power and it “pulses” the steam. It takes forever to froth milk. The wand doesn’t have a big enough range of motion to hold a bigger size pitcher comfortably. I ended up purchasing a countertop milk frother that is <<chef’s kiss!>> But again, how stupid that I need an additional step. The last thing is the interface. It’s totally and needlessly complicated. Please just give me 2 shots of espresso, an option for hot water after my shots are pulled and froth the milk quickly and creamy. I don’t want 5 additional and irrelevant buttons and lights to blink at me every morning, pre-coffee. Overall, I think this machine is trying to do too much so it fails to do the 1 thing perfectly. For the price of this machine, that’s a big bummer. But the espresso it makes, did I mention how incredible it tastes???

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Professional Results without Needing Professional Technique
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   This De'Longhi La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine is well made and a bit heavy because it is solid. The assembly is very minimal. There are two manuals and both must be referred to because the more colorful one doesn't have all the parts identified. Some of the better features include the filter holder assembly which has a long handle on it and locks into place and automatically initiates the grinding of the beans in the hopper. The big advantage is that when it locks into place, there is no place for ground coffee to fall out and make a mess. Also, the tamper is built in and the coffee is precisely tamped and since the tamping takes place with no place for the coffee to fall out, again there is no coffee ground mess. One can make either coffee or espresso with this machine.  In my pictures you can see one cup with coffee and the other with espresso.  The grind of the beans can be adjusted allowing for different strength and smoothness. The frothier can be set to specific settings so the cup does not have to be moved around to get the desired results. The espresso maker can be set to self clean with steaming hot water. Excess water runs down into the tray and a red plastic pieces floats up through the grill to show you when it is time to empty the water out of the tray. This machine gives professional results without having to have professional technique. This is the most user friendly espresso machine I have ever operated.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Quality is horrible and it makes a decent shot but not worth the money
Review Description: I bought this machine from a different supplier but wanted to leave a review so you can get a good idea of what you re going to be dealing with if you purchase this.First thing I noticed is the quality of the machine. Parts of the machine are literally flimsy plastic. If you can see this from the outside, I can only imagine how much plastic is on the inside of this machine. The tamper is PLASTIC, the lid on the grinder is PLASTIC and the outside of the machine dents easily and is just plain CHEAP. It’s all a facade! After spending $800 on a machine you would think they can spring for materials that are more than aluminum and plastic!After 2 months of daily use (maybe 3 or 4 shots a day) it started leaking from the spout that goes into the drip tray. I would wake up to a puddle of water every morning. In addition... The water doesn’t get hot enough, the grinder is no where near the quality that it needs to be to make the kind of espresso that you think you are paying for. Bottom line is there is always something wrong with this machine and no one could ever figure out what it is with those cryptic symbols they have popping up! DO NOT BUY THIS MACHINE!

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: This is a beautiful espresso machine and I love the way it looks in our kitchen. Other coffee makers and espresso makers that we had were definitely not this pretty.While it is a beautiful machine it does not come without a learning curve, dont expect to press a button out of the box and have a delicious coffee.We have been using this for a few weeks now and it has taken a few tries to get our cup of the coffee the way we like it. It was slightly challenging but we have never had a machine like this either. You will need to learn the knobs and how they function with your preferences (espresso, americano etc). I think the hardest part was figuring out how many beans and how not to overfill the tamper. It takes less than a minute to make a delicious cup! You can also just dispense hot water which is super nice for a quick cup of tea.But once you get it down it is the best cup of coffee or espresso ever - like your own cafe! I know for my husband and I this will save us money in the long run.I do recommend buying quality beans and filtered water but chances are if you are considering this machine you would do that anyway.You also need to keep this machine clean and clean it regularly to keep it performing best.From start to finish - opening the box to cleaning the machine to my first cup took about 45 minutes - and it was time well spent. I highly recommend this machine and am looking forward to making some great coffee and espresso.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Description: Bought the De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso EC9335M sometime 2018.  A $6 reed switch used to determine water level recently stopped working, which prohibits the machine from functioning.  Found the part online and took things apart since the warranty was past.  This over eight hundred dollar machine is laden with plastic, rubber, and inexpensive electronics inside.  Looking at the materials used I can't help but wonder what kind of chemicals leach into my coffee with every use of this machine.  Anyone else having water sensor issues make sure the magnetic float inside the reservoir is not stuck down when full.  If not then likely the reed switch has gone bad like mine.  Tear down is somewhat complex, parts are cheap.  About 4 hour and thirty bucks DIY repair job or another two hundred for pro repair.  Health and value reasons cannot recommend this product.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Be your own barista for real!
Review Description: This is one beautiful piece of machinery and unless you have been a barista and worked a professional machine similar to this, there will be a bit of a learning curve to create that perfect latte or espresso.  Make sure you have some special coffee beans on hand when this machine arrives at your door so you can dive right in and learn to create the drink of your dreams!  Also, this is a fairly large machine so do think about where it will sit in the kitchen or dining room as it is heavy and not something that can be easily moved regularly.  One last note, the warranty on this machine is exceptional - be sure to fill out the paperwork!  We never expect anything to happen, but just in case, if the warranty has been activated, the machine is covered and the company will be there to stand by their product.  This is definitely worth it if you are looking for a top of the line latte/espresso machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Keep your La Specialista. A much better all around experience than Breville
Review Description: My husband bought this for my 65th birthday.  I used it a lot and really enjoyed the espresso.  I did not like the fact that the hopper was stationery.  If you put too much coffee in, you had to grind it because you aren't supposed to leave the coffee in. That before I realized I could weigh it.  I returned it and bought the Breville Barista Express. I made a BIG mistake. I watched videos of people who complained that you couldn't use a single walled filter. So I returned the LaSpecialista and guess what, I can't make a good cup of Espresso with the single-walled filter no matter what with the Barista Express.  What a dope I am. The La Specialista is a much nicer machine.  The tamper, the rack to make the espresso cup closer to the dispenser which makes for less splashing.And this is why I should not have returned the LaSpecialista. DeLonghi's customer service is fantastic and Breville doesn't have customer service. I have waited on the phone twice for 4+hours both times. I mean really and have never gotten a response. Never. Now my descaling process does not work. My poor husband wasted all that money on a machine that I will never be able to get serviced.

Product Title: De'Longhi La Specialista Espresso Machine with Sensor Grinder, Dual Heating System, Advanced Latte System & Hot Water Spout for Americano Coffee or Tea, Stainless Steel, EC9335M
Review Title: Skip the gourmet coffeeshop and make your own drinks at home!
Review Description: My very first espresso maker about 20 years ago was a DeLonghi - It was quite basic but did the job well. After many years of faithful service, my replacement Gaggia gave up, so I was looking for an espresso machine that could provide ample pressure (and a grinder). Upon unboxing, I was impressed by the solid build quality and overall looks of the La Specialista; is it gorgeous on the countertop and has a bit of a 1950s vibe to it.Pros: Two independent heating systems (one for milk, one for coffee).  You can tamp directly in the filter holder.  The advanced latte system lets you choose between flat (hot milk only) or foam. It has three presets for espresso, Americano, and coffee.Be sure to read the instruction manual before attempting setup. It's worth watching all the DeLonghi how-to videos on YouTube first before setting up for the first time (especially about using the built-in grinder as this is my first machine that has one, and there's definitely a bit of a learning curve).  And you may want to experiment with the coffee bean grinder (any whole coffee beans will work; it doesn't have to be "espresso" blend!) to find the grind that's best for you.This is like upgrading to a Ferrari; absolute beauty! I loved the quick startup (my previous Gaggia took about 10 minutes to prime) and the quality of the crema / coffee (if you are a fan of flavored drinks, you can also make your own mochas or add flavored syrups; I loved the fact that this makes fantastic flat whites). Absolutely gorgeous foam, too.Overall, I'm absolutely thrilled with the La Specialista and look forward to many years of excellent lattes and cappuccinos!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: I love my espresso and lattes, hope this holds up.
Review Description: Eight Month Update:  Average two lattes a day, keeping it clean and rinsing the steam wand religiously, not a hitch yet.  Just did my second descaling, no problems.  Still very happy and my wife loves every cup I make for her (of course she does!).  No leakage, remember to keep the portafilter inserts clean!Original review: This is a nice looking machine, and after three weeks I cannot say it has any problems at all.  I dialed in the grind (set at 2 and about 5/8 of full dial setting) and used some 20 dollar Lavazza Blu/Oro beans, the coffee was amazing.  The crema is quite good, it would be better if the head was heated by water like others, but run a hot water preheat before you start brewing.  Try to warm the cup too, will hold the crema longer.  For the price, this is quite good.  The steam heater works well, if you put an inch and a half of milk in the provided pitcher, the sixty second steam cycle is sufficient, but use a thermometer anyway, it is best gage of readiness and they cost about 10 bucks with the clip.  I believe cleaning is most important thing about these machines, blow out the steam tube, clean the steam wand, disassemble it and wipe the rubber tube after you're done with it for the time of day.  Use filtered water, this is not a FAEMA or professional machine, it will help you keep the pump and piping cleaner longer.  Don't let coffee get stale in the hopper, just put what you need for a few days at most.  Clean between the two disks of the portafilter, and rinse it out too.One thing that happened once is that a suction developed in the water line, not sure but seems like a check or stop valve got cycled by an air bubble.  I stopped the cycle when the trouble lights appeared, lifted and reseated the tank, and it burped when I restarted the cycle.  D'longhi should look into that, it might be a reason others have had problems with the water-out lights coming on.All said, having this quality of espresso at home is a wonderful thing, beats starbucks by a long shot.  If you want flavorings look up Torani syrups, I bought some for an occasional twist when I want it.  I will update if I have any other news on my experiences with this machine.  I think it is a good purchase so far.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have been using home espresso machines for 8 years. I mainly make lattes and americanos with the occasional cappuccino. I think Starbucks drinks are just ok, not good or great.  I purchased this De'Longhi La Specialista to replace a Breville 870. The advertised La Specialista dimensions don't accurately indicate just how big this machine is. With the grinder hopper attached, the actual height is about 17.5 inches and with the poorly designed power cord attached the depth is 16 inches. Lots of counter space is needed. The design of the built in tamper and grinder chute make getting the correct grind and tamp more difficult than necessary due to not being able to see how much coffee is being dispensed and feeling the tamp pressure. This process is an important part of pulling a good espresso shot. Only pressurized filters are provided. Once the grind and tamp are set as best as possible the resulting shots are only mediocre. The pucks are a mess, often not releasing from the filter causing the filter to drop out of the portafilter into the knock box and the puck needing to be scooped out of the filter.  The water reservoir is hidden on the sides so the water level can only be seen from the back of the machine. The steam wand is actually comprised of two pieces and milk goes up into the tubes requiring both pieces be removed and cleaned after each use. This is an easy process but I question how well the wand will hold up over time with this daily removal. Beans must be removed from the hopper prior to removing the hopper as there is no closing mechanism to hold the beans in the hopper. These issues are unacceptable for a machine at this price point. Now the pros; this is a good looking machine and is quiet, the steam wand does work well, easily frothing milk, and the warm up time is very quick. This machine makes better coffee drinks than a drip or pod coffee maker but isn't as good as other options in this price range. I returned mine and purchased another 870.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Grinder stopped working on day 5…. Ended up buying a Breville for significantly more money.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The bean grinder does not work after a month. The frothing wand makes our milk taste like metal. This is definitely not worth your money. I took a chance on buying this machine and literally the tamp and brewing espresso is the only thing that works. You cannot brew more than 2 shots at a time because of the automatic shut off. Would not buy again ever. Not happy with my purchase.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Disappointed in De'Longhi La Speialista Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought the Specialista after retiring my Brevile Dual Boiler due to a failed pump (after five years of use) because I wanted a built-in grinder and tamper. The Specialista is attractive and seems well-made. However, I am disappointed in the Specialista in several ways and regret buying it instead of having my Breville fixed:1. The setting of the grinder is not consistent and difficult to adjust, especially at the finest grind settings.2. The milk foamer (expander) does not make higher density foam that I was used to with the Breville (manual) steamer and it is too easy to bump the wand into its "flat" setting3. The portaflter is deep and not very wide so I have great difficulty emptying the used grounds into a "bang box." I have to use a tool every time; which is very messy. I never had that problem with the Breville portafilter with its different aspect ratio.4. The very small holes in the portafilter tend to get clogged and they are difficult to clean.5. The water reservoir capacity is marginal, requiring filling more often than I'm used to with the Breville.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: We love our espresso maker but...
Review Description: Who doesn’t like espresso? When I ordered this product in February of this year, I thought I knew quite a bit about coffee. I had experimented with several different coffee making devices but here was a product that made actual espresso, that ground the coffee to the correct size, preheated the water to the correct temperature, forced the water through the specialized portafilter at the appropriate pressure to insure proper extraction to make  delicious, coffee house style espresso. What’s not to love?Namely, the descaling process. We have had this unit for about 3.25 months and have descaled it twice. Descaling is a process that removes hard water mineral build up from the sensitive components inside the espresso maker. Our neighbor has this same unit and has had it for several months and has not yet been required to descale it.  We use filtered water only in our unit so I am not entirely sure what’s causing the issue.Other than that, we love our espresso maker. It does what it claims and does it well.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Average espresso...until it broke 2 months later
Review Description: Switched from a Breville to the De’Longhi. It’s more automated and takes less than 5 seconds to start steaming milk which is great.After 2 months of use, the espresso machine started to leak unfortunately (being told it’s a problem with recently manufactured units).Amazon won’t replace it since it’s been more than a month and De’Longhi’s support is a nightmare.  Had to email them 4 times after doing a video call to show the issue.  They are sending a box to ship the unit back - will take 3 weeks to get it back to me.  No advance replacement was offered.  For a unit that I just bought, I wasn’t expecting to be without it for such a long time.  Will definitely not purchase from De’Longhi again.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: False advertising; bad product all around
Review Description: The La Specialista espresso machine is advertised as a "double boiler" machine.  It doesn't operate that way.  You cannot steam milk while the machine is brewing an espresso.  The "smart tamping" system doesn't work well.  I set this unit is to  grinding setting for the finest coffee, and yet it is still very coarse - so much that the pressure never builds up.  Oh, and the DeLonghi knock-out box, which I bought separately, is also useless.  Sending it back.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: As quick and easy as a pod machine
Review Description: I read several online magazine reviews of different espresso machines, and this one ranked as one of the best. I ended up choosing this over a similar Breville machine because of the additional hot water spout. I was initially apprehensive about the price, but now I don't know how I waited so long to get one of these. The only problem now is that I want to drink coffee all day!The machine is super easy to use, yet it's fun to operate and you feel like a professional barista. You get your coffee as fast as you would from a pod machine, but it tastes like you got it at a coffee shop. Once the machine is set up (not difficult), brewing a coffee is as simple as:1. Attach the filter to the grinder. The correct amount of beans will grind automatically.2. Tamp the grounds with the lever.3. Attach the filter to the brewer and place a cup underneath.4. Select your drink and hit OK.There are some great features that make it easy to create the full range of coffee shop drinks:* You can easily grind and brew 1 or 2 shots. Filters are provided for both sizes.* You can select espresso, Americano (espresso + hot water), or "coffee" (AKA a lungo), and the machine applies the correct amount of water and brewing time.* A separate button will provide hot water only, making this the easiest way to brew tea.* There is a wand that can froth or steam milk so you can make cappuccinos and lattes.I initially thought the coffee was not hot enough, but I checked the manual and found a setting to use a higher water temperature. There is also a bit of trial and error to set the grinder to get exactly the right "dosage" of grounds per shot, but once you have that dialed in, you don't have to worry about it again for a long time.In conclusion, this is a great machine and I'm so glad I bought it. I can think of very few purchases where I was just as excited to use the thing weeks after I got it, and this is one of them.PS. If you ever see "Amazon Warehouse" selling one at a deep discount, go for it. I got a $300 markdown because one corner of the shipping box was slightly dented. The machine itself was pristine!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Let me just say this, I originally ordered the Breville Barista Express Espresso Machine and a few minutes after ordering that machine from a different retailer, I stumbled across the info link for this beautiful muscular machine. I ordered it because it has 2 options the Breville doesn't offer, function to provide hot water to make tea and a recipe choice to make an Americano sized drink. Those 2 functions sold me and I ordered this machine and am so happy i did. I love looking at it and I have also did several demo videos for my friends and family members who I can't wait to serve up a fresh cup of espresso or coffee. I also like that i can disable the automatic coffee grind feature so that i can tamp already possessed coffee grinds to use in the machine and make espresso and other drinks. This is a fun machine to use and makes a statement in your space.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: There are some positive reviews here, but I beleive they come from people who do not have any experience with espresso machines. I think DeLonghi tried to compete with Breville all-in-one machine and this attempt failed. They tried to couple their EC680M cheap machine with a grinder and the grinder is terrible. First, you need to grind always to the finest setting, and it is not fine enough. The beverage is sour (underextracted). the grinder has only 6 settings (a joke? only 6?) and they are all useless, since you need to set it to 1. And the espresso is not good. They tried to fix this problem by replacing regular baskets with pressurized baskets (they are more forgiving), but it means it is NOT espresso. Pressurized = bad. The tamper is a joke.When you brew espresso, the gauge in front of the machine NEVER shows the optimal zone. Never! Watch some youtube videos, never. I saw just one video, where the zone shown was optimal, but the guy used much more beans, filling the basket well above the limit.Verdict: it is not just a machine that is not as good as the others. The whole design is flawed, the machine simply does not work. I got it as a gift to friends in Taipei, so I cannot ship from there and  return.$799 just wasted. DeLonghi, have conscience! Return money! And fire all the designers.Google, there is a video, where a guy in France found a solution. Forget the internal grinder, and buy a separate grinder, nonpressurized basket, tamper and distributor, and use only 1/2 of La Specialista. A shame.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Only 6 weeks of usage and it's already broken. Called CS and they couldn't/didn't resolve. And now I can't return it either. Don't buy a DeLonghi product. They don't have the infrastructure to deal with.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Our unit displayed a general alarm error and upon contacting DeLonghi, I was told I would have to send the unit back for repair. It took awhile for me to receive the shipping label and the return box. I tracked the package and was told during my initial call, the machine would be sent back within 24-48 hours of receipt.I called to get an update a couple days later. I was provided a tracking number and told it had been shipped back to me.It ships via FedEx ground, so it took awhile to send/receive the unit.Upon receiving the unit, it was it noted the heating unit had been replaced.  While inspecting the returned unit, I noticed it came back with two small dents.A few days after receiving the unit it began to get another error light (appliance is too hot). I contacted customer support who asked for a video of the error. I was told the device was defective, but they would need to inspect it first, before a replacement could be given.Luckily I kept the shipping box, but it took three days for me to get a shipping label. So now we’re left without the machine for a second time.6/4: UPDATEReceived our third unit. This one is a certified refurbished one to replace the new one we bought that didn’t last very long. I can’t say if it works or not, as the water tank it was shipped with is cracked and broken .... DeLonghi is closed, so I’ll have to call tomorrow.Update: Our certified refurbished machine no longer works. It turns on and then shuts off. Numerous calls to Delonghi with promises of call backs which never came. Finally was able to get them to agree to refund me my money. Although they say it can take 4-6 weeks. I was offered a brand new replacement machine, but their lack of follow through and going through three returns isn’t worth it.I’d stay away from this machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Purchased machine mid November when I was able to get it at $100 off.  Arrived quickly and all was well as I learned how the machine worked which, truth be told, took a bit of a learning curve. I sough help from De'Longhi because it was almost impossible to get the puck out of the filter holder.  I eventually learned to live with that.  I reduced the coffee amount and slightly increased the grind and that helped some but it still was difficult.  Then, the grinder stopped working.  I worked with De'Longhi to resolve and was unable to get it working.  At this point I was told they would send me a box so I could return it and they would fix it and send it back to me.  I had missed Christmas Eve and Christmas day coffee with my family and was unhappy at the prospect of weeks without my espresso machine.  So, I called Amazon on Friday, explained my situation, and had a new machine on my doorstep Monday morning!  Technically, my 30 day Amazon return window had closed, but after hearing my story, customer service came through!In the meantime, the DeLonghi box never arrived.  I did get a phone call from them about a week after I received my new machine telling me how sorry they were that my problem had fallen through a crack in the system.  So, I guess I should be hopeful that the 2 year warranty on the machine will be honored.  Still, cant thank Amazon enough.BTW:  the new machine is amazing.  Makes amazing espresso (for me) and Americanos (for my husband) and the milk frother is outstanding.  Once you have it down, it can't be beat!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: READ CAREFULLY!!!Everything about this unit is fantastic. BEWARE!! If your looking for a plug and play unit that needs no adjustments then this is NOT the unit for you. It takes time to dial in and when you clean it or even change beans you have to readjust. It’s not a problem for us as we have the time to do so. We have had zero issues and use it very frequently. I definitely recommend this unit and it’s very easy to use once it’s dialed in.As people have stated the water low light will come on when you first get it, even if the water tank is full. All you have to do is READ the directions and prime the system. I am amused by the amount of people who send this unit back when all they have to do is read the directions. P!! A YEAR LATER UPDATE!!  Well after just about daily use of this unit, we have had it for a year and still have no issues with this unit.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Update:After about 3 months of use, it started having issues:Water is leaking at random times, emptying the whole container through the drip trayThe tank empty light would come on and not go away, even when you fill the tankoften times pressure is not high enough to even push the liquid through the coffee grounds.Overall pretty disappointed. Called the manufacturer a few times, they ignored me for some time, now they want me to send it in to repair it, which could take weeks.I wish I could return it----------------------------This is a great machine, everything works as advertised. It took a bit of time ant tries until I got the desired coffee, but once you get it right it works flawlessly.You will get the user manual and there are plenty of videos on youtube to help you set it up and understand what's what.It's really easy to set it up, it took me less than 10 minutes from opening the box to making the first coffee. Make sure the left-most dial is set to 1/3 of the way. Initially I had it all the way left, which means you fill it and tamp it yourself.I am using Illy Classic Whole Bean coffee and it tastes heavenly.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Excellent product that could use a few enhancements - REVISED
Review Description: Would love to see a better seal on the bean hopper and a larger water tank, but the unit makes great flavorful coffee.  it is easy to clean and looks good.  The footprint is not too bad and my wife will maybe let me bring it in the house instead of my office.  I think I'll keep it close to me. :)Update:  Two weeks after setting this up and only a handful of coffees I started noticing that the countertop had water on it after use.  At first, I thought it was from cleaning up around the unit or it settling in.  Boy was I wrong.  This unit leaks a significant amount of water all the time, but its haphazard as to when.There is definitely a design flaw someplace. I notice it most after doing a couple of cups back to back, but it can also happen with a single cup.  I typically will froth some milk and then make a couple of cups of Americano to use with the milk.  If I stop the Americano short of the full cycle or stop the frothing after the machine warms up, I notice the water the most.  Typically right after shutting off the cycle is when water will come during out the left side.  I put a paper towel down to show it in the attached photo.  This photo was taken mid water dump.  By the time it finishes, the towel is completely wet.I contacted Delonghi and they said it was a bad batch of drip drays that didn't have the proper hole so they shipped me a replacement drip tray.  The whole process of reporting and getting the new drip tray took months thanks to the COVID situation, which I understand.  However; when the new drip tray arrived, the problem persisted.  Now they want me to ship the unit back to them, go without a coffee maker for perhaps months and then wait to get back a unit that hopefully works.  I suspect this is more a design flaw than a lemon so I don't have high expectations.  Why not send me a new unit and then see?Very disappointed in what I thought was a premium band.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I purchased for Christmas 2019. We have pretty much made 2 cups of Americano every days since, with some cappuccinos and espressos. I love the built in tamper, keeps the mess off the counter. It's very easy to use. Heats up faster than a Kurig.It really is a good machine. Here are some things De'Longhi could to to make it fantstic.1. Give it a few more grind settings. I pretty much keep mine at 5. Only a few times with some very fresh roasted beans have I had to turn it down to 3 or 4. Never used 1-2.2. Give a way to grind just a tad more coffe not a measured dose.3. Suppy a non pressure basket to allow some experiments.Lastly, My grinder crapped out. A small rock was in the coffee beans and stripped some gears out( assume) in the inner workings. I called customer support and they are shipping me a box to return and will fix or replace. Very happy so far with Their customer service.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: get what you pay for in this model
Review Description: I bought this so my wife could feel like she was in Paris again each time she had a cup of cappuccino. 100% delivery on the feeling. If you make coffee by the pot the preparation of coffee using this machine  will change your whole routine, buying habits and time. First you quit using pre ground coffee and you buy whole bean coffee. If you use creamer that stops too, you change to milk. And you find a world of flavoring syrup you will end up using every day to make your Joe. Second you make it by the cup instead the pot. Third it takes 6-15 minutes per cup depending upon how elaborate the preparation. Fourth you have to go through a cleaning process once a month. Fifth you are spending $700 plus to get a contraption that takes up about 3.5 to 4 square feet of counter space.As for this machine in particular we researched and found it to have everything we thought we needed for our first espresso machine. It has been a great piece of equipment. We installed a reverse osmosis unit under our sink to avoid using our local hard tap water ($200). If you have hard tap water use bottled or RO water to extend the life of the machine to avoid scale build up. We have owned it six months and one day it began draining the water from the reservoir into the drip tray. I called The manufacturer and they said there was a new tray design that fixed the problem and said they would send one out in two weeks. A month later we are still waiting for the replacement tray. Machine still works but we have to remove the drip tray to avoid the water tank from being drained into the drip tray.A good purchase from a good company that is slow like any big company....and it still feel like Paris.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: What initially attracted me to this device was it's Italian made and they take their coffee seriously along with the integrated grinder and tamper. I know a few people who have machines and the grounds make a mess on the counter top. Purchased in August 2019 with three repairs so far so just not a very reliable product.The good: When it works it brews a really nice coffee with nice crema. The integrated grinder and tamper work well.The bad: It breaks quite frequently. The first two times it was under warranty so we got to send it back for free. The first break was a loss of pressure in the device when making a coffee. This decreased the volume output and removed the nice crema from the top. The second time we got a refurbished machine which lasted another six months. Broken thankfully just before the warranty period ended. Most recently the steamer has malfunctioned so instead of frothing milk it only heats the milk. The other major issue with the steamer is instead of a wand they give you a nozzle which lets you change the amount of air allowed to mix with the steam. Well milk gets up the nozzle and really requires taking it off daily and cleaning it. Consider that vs a wand where you only need to turn on the steam function and it clears the line from any milk. I have forgotten to on some days in a hurry and the next find curdled milk rising to the top of my coffee the next.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Made the plunge into the “I envy them” espresso machine crowd.  Now I am on the inside looking out .Have a Breville Nespresso Creatista - it has been great - but i wanted to get back to using coffee beans instead of pods.  Nespresso makes the best pods, but $.80 to $1 each pod adds up quick when you need two at a time for strength. I tried the pods where you can used your own grounds, but those don’t produce as well.I roast my own beans and love to experiment with different roasts and coffee beans (honey, pea-berry, wood fire roasted, ....)  which using pods I wasn’t getting to do.I was going to go with Breville Barista, I was waiting for a deal that wasn’t a scam.  And then this machine came along.  After research and comparison videos , it seemed better - due to the built in tamping arm and advanced milk frothing feature. Being a cappuccino man - the froth is important. Would be great if it had the temperature sensor of the Breville creaista - but a digital thermometer will do as work around.Got it all unboxed, cleaned, and produced  a cappuccino within 30 mins, using quick start. Took another 30 mins and read the manual and made a second cappuccino. Suggest reading manual as it has the info on how to change defaults and that you need to do multiple rinses not just one.Get a digital thermometer and a tamp box to go with it.Hope yours gets delivered before 7pm as you maybe wired until late in the night - with the caffeine from the test runs.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Such a beautiful machine...a true kitchen piece of art!!!!
Review Description: This is part one I will do an update in a month or so. Sep 28, 2019 I just unboxed my Specialista and I am without words. Its heavy. Its steel. Its gorgeous. I mean I read reviews and did my homework on a machine for I don't even know how long. I was set for a long time on the Breville Barista Express for look and price until I fond the DeLonghi La Specialista it all changed and I even coughed up an extra $100 ($599).
