Reviews were off the charts and espresso results were consistent and inspiring. So simple to set up but hard to keep clean. Every fingerprint is see so you will be constantly wiping it down to keep your baby smiling all day lol.Today 9/29/19 I am going to try to make my first Iced Espresso. I was playing with features and the hot water feature heats it up almost to commercial grade. My biggest thing from making coffee at home is that it doesn't get as hot during the brewing cycle. Already before I even pulled my first shot the water itself was scolding. Ok so my first espresso shot was an absolute fun disaster. OMG you are gonna have fun but waste alot of coffee so don't even think about splurging on an expensive bag keep 2 things in mind: 1) espresso is coffee but supposedly roasted longer and 2) it takes time to perfect the complex nature of expresso or exotic coffees that use other technique that regular brewing lacks.I will be back with an update after I have had a little more experience and see how this machine holds up.*******Update 10/25/19*********This machine is so much fun and delivers cafe quality espresso drinks. Made my first iced caramel latte that I usually pay over $4 for and mine tasted just as good. Super fun and I feel like a barista a few times a week and definitely on weekends. Hard to keep shiny stainless steel clean and it’s not really built to “wing” it on the fly. For example you can skip the built in tamper function if you want to press your own coffee which I want to do sometimes. The tamper light will flash but you can still move through the process. Also don’t try to steam your milk and drip your espresso doesn’t like that. I think it lost pressure I was worried for a minute. Otherwise it outperforms my expectations and a real conversation starter. It just looks so much better than the Breville.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is an excellent machine, not even considering that it is under $1K, it stands up to almost any machine as far as quality of espresso produced. This machine comes with an excellent start up guide which can be a little confusing to understand at first because it was written by Italians, lol. Hang in there!! After figuring out your dosing, grind, and temp settings, you will be enjoying FANTASTIC espresso in no time at all. Do keep in mind that when changing the grind settings, you have to change it WHILE THE GRINDER IS IN OPERATION. Failing to do this may damage the grinder.Frothing wand and hot water features work great as well, although just a little longer wait than I expected for these to achieve their goals.Don't wait, just buy this machine if you are in the market.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Firstly, this is a beautiful machine built with high quality material and fancy technology. Great for someone who wants to start making their own coffee without the skills and the mess. The bad: if you like more settings on your grinder this machine is not for you (6 settings) If you like to control of the tamping this machine is not for you (jackpot machine handle on the side!) If you don’t like pressurized portafilter this is not for you. If you like to make your own froth, you know it, not for you. This is a step above semi-automatic. I’d say you’re only in control of 25% of the work. Get a Breville Barista express if you want 50-60% control.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I don’t feel I can leave an accurate review of this product I am very excited to have received it however I have had it for an entire week and have had been able to make 0 cups of any kind of coffee. It will not pull any water I waited 40 minutes on customer service at the company so they could tell me to push the button at least 23 times to get the water pressure accurately pulling through the machine???So this weekend I plan to spend another 30 40 minutes on the telephone so someone can tell me to do something ridiculous lol.  I imagine I will need to take it to send it somewhere and praying for the amount of money that this thing cost that they replace the machine immediately lol  if I get a new machine and it works beautifully I will definitely come back and make an addition to my review!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: After watching 2 videos on how to set up your grinder and 4 tries on the machine i finally got it pouring the best coffee to date. its not noisy like others have said and its easy to maintain. i have been using it around 4 times a day although sometimes my inlaws visit for afternoon coffee and its used 2 or 3 more times than normal. no regrets so far and its worth every penny. Try lavazza super crema or espresso whole beans best tasting coffee.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Going from super automatic to semi love it!
Review Description: Our super automatic finally broke and decided to try this Semi automatic as we didn’t want to spend 2k on new super.Really happy with this machine- Here are some pros/cons highlights:- ProsLooks beautiful on our counterGrinder works great (even with oily dark beans)Tamping works greatFrother has been flawless (I use Half and half)Price point.Cons-Water tank in the back of the unit. I need to move the machine every time I fill. On the other hand where else would I go that wouldn’t change beauty of the machine.Unit height (doesn’t quite fit under our cabinets) we have towards the front of our counter top. Still looks great.If you do use dark oily beans you will get watery soupy puck. Not huge deal.If you switch beans you will need to dial in grind and volume again.Overall we love it and would buy again. I don’t see going back to super automatic.Hope this helps.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Takes a little practice, but well worth it!
Review Description: We got this as a gift for each other for Christmas. We LOVE it.The ONLY negative thing is it is not QUITE as simple as grind, tamp, brew. This is not your mom & dads Coffee maker (well... unless you are my kids). Make sure you set everything just right, and anything less than top shelf coffee beans will not work well, not all espresso is the same, we learned this the hard way when we decided to use up some of the "old' beans we had in the cabinet. (we thought we broke it. wouldn't brew right).However, Once you get used to it, you'll be making perfect espresso & coffee drinks every time.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great hybrid machine, we love it
Review Description: I used various espresso machines: a manual Gaggia Classic, a manual Delonghi and several fully-automatic ones from Delonghi and Siemens. There were two issues with the manual espresso machines: 1) The whole kitchen got messy no matter how often we cleaned 2) To get a consistent espresso shot in the morning rush was too difficult. Fully automatic ones were very convenient and kept our countertop clean, however they lacked flavor no matter what we tried. This Delonghi is a good hybrid. It is very easy to get consistent shots and our countertop stays clean. The machine will adjust the amount/granularity of the grind and will produce consistent shots. No learning curve. Highly recommended

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I've walked into my kitchen several times to water pouring onto my floor from this machine. Don't waste your time / money on this.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We purchased this espresso maker on Nov 7, 2019 and returned it on the 11th of Dec.  There were a few disappointments from the start, but we most likely would have accepted them, but when it started to leak all over my counter top, we returned it. We checked it over and made sure that the seal from the water dispenser was making contact, but it still leaked. Now for the disappointments. Although we had the grind value down to the very lowest, we could not get the pressure gauge to read in the acceptable area. The taste wasn't bad tho and the crema was pretty good. It was also good at making an Americano which my husband likes. One thing that really bugged me was the the milk steam only runs for one minute and then quits. The only way I could get the temperature up to 140 was by resetting the steam. It did froth well, but I never did get a hot latte.  The automatic tamper worked so well that it was almost impossible to get the used grinds out of it. Forget using the Knock Box. Also the cup warming feature is useless. We have since bought a Breville Barista Express machine and although it is certainly messier and cheaper I might ad,  so far I am very pleased with it.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I'm extremely satisfied with this product. It's so elegant, easy to use, and the perfect espresso machine for starters like me. It's my first espresso machine, I was using Moka pot before. I truly liked its design. And I truly like the Smart Tamping system - not perfect tamping but quite good one for such a convenient mechanism. And it wouldn't hurt Delonghi to send it with an espresso cup set :)Note: I might consider buying the newer version aka 9355 since the frother is not working as I expected, I would prefer to have a manual version. Because it's hard to clean this one and sometimes their prices are very close.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Paid for itself. Excellent espresso machine.
Review Description: This is what I have been looking for. I can make coffee in several ways with ease. They are consistently good. It is a lovely ritual. I grind the coffee beans, tamp, then brew. I froth my milk and add it to the coffee.I was hesitant to spend this much money on a coffee machine. I don’t often buy coffee at a specialty store, though I appreciate a good vanilla latte. I usually consume 2 cups of coffee a day. If I were to pay $5 per cup, at 2 cups a day, this machine pays for itself in two months.I am very happy with this machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Had been using a Breville Infuser machine until it expired.  This is the next level up in terms of features.  Bought it at a discount from the Amazon Warehouse with "minor cosmetic damage".  In this case it was a difficult to see small dent in the drip tray, so I consider it an excellent purchasing choice.The machine itself is simple to use.  I haven't quite got the combination of beans, grind and tamping pressure to where I want it - I think mostly the beans - but there is still time.Overall very please with my purchase.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Yes, but can it make coffee?
Review Description: Yes, it can!  Great machine.  A tad smaller footprint than I expected, but solid and well made.  Stainless exterior. Relatively easy to use (my first foray into this type of machine).  A lot of online videos really simplifies the learning.  Saw videos comparing this to the "B" brand.  I would still buy this.  For me, there are enough settings on here to really personalize the drinking experience, yet enough built-in/automatic settings so one does not need to became an expert barista.  For the math addicts, netting out coffee bean purchases against not buying k-cups, this machine will pay for itself (for me) in less than two (2) years.  Plus, there will still be over 1 year left of the 3-year warranty!  Impressive machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Not for someone who already has a quality grinder.  The port filter is a non-standard size, so normal tampers don't work.  The auto tamper over tamps even with the lightest pressure, so the pump struggles to get water through the grind.  By the tie a cup is drawn, it's cold.  Crema is weak, coffee doesn't taste very goo.  We are very experienced barisatas and have experimented with the settings.  We're trying to find a machine for our guest house and so far, nothing comes close to the quality and features of our Breville Dual Boiler.  Returning this one asap.  Next up:  Rancillo.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Good product but find a different seller, due to warranty issues, WITH UPDATE.
Review Description: Keep looking, don't get anything from this company or this seller. Here's why, or at least here's what happened to me. Within two months of getting this very nice, very expensive machine, the grinder stopped working. I tried to get a replacement from DeLonghi, but DeLonghi doesn't recognize this seller as an official retailer so they wouldn't honor my request for a replacement piece. The seller would replace or refund if I would mail them the machine back, which would have been super expensive. The machine is obviously heavy. At the time, I chose to live with the machine since it was still half working. Today, the entire machine stopped working. It turns on but won't do anything else. All of its functions have ceased to work. So, DeLonghi machines, no matter who you buy them from, are lemons. At least mine is. DeLonghi, the company, won't stand by their manufacturing. The seller here would not make refunds or replacements realistic and absolutely not easy. Amazon is at fault here too, in my opinion. They should not let unauthorized sellers sell anything that would jeopardize a return,  refund, or warranty. At all. Ever. That's just shady. I hope you find a great espresso machine from a reputable company.  My DeLonghi was great while it lasted but I'd never spend a dime on something that didn't even last 10 months. Good luck. UPDATE: One day after posting this review, I was contacted by DeLonghi and was told that they would indeed honor the warranty.  They provided me with a packing box and packing slip (at their expense) to ship my broken machine off to be repaired. Which it was!!! The machine was repaired and returned to me. I love my machine and the coffees it makes. I kinda wish they would have honored the warranty the first go-round, but at the end of the day, I am glad DeLonghi did the right thing.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: nightmare to set up and defective
Review Description: I purchased this expresso machine and was excited as i read many reviews as well as many videos on which unit to buy. i spent 3 and half hours trying to set this machine up after watching the youtube vieo on how to set this unit up i had to call there customer service agents and spoke to one agent who kept telling this part must be defective when it wasnt there just wanting a good explanation on how to probably install the hopper plazstic peiece that set in the grinder but the real problem was the little piece inside the grinder part of the hopper that wouldnt lock in which caused the whole machine to not work at all.. what a joke this is a brand new unit and comes defective. such a waste of time and energy. thank goodness for amazon return.my husband was dignosed with Cancer two days before christmas so it took time to focus on even trying to set this machine up. i will be returning this today. such a disappointment

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The coffee created is amazing!! The crema produced is heaven. I enjoy the coffee as much as any cafe I’ve been to, and I do it myself. I usually do the Americano them foam some sweetened creamer and mix it in. Heaven!!Here’s the cons...a couple times the porta filter has caused the pump not to work. Even with regular cleaning, the microscopic drain hole can get clogged which will back up the pump and not allow the hot water to come through.  Delonghi sent me another filter and it worked for awhile... then backed up again...I scrubbed the filter vigorously and it’s working again. I’m hoping that’s the only issue and that this machine lasts a decade or more because the coffee produced is to die for.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: This is a gift for a family member
Review Description: I received my expresso machine yesterday seems to work great have a little bit of a problem with water leaking around the basket but  I think it’s because it’s new and maybe the basket needs to seat I purchased one before and had to return it but I’m happy with this I will update in a week or so it’s going to my daughter as a gift

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: From a beginner’s point of view
Review Description: Written entirely by a espresso-maker novice. I am, however, quite the Starbucks lover. I am married to an ex-barista who is quite the snob about drinking coffee at home. I am not as picky, but I know a good cup of coffee when I have one in front of me. I figured between the two of our tastes and experiences that we could provide a well-rounded review. Setup was fairly simple. After yelling at my husband to read the instructions for the fifth time, it got cleaned & put together in about 20 minutes. This machine does not include the water softener filter so if you deal with hard water, plan to buy one in addition to the price of this machine. We’ve made two drinks so far and both have been amazing. We’ve made an iced caramel macchiato and a vanilla latte. The flavor is strong and brewed just right. Even for me, with no experience working an espresso machine, it was easy enough to figure out. Prep, brew, & clean up time took a total of 6 minutes from whole beans in the grinder to finished grinds in the trash. To compare to how much you’re spending on coffee already, when broken into daily payments over a year, it ends up being about $2.05. Way less than a grande or vente Starbucks drink price and according to the hubs way better in taste! I spent maybe $15 on Starbucks coffee beans, more almond milk, and some caramel drizzle that will last me over a month. Although it’s a lump sum in the beginning, you will be glad you made the investment. This machine is well worth it.UPDATE ON 8-11-19:I’m updating my review to add a few very important notes that I have learned since I posted my original review:1. Any coffee beans are “espresso” beans. This is probably basic knowledge to some, but I didn’t know that! I spent a good 30 minutes in publix looking for “espresso” beans. Lol.. live & learn.2. Watch all the YouTube videos! Making the perfect shot of espresso takes practice. I went to Costco & bought a big bag of beans and made about twenty shots just trying to perfect my skill!3. Only put the beans in the grinder before you go to make a cup. It makes for a much fresher tasting espresso.4. If you’re going to be making lots of espresso, invest in a good set of espresso glasses. I originally was using a stainless steel shot glass I had and my finger tips about burned off! I ordered JoyJolt double walled espresso glasses (the 2 oz ones) on Amazon and they have been a lovey addition to my morning espresso routine.5. The machine will stop grinding depending on where you turn the knob. I have found for a single shot of espresso, turning the grinder knob to the center and just a tad to the left that it makes the perfect amount for a great shot of espresso.6. The closer the espresso glass is to where the espresso is coming out is important! It creates a thicker level of crema.That’s about all I can think of right now. It truly is an amazing machine and I have enjoyed waking up knowing I get to go downstairs to this bad boy.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: EDITED TO SAY: $$$$ BUYER BEWARE!!!!! After only 5 months of very light use, my water sensor is broken. My water tank is full, but it is telling me to add water and I am unable to make coffee altogether. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!$$$  So much so that I deleted my initial 5 star review and reduced it to one star!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: If you are considering getting this machine... read on so you have a sense of what to expect.  If you have already, I sincerely hope your experience is better than ours.We have had this machine for about a year and a half.  About 4 months ago, the grinder stopped working.  It took me 40 min to get a hold of some one @ DeLonghi to get a repair (neve rmind online, where they promise a reply within 2 business days and I did not get any reply for over a month!).They did honor the 2 year warranty and repaired it at no charge... except that it took weeks to even get the box/paper work to send it to them and a couple of weeks to get it back (the latter, honestly, I was ok with).We have had it back now for about a month... and this morning it stopped working... again!  Now the computer thinks the water tank is empty (it is not, and we have inserted/re-inserted the tank several times), and wants to run the set up program (which we have run 4-5 times already)... to no avail!I am incredibly frustrated!  This was not a cheap item.  This was $800 and I would have expected better quality and better customer service.  I am at a loss. I was hoping for a better experience.  Now, I am back to my trusty coffee pot on the stove... until I figure something out.Still here are some comments I have for you to consider about the machine itself.What I love...It is relatively easy to set up and use... almost foolproof!It heats up quicklyIt is quieter than othersLots of features to make different drinks easilyFoams milk like a dreamThe tamping feature is really cool!  It helps control the mess and keep things tidy!But...There are several design “flaws”  you should be aware of...It is a tall machine... we have it under the upper cabinets and to get it in and out we have to take off the coffee bean hopper lidI absolutely dislike the fact you cannot take the hopper off when it is full of beans.  So, you are “stuck” with whatever beans you put in.  Other machines I have had lock the beans in and you can remove the hopper and the beans if you desire to change the coffee... which we do!It has only 6 grinder settings... we have it set one notch above the finest grind setting and we still are not getting the intensity of flavor we were used to get with other machines.  I wish there were more grind settings.I hope this helps you make a more informed decision.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: It made great cappuccinos for 5 days. Then stopped steaming and grinding the beans. Returned for a refund.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This item leaks water, we received this yesterday and woke up to water on the counter. Figured it was adjusting or something. During the day more water leaking out we called Delonghi to have the representative advise they have issues with this, offered to replace it. When we asked how can you guarantee the replacement would work, she said good question I cannot say it won’t happen again.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Good results, but less manual control than most espresso machines
Review Description: If you want to make "restaurant quality" espresso, then you need to invest in a machine that has a quality grinder and allows you to have control over the critical variables; such as grind size, extraction time, and temperature.  The most popular high end machine for making espresso at home has been the Breville Barista Express.  But that machine has a high learning curve.  Just learning to choose the right grind size from the many available options or consistently tamping the grounds with the right amount of pressure takes a lot of practice (and wasted coffee).  Not to mention learning to use the steam wand properly for milk based drinks.  You can spend about 4 times as much as the Breville would cost you to buy a superautomatic machine that makes really good espresso, such as the various Jura models.  Or you could spend just a little more money than the Breville and buy a machine like this new De'Longhi La Specialista Prestigio espresso machine, which automates some of the steps that are hard to master but still allows you more control over the process than a superautomatic machine would.  This De'Longhi only offers 6 choices for grind size, but with the built in sensor grinding technology, you don't need to be as precise when dialing in the grid size as you would need to be with a less advanced machine.  But perhaps the most useful feature of this machine is the smart tamping feature, which takes care of using just the right amount of pressure to tamp the grounds so you don't need to worry about that.  So whether you are a beginner or an expert when it comes to making your own espresso, you will always get more consistent results with this machine.  The steam wand is improved over previous De'Longhi models, but it does take a while to master the skill of using it to make really good lattes and cappuccinos.  However, after a little practice it didn't take me long to get much better results than I have been able to get with any other espresso machine I have used.  Overall this is a very nice machine, and probably the best value in a home espresso machine for under $1,000 that you will find anywhere.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: 1. I am on my second machine. The first one, the descaling light went on and would not turn off regardless of how many times I descaled. This occurred two weeks after purchase2. While it is easy to use making it attractive, it is terrible. There is a setting for coffee and americano, which is a waste of beans, because you will end up manually making the americanos because of the water espresso ratio3. I kept repeatedly reading about people having difficulty reaching optimal zone temperature while pulling  a shot. Various solutions were provided, however, I did not have this problem with the first machine. After the first machine was replaced, I began to have this problem. This is a POORLY BUILT machine.4. The milk frothing dual boiler system might as well be a single boiler. It takes a while for the steam to heat up, and also stops frothing and steaming milk prematurely when in the micro foam position.5. All the reviews here and of people who received a FREE MACHINE. I DID NOT REALIZE THIS UNTIL AFTER MY PUCHASE. SHAME ON AMAZON. Now I have to carry this again and return it. If you are looking for an espresso machine below $1000, do not buy this product. If you are looking to buy over the $1,000 range, then you do not need to worry about this at all.This is a summary of my experience.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought this and LOVED it for a few weeks while it worked. They the water sensor stopped working randomly, so I exchanged it for another. The 2nd came and it was broken immediately so I was never even able to use it! Be careful with this model... seems the longevity is in serious question because of this.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: I wanted to love it, but I don’t.
Review Description: I owned a Breville dual boiler for Many years. The features of this one such as the self tamping got me to choose this brand over another Breville. On my new machine, I do love the incorporated grinder as well as the tamping mechanism. However, I’m disappointed with the steamer of this machine which is a huge factor in having a machine of this caliber. I love making mochas and capuchinos, but I have such a hard time trying to frothing and texturizing the milk to the creamer consistency to make lattes. With the Breville this process was a breeze. I was about tho give up and return this De’Longhi to Amazon and get another Breville instead. I did find a technique were I’m able to get the cream with this one to make my lattes, unfortunately it has been a 50/50 right outcome. I think I’m pass the window where I could’ve return this machine; therefore, I’m keeping it. I still love the simplicity in the grinding and tamping, and  hope I get to a point where I have more success with the frothing.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great machine for Americanos and Lattes
Review Description: I’ve had a few different espresso machines over many years.  My last was a Breville Oracle that finally died after 3 years.  In deciding what to replace it with I evaluated what I wanted to use it for.  For the last few years I only drink Americanos and to a lesser extent, Lattes.  So I wasn’t looking for an espresso machine to produce god shots for drinking straight espresso, but something more than good enough to produce excellent Americanos and Lattes.  The La Specialista met that quite well.It is easy to use and since I was well experienced with espresso making, dialing it in to produce great coffee was quick and easy.  From power on to ready to use is about a minute.  Then I do a blind shot to heat up the portafilter as a cold portafilter will negatively affect the espresso produced.  I leave the empty portafilter in the machine and use the Rinse button to get the preheat done.  Grinding works well as does the built in tamping with a side effect of not being as messy as using a separate grinder with a tamper often is.  One concern with the grinder is that to make good espresso the grind setting needs to be very close to the minimum grind size and over time, as the grinder burrs wear that will probably become an issue.  Fortunately DeLonghi sells a replacement upper burr for that very issue.Steaming excellent and nearly automatic for Lattes or Flat Whites, but I think it is a little weak for a cappuccino.  Cleaning of the steam wand is dead simple and since the wand is a no-burn type, cleaning off the outside is easy too.The various button combinations for changing some default settings work well and are well documented in the user manual.  The First Start pamphlet is excellent and well presented so getting the machines ready for that first use is really easy.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Not a professional machine at all
Review Description: This machine was a total waste of my time.  I much prefer my Breville barista express but I thought for an additional $200 or so to get this more modern looking dual boiler machine.  The disadvantages thus:  the water tank has no indicator on the side, which means I have to pull the machine out and check the water levels;  the steam wand has no handle to grab on to; and most importantly, there is simply not enough pressure to froth the milk.  For a dual boiler machine this is insulting!  It grinds great, the espresso brews great, however, the fact that there is no pressure to froth my lattes is the biggest reason for this return.  Please do not waste your money on such a useless, fancy machine.  You will be sorely disappointed.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I was so excited to get this machine but the bean light kept flashing which means the bean holder was not in correctly. No matter how many times we took it out and replaced it the flashing light would not go out and the coffee would not grind.  After an hour and a half of three of us trying to fix it we finally called Amazon tech support. They tried with us for another half hour. (DeLonge was closed as it was after hours). Finally we packed it up and it is going back.  I am hoping that the replacement they send actually works.  Fingers crossed.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have been looking for a coffee machine with grinder function ever since our previous machine died a couple of months ago. The previous one was a Krupps fully automatic machine, made really good coffee but like all machines do at some point, it decided to die.There are quite a few machines in the $1200+ range and a few in the $600-1200 range, which is the price range I was looking at. I had short-listed to Gaggia vs Philips, leaning more towards Gaggia but reports of their poor customer service was disconcerting. Both of these are fully automatic. De'Longhi had the semi-automatic Magnifica but it didn't look pleasing aesthetically as far as matching the rest of my kitchen goes. Breville seemed a little too much work with manual tamping - as in, you actually take the tamper and press into the portafilter to tamp.Almost as I was finally ready to buy, I see this De'Longhi - la specialista. I have had this machine for about two weeks now.It is a semi-automatic machine. Its not a press-one-button-and-get-coffee machine, you will have to do some, a little, bit of work. Meaning, attach the portafilter to the grind unit and then the brew unit. Not a lot of work, and it actually feels good to be doing that!!Build quality is really really good. I am hard pressed to tell plastic from steel parts. Sides have the brushed steel look and chrome trims and I have no idea what is plastic. A very solid, well built machine. It looks really really good sitting on the counter, especially with that black 'dashboard' with the pressure gauge dominating the facade. The portafilter is solid and surprisingly heavy - you could easily use it for defense in case of burglary or something !! Same solid build is seen also in the included frothing mug and the filters, as well as the steel drip tray grill. Rest of the drip tray is plastic - the one place where plastic is obviously plastic.Power button turns it on of course - there's a master on/off switch in the back. Also in the back is a water reservoir which is surprisingly large.Attaching the portafilter to the grinder starts the grinding automatically. The machine will grind coffee for one or two shots if you press the 2x button.This is where my only frustration with the machine arose - frustration that has since been resolved. Start with factory default settings - fineness at 3 and amount of coffee dial at about 10 o'clock position. I was too impatient and started playing with the dials causing the machine to grind EXCESSIVE amounts of coffee and essentially malfunction. Ground coffee would back up the discharge chute from the grinder resulting in unhappy sounds from the machine and unhappy time for me.De'Longhi uses an "exclusive" new technology / sensor to determine how much coffee to grind. I think the common method is to grind for a certain amount of time. This machine detects the actual amount ground - I think. Anyway, I think this sensor is located in the chute which can be accessed by popping up a small flap located right at the base of the bean hopper. Using the provided brush tool, and a thin plastic stick, I unclogged this chute and cleaned out as much coffee grounds as I could. Problem solved. But it did take about half a bag of beans before getting that resolved.I blame the above on the fact that this is our first semi-automatic machine. There is a learning curve.Now that the vulnerable part is identified and addressed, the machine has been working without any issues whatsoever. I am actually coffee-making, barista style, on this thing. Coffee tastes really really good. Unlike the Breville, this one has a built in tamper - handle on the left side of the machine in the product photos. Once you attach the portafilter, the machine will automatically grind the dosed amount of coffee. Pull the handle down to tamp - there's a mark to tell you how much to pull. Remove the portafilter, attach it to the brewing station and press OK button. And you have your coffee.The built in milk frother / steam wand works really well too. The frother has a dedicated heating unit, separate from the brew unity. It has a 'flat' and 'foam' function. I tried both and really enjoy the foamed steamed milk. After watching a few YouTube videos, I learned to hold the included frothing mug at a certain angle and move it in circular motion etc but then discovered that the machine does a really fine job without those shenanigans. Just set the mug on the corner of the drip tray, stick the want in there and turn the dial for steaming. You get a luxurious micro froth without doing the dance I described. And the steam stops automatically. If you like your coffee actually hot though, you will have to do the steam twice. There is a function to increase the temperature of the coffee but I have not played with that setting so far.The cons are very few. Coming from a fully automatic machine, I had a to learn to use a semi-automatic one but that should be expected of any new tool / machine. The machine is full enclosed and does NOT have the easily removable brew unit that some manufacturers highlight, including DeLonghi. That might be an issue further down the road, but DeLonghi Magnifica and Breville don't have that feature as well and don't seem to be suffering as a result.Overall, I am really pleased with the machine. Great build quality, great coffee. Happy with the purchase.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Doesn’t work, the third machine in less than 2 months
Review Description: I did turn on the machine and it doesn’t work because the display of out or water was on. The tank was full of water. I move out the tank and put in 3 times. I unplugged and plugged again and the light indicator was still on. It’s unbelievable! This is the third machine that I’m going to return in less than 2 months.I don’t know if it’s something with the machines that Amazon sales (poor quality or machines that are resale from people that return it) or it’s really a poor quality control on the factory. But the next one I’m going to buy at Macy’s.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Don't buy a DeLonghi espresso machine!
Review Description: $700 piece of junk!The unit worked fine till after 3  months the damn thing started to leak. Had to JUMP THRU MANY HOOPS to get a customer service rep to walk me through the most cumbersome support entitlement process ever conceived. So it's almost May and I get a callback from them saying they still needed a barcode so I told them where to go. In the end I'm stuck here waiting for a replacement part that may or may not fix the leak. My suggestion is to go back to old fashioned boiled coffee and strain it thru a sock like grandma did.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: **UPDATE** Machine started to leak all over the counter top. EASY FIX! I am sharing this to avoid returns and waits. I called De'longhi and they were absolutely no help! They actually told me to just take the tank off after each use to prevent leakage!!! Um no, that doesn't fix the problem people!!  So I was ready to return the unit but decided to check things out on my own. Here was my discovery...On the back of the machine under the water tank (take tank off) there is a clear star shaped gasket that regulates the flow of water into the machine.  Gently rock the valve with your finger until you feel it lay flat. Do this even if it appears to be flat already. It seems to reset the flow. Fixed my problem! I think it is caused my pressure build up? Hope this helps others with leaking issues.We have been using this now for two weeks. LOVE IT! As a former barista I would highly recommend this machine as it is pretty self explanatory. A few things we didn’t like of the top was the awkward placement of the water tank. It’s a bit difficult to put water in from a pitcher or jug. Recommend using a tumbler or a glass if it’s stored under cabinets. Another issue we had with the unboxing was we couldn’t get the grinder to operate. That was due to not twisting the dome on hard enough ( I was afraid of breaking the plastic) but it’s tougher than one would expect. The frother wand should be dissembled and cleaned after each use or fill a cup with water and run the air through to make sure the inner nipple is clean. No water leakage as others have mentioned in their comments. All and all we are very happy with our purchase. Brews a great espresso and americano. The more you use it the more comfortable you will become with the functions. I highly recommend buying the knock box and espresso shot glasses!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: My wife bought this machine from Amazon about 9 months ago. We haven’t had any of the maintenance problems other users have had. I haven’t seen any reviews here from an “unwilling” household member, so I wanted to post this. We have had the same automatic drip coffee maker for over 10 years, so this was a serious upgrade for us. As a guy who “just wants a cup of coffee” in the morning, I was very skeptical that I could grow to love this machine. We have limited counter space and so didn’t want to have both. But my wife promised she’d make the coffee every morning, so I consented. Her promise lasted about two months, so indeed I was stuck using the machine as expected (and making hers as well)! Now I drink cappuccino every morning, because the taste is better than coffee (Americano) and it takes the same amount of time. That’s my chief complaint with this machine, the active time spent using it. You can't set it to be ready when you wake up, and the operation is active; you can't just push a button and walk away. So my experience is not in comparison to any other espresso maker, but compared to a “normal coffee maker.”I also wanted to share a few tips to getting the time down from 8 minutes to 4 minutes including clean up. This is for people who have been using the machine for a few months so you know what I’m talking about.1. Use the shelf of the machine for the milk foaming. If you use enough milk (we use heavy cream/almond milk), the steamer tube will reach into the milk while in the included steel “pitcher”. I have found no difference in milk/foam consistency if I stir the milk around or just let it sit. I use this time (usually takes 2 steam cycles) to empty out the grounds and clean up the filter holder.2. I use a small metal spoon to clean out the grounds from the filter rather than banging it, which has been faster and makes less of a mess. I’ve been doing this for the past 4 months and have not noticed any scrapes to the filter or filter cup. The sooner you do this after use the easier it is.3. We remove and rinse the filter after each use. This was very annoying for me as I have big fingers and it’s nearly impossible to grip the tiny rubber tab to pull the filter out. Then my wife showed me a trick: just use a small corner torn off from a paper towel to pull the tab. It gives you just enough grip to easily pull out the filter, and works every time.I clean the filter and cup while the milk is foaming and this has made coffee making into only a minor annoyance rather than the serious one it was before.My other complaint is the noise that the foamer makes. Surprisingly, the way that you orient/tilt the milk pitcher makes a big difference. Play around with it until the noise is reduced. I used to wake up the whole house with what I would call the “shrieking beasts of hell”, but now they have mostly been tamed.Overall, I’m happy with the purchase, but it took some getting used to.PS:  In case anyone is wondering, each steam cycle adds about 30ml of water to your beverage. I weighed the milk pitcher before and after steaming. Yes, I'm a nerd.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Leaks water from the boiler outlet. Useless machine.
Review Description: Leaks water at the boiler outlet. I’ve meticulously cleaned this area to no avail.De’Longhi service is impossible to get on the phone.Water coming out of the sides renders the Specialista useless and a waste of $800.My Breville that I gave to my daughter was so reliable!Praying that De’Longhi will read this and respond.Update: Delonghi contacted me. They did a video call and I demonstrated the issue. They are sending a box for me to ship them the unit for service.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Less then a month old and every time it brews a coffee it makes this loud noise. Not sure what it is but very upsetting for a product that cost over $500 it should not have any problems this soon.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: mine works perfectly , it brews a perfect expresso with a perfect  cream and flavor ,  the integrated taping system works flawlessly and with minimal mess , the grinder and froth system worked great  ,  the extraction process is incredible you can feel you are having a high quality coffee.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: I love my espresso and lattes, hope this holds up.
Review Description: Eight Month Update:  Average two lattes a day, keeping it clean and rinsing the steam wand religiously, not a hitch yet.  Just did my second descaling, no problems.  Still very happy and my wife loves every cup I make for her (of course she does!).  No leakage, remember to keep the portafilter inserts clean!Original review: This is a nice looking machine, and after three weeks I cannot say it has any problems at all.  I dialed in the grind (set at 2 and about 5/8 of full dial setting) and used some 20 dollar Lavazza Blu/Oro beans, the coffee was amazing.  The crema is quite good, it would be better if the head was heated by water like others, but run a hot water preheat before you start brewing.  Try to warm the cup too, will hold the crema longer.  For the price, this is quite good.  The steam heater works well, if you put an inch and a half of milk in the provided pitcher, the sixty second steam cycle is sufficient, but use a thermometer anyway, it is best gage of readiness and they cost about 10 bucks with the clip.  I believe cleaning is most important thing about these machines, blow out the steam tube, clean the steam wand, disassemble it and wipe the rubber tube after you're done with it for the time of day.  Use filtered water, this is not a FAEMA or professional machine, it will help you keep the pump and piping cleaner longer.  Don't let coffee get stale in the hopper, just put what you need for a few days at most.  Clean between the two disks of the portafilter, and rinse it out too.One thing that happened once is that a suction developed in the water line, not sure but seems like a check or stop valve got cycled by an air bubble.  I stopped the cycle when the trouble lights appeared, lifted and reseated the tank, and it burped when I restarted the cycle.  D'longhi should look into that, it might be a reason others have had problems with the water-out lights coming on.All said, having this quality of espresso at home is a wonderful thing, beats starbucks by a long shot.  If you want flavorings look up Torani syrups, I bought some for an occasional twist when I want it.  I will update if I have any other news on my experiences with this machine.  I think it is a good purchase so far.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have been using home espresso machines for 8 years. I mainly make lattes and americanos with the occasional cappuccino. I think Starbucks drinks are just ok, not good or great.  I purchased this De'Longhi La Specialista to replace a Breville 870. The advertised La Specialista dimensions don't accurately indicate just how big this machine is. With the grinder hopper attached, the actual height is about 17.5 inches and with the poorly designed power cord attached the depth is 16 inches. Lots of counter space is needed. The design of the built in tamper and grinder chute make getting the correct grind and tamp more difficult than necessary due to not being able to see how much coffee is being dispensed and feeling the tamp pressure. This process is an important part of pulling a good espresso shot. Only pressurized filters are provided. Once the grind and tamp are set as best as possible the resulting shots are only mediocre. The pucks are a mess, often not releasing from the filter causing the filter to drop out of the portafilter into the knock box and the puck needing to be scooped out of the filter.  The water reservoir is hidden on the sides so the water level can only be seen from the back of the machine. The steam wand is actually comprised of two pieces and milk goes up into the tubes requiring both pieces be removed and cleaned after each use. This is an easy process but I question how well the wand will hold up over time with this daily removal. Beans must be removed from the hopper prior to removing the hopper as there is no closing mechanism to hold the beans in the hopper. These issues are unacceptable for a machine at this price point. Now the pros; this is a good looking machine and is quiet, the steam wand does work well, easily frothing milk, and the warm up time is very quick. This machine makes better coffee drinks than a drip or pod coffee maker but isn't as good as other options in this price range. I returned mine and purchased another 870.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Grinder stopped working on day 5…. Ended up buying a Breville for significantly more money.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The bean grinder does not work after a month. The frothing wand makes our milk taste like metal. This is definitely not worth your money. I took a chance on buying this machine and literally the tamp and brewing espresso is the only thing that works. You cannot brew more than 2 shots at a time because of the automatic shut off. Would not buy again ever. Not happy with my purchase.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Disappointed in De'Longhi La Speialista Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought the Specialista after retiring my Brevile Dual Boiler due to a failed pump (after five years of use) because I wanted a built-in grinder and tamper. The Specialista is attractive and seems well-made. However, I am disappointed in the Specialista in several ways and regret buying it instead of having my Breville fixed:1. The setting of the grinder is not consistent and difficult to adjust, especially at the finest grind settings.2. The milk foamer (expander) does not make higher density foam that I was used to with the Breville (manual) steamer and it is too easy to bump the wand into its "flat" setting3. The portaflter is deep and not very wide so I have great difficulty emptying the used grounds into a "bang box." I have to use a tool every time; which is very messy. I never had that problem with the Breville portafilter with its different aspect ratio.4. The very small holes in the portafilter tend to get clogged and they are difficult to clean.5. The water reservoir capacity is marginal, requiring filling more often than I'm used to with the Breville.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: We love our espresso maker but...
Review Description: Who doesn’t like espresso? When I ordered this product in February of this year, I thought I knew quite a bit about coffee. I had experimented with several different coffee making devices but here was a product that made actual espresso, that ground the coffee to the correct size, preheated the water to the correct temperature, forced the water through the specialized portafilter at the appropriate pressure to insure proper extraction to make  delicious, coffee house style espresso. What’s not to love?Namely, the descaling process. We have had this unit for about 3.25 months and have descaled it twice. Descaling is a process that removes hard water mineral build up from the sensitive components inside the espresso maker. Our neighbor has this same unit and has had it for several months and has not yet been required to descale it.  We use filtered water only in our unit so I am not entirely sure what’s causing the issue.Other than that, we love our espresso maker. It does what it claims and does it well.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Average espresso...until it broke 2 months later
Review Description: Switched from a Breville to the De’Longhi. It’s more automated and takes less than 5 seconds to start steaming milk which is great.After 2 months of use, the espresso machine started to leak unfortunately (being told it’s a problem with recently manufactured units).Amazon won’t replace it since it’s been more than a month and De’Longhi’s support is a nightmare.  Had to email them 4 times after doing a video call to show the issue.  They are sending a box to ship the unit back - will take 3 weeks to get it back to me.  No advance replacement was offered.  For a unit that I just bought, I wasn’t expecting to be without it for such a long time.  Will definitely not purchase from De’Longhi again.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: False advertising; bad product all around
Review Description: The La Specialista espresso machine is advertised as a "double boiler" machine.  It doesn't operate that way.  You cannot steam milk while the machine is brewing an espresso.  The "smart tamping" system doesn't work well.  I set this unit is to  grinding setting for the finest coffee, and yet it is still very coarse - so much that the pressure never builds up.  Oh, and the DeLonghi knock-out box, which I bought separately, is also useless.  Sending it back.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: As quick and easy as a pod machine
Review Description: I read several online magazine reviews of different espresso machines, and this one ranked as one of the best. I ended up choosing this over a similar Breville machine because of the additional hot water spout. I was initially apprehensive about the price, but now I don't know how I waited so long to get one of these. The only problem now is that I want to drink coffee all day!The machine is super easy to use, yet it's fun to operate and you feel like a professional barista. You get your coffee as fast as you would from a pod machine, but it tastes like you got it at a coffee shop. Once the machine is set up (not difficult), brewing a coffee is as simple as:1. Attach the filter to the grinder. The correct amount of beans will grind automatically.2. Tamp the grounds with the lever.3. Attach the filter to the brewer and place a cup underneath.4. Select your drink and hit OK.There are some great features that make it easy to create the full range of coffee shop drinks:* You can easily grind and brew 1 or 2 shots. Filters are provided for both sizes.* You can select espresso, Americano (espresso + hot water), or "coffee" (AKA a lungo), and the machine applies the correct amount of water and brewing time.* A separate button will provide hot water only, making this the easiest way to brew tea.* There is a wand that can froth or steam milk so you can make cappuccinos and lattes.I initially thought the coffee was not hot enough, but I checked the manual and found a setting to use a higher water temperature. There is also a bit of trial and error to set the grinder to get exactly the right "dosage" of grounds per shot, but once you have that dialed in, you don't have to worry about it again for a long time.In conclusion, this is a great machine and I'm so glad I bought it. I can think of very few purchases where I was just as excited to use the thing weeks after I got it, and this is one of them.PS. If you ever see "Amazon Warehouse" selling one at a deep discount, go for it. I got a $300 markdown because one corner of the shipping box was slightly dented. The machine itself was pristine!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Let me just say this, I originally ordered the Breville Barista Express Espresso Machine and a few minutes after ordering that machine from a different retailer, I stumbled across the info link for this beautiful muscular machine. I ordered it because it has 2 options the Breville doesn't offer, function to provide hot water to make tea and a recipe choice to make an Americano sized drink. Those 2 functions sold me and I ordered this machine and am so happy i did. I love looking at it and I have also did several demo videos for my friends and family members who I can't wait to serve up a fresh cup of espresso or coffee. I also like that i can disable the automatic coffee grind feature so that i can tamp already possessed coffee grinds to use in the machine and make espresso and other drinks. This is a fun machine to use and makes a statement in your space.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: There are some positive reviews here, but I beleive they come from people who do not have any experience with espresso machines. I think DeLonghi tried to compete with Breville all-in-one machine and this attempt failed. They tried to couple their EC680M cheap machine with a grinder and the grinder is terrible. First, you need to grind always to the finest setting, and it is not fine enough. The beverage is sour (underextracted). the grinder has only 6 settings (a joke? only 6?) and they are all useless, since you need to set it to 1. And the espresso is not good. They tried to fix this problem by replacing regular baskets with pressurized baskets (they are more forgiving), but it means it is NOT espresso. Pressurized = bad. The tamper is a joke.When you brew espresso, the gauge in front of the machine NEVER shows the optimal zone. Never! Watch some youtube videos, never. I saw just one video, where the zone shown was optimal, but the guy used much more beans, filling the basket well above the limit.Verdict: it is not just a machine that is not as good as the others. The whole design is flawed, the machine simply does not work. I got it as a gift to friends in Taipei, so I cannot ship from there and  return.$799 just wasted. DeLonghi, have conscience! Return money! And fire all the designers.Google, there is a video, where a guy in France found a solution. Forget the internal grinder, and buy a separate grinder, nonpressurized basket, tamper and distributor, and use only 1/2 of La Specialista. A shame.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Only 6 weeks of usage and it's already broken. Called CS and they couldn't/didn't resolve. And now I can't return it either. Don't buy a DeLonghi product. They don't have the infrastructure to deal with.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Our unit displayed a general alarm error and upon contacting DeLonghi, I was told I would have to send the unit back for repair. It took awhile for me to receive the shipping label and the return box. I tracked the package and was told during my initial call, the machine would be sent back within 24-48 hours of receipt.I called to get an update a couple days later. I was provided a tracking number and told it had been shipped back to me.It ships via FedEx ground, so it took awhile to send/receive the unit.Upon receiving the unit, it was it noted the heating unit had been replaced.  While inspecting the returned unit, I noticed it came back with two small dents.A few days after receiving the unit it began to get another error light (appliance is too hot). I contacted customer support who asked for a video of the error. I was told the device was defective, but they would need to inspect it first, before a replacement could be given.Luckily I kept the shipping box, but it took three days for me to get a shipping label. So now we’re left without the machine for a second time.6/4: UPDATEReceived our third unit. This one is a certified refurbished one to replace the new one we bought that didn’t last very long. I can’t say if it works or not, as the water tank it was shipped with is cracked and broken .... DeLonghi is closed, so I’ll have to call tomorrow.Update: Our certified refurbished machine no longer works. It turns on and then shuts off. Numerous calls to Delonghi with promises of call backs which never came. Finally was able to get them to agree to refund me my money. Although they say it can take 4-6 weeks. I was offered a brand new replacement machine, but their lack of follow through and going through three returns isn’t worth it.I’d stay away from this machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Purchased machine mid November when I was able to get it at $100 off.  Arrived quickly and all was well as I learned how the machine worked which, truth be told, took a bit of a learning curve. I sough help from De'Longhi because it was almost impossible to get the puck out of the filter holder.  I eventually learned to live with that.  I reduced the coffee amount and slightly increased the grind and that helped some but it still was difficult.  Then, the grinder stopped working.  I worked with De'Longhi to resolve and was unable to get it working.  At this point I was told they would send me a box so I could return it and they would fix it and send it back to me.  I had missed Christmas Eve and Christmas day coffee with my family and was unhappy at the prospect of weeks without my espresso machine.  So, I called Amazon on Friday, explained my situation, and had a new machine on my doorstep Monday morning!  Technically, my 30 day Amazon return window had closed, but after hearing my story, customer service came through!In the meantime, the DeLonghi box never arrived.  I did get a phone call from them about a week after I received my new machine telling me how sorry they were that my problem had fallen through a crack in the system.  So, I guess I should be hopeful that the 2 year warranty on the machine will be honored.  Still, cant thank Amazon enough.BTW:  the new machine is amazing.  Makes amazing espresso (for me) and Americanos (for my husband) and the milk frother is outstanding.  Once you have it down, it can't be beat!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: READ CAREFULLY!!!Everything about this unit is fantastic. BEWARE!! If your looking for a plug and play unit that needs no adjustments then this is NOT the unit for you. It takes time to dial in and when you clean it or even change beans you have to readjust. It’s not a problem for us as we have the time to do so. We have had zero issues and use it very frequently. I definitely recommend this unit and it’s very easy to use once it’s dialed in.As people have stated the water low light will come on when you first get it, even if the water tank is full. All you have to do is READ the directions and prime the system. I am amused by the amount of people who send this unit back when all they have to do is read the directions. P!! A YEAR LATER UPDATE!!  Well after just about daily use of this unit, we have had it for a year and still have no issues with this unit.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Update:After about 3 months of use, it started having issues:Water is leaking at random times, emptying the whole container through the drip trayThe tank empty light would come on and not go away, even when you fill the tankoften times pressure is not high enough to even push the liquid through the coffee grounds.Overall pretty disappointed. Called the manufacturer a few times, they ignored me for some time, now they want me to send it in to repair it, which could take weeks.I wish I could return it----------------------------This is a great machine, everything works as advertised. It took a bit of time ant tries until I got the desired coffee, but once you get it right it works flawlessly.You will get the user manual and there are plenty of videos on youtube to help you set it up and understand what's what.It's really easy to set it up, it took me less than 10 minutes from opening the box to making the first coffee. Make sure the left-most dial is set to 1/3 of the way. Initially I had it all the way left, which means you fill it and tamp it yourself.I am using Illy Classic Whole Bean coffee and it tastes heavenly.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Excellent product that could use a few enhancements - REVISED
Review Description: Would love to see a better seal on the bean hopper and a larger water tank, but the unit makes great flavorful coffee.  it is easy to clean and looks good.  The footprint is not too bad and my wife will maybe let me bring it in the house instead of my office.  I think I'll keep it close to me. :)Update:  Two weeks after setting this up and only a handful of coffees I started noticing that the countertop had water on it after use.  At first, I thought it was from cleaning up around the unit or it settling in.  Boy was I wrong.  This unit leaks a significant amount of water all the time, but its haphazard as to when.There is definitely a design flaw someplace. I notice it most after doing a couple of cups back to back, but it can also happen with a single cup.  I typically will froth some milk and then make a couple of cups of Americano to use with the milk.  If I stop the Americano short of the full cycle or stop the frothing after the machine warms up, I notice the water the most.  Typically right after shutting off the cycle is when water will come during out the left side.  I put a paper towel down to show it in the attached photo.  This photo was taken mid water dump.  By the time it finishes, the towel is completely wet.I contacted Delonghi and they said it was a bad batch of drip drays that didn't have the proper hole so they shipped me a replacement drip tray.  The whole process of reporting and getting the new drip tray took months thanks to the COVID situation, which I understand.  However; when the new drip tray arrived, the problem persisted.  Now they want me to ship the unit back to them, go without a coffee maker for perhaps months and then wait to get back a unit that hopefully works.  I suspect this is more a design flaw than a lemon so I don't have high expectations.  Why not send me a new unit and then see?Very disappointed in what I thought was a premium band.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I purchased for Christmas 2019. We have pretty much made 2 cups of Americano every days since, with some cappuccinos and espressos. I love the built in tamper, keeps the mess off the counter. It's very easy to use. Heats up faster than a Kurig.It really is a good machine. Here are some things De'Longhi could to to make it fantstic.1. Give it a few more grind settings. I pretty much keep mine at 5. Only a few times with some very fresh roasted beans have I had to turn it down to 3 or 4. Never used 1-2.2. Give a way to grind just a tad more coffe not a measured dose.3. Suppy a non pressure basket to allow some experiments.Lastly, My grinder crapped out. A small rock was in the coffee beans and stripped some gears out( assume) in the inner workings. I called customer support and they are shipping me a box to return and will fix or replace. Very happy so far with Their customer service.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: get what you pay for in this model
Review Description: I bought this so my wife could feel like she was in Paris again each time she had a cup of cappuccino. 100% delivery on the feeling. If you make coffee by the pot the preparation of coffee using this machine  will change your whole routine, buying habits and time. First you quit using pre ground coffee and you buy whole bean coffee. If you use creamer that stops too, you change to milk. And you find a world of flavoring syrup you will end up using every day to make your Joe. Second you make it by the cup instead the pot. Third it takes 6-15 minutes per cup depending upon how elaborate the preparation. Fourth you have to go through a cleaning process once a month. Fifth you are spending $700 plus to get a contraption that takes up about 3.5 to 4 square feet of counter space.As for this machine in particular we researched and found it to have everything we thought we needed for our first espresso machine. It has been a great piece of equipment. We installed a reverse osmosis unit under our sink to avoid using our local hard tap water ($200). If you have hard tap water use bottled or RO water to extend the life of the machine to avoid scale build up. We have owned it six months and one day it began draining the water from the reservoir into the drip tray. I called The manufacturer and they said there was a new tray design that fixed the problem and said they would send one out in two weeks. A month later we are still waiting for the replacement tray. Machine still works but we have to remove the drip tray to avoid the water tank from being drained into the drip tray.A good purchase from a good company that is slow like any big company....and it still feel like Paris.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: What initially attracted me to this device was it's Italian made and they take their coffee seriously along with the integrated grinder and tamper. I know a few people who have machines and the grounds make a mess on the counter top. Purchased in August 2019 with three repairs so far so just not a very reliable product.The good: When it works it brews a really nice coffee with nice crema. The integrated grinder and tamper work well.The bad: It breaks quite frequently. The first two times it was under warranty so we got to send it back for free. The first break was a loss of pressure in the device when making a coffee. This decreased the volume output and removed the nice crema from the top. The second time we got a refurbished machine which lasted another six months. Broken thankfully just before the warranty period ended. Most recently the steamer has malfunctioned so instead of frothing milk it only heats the milk. The other major issue with the steamer is instead of a wand they give you a nozzle which lets you change the amount of air allowed to mix with the steam. Well milk gets up the nozzle and really requires taking it off daily and cleaning it. Consider that vs a wand where you only need to turn on the steam function and it clears the line from any milk. I have forgotten to on some days in a hurry and the next find curdled milk rising to the top of my coffee the next.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Returned Because the grinder doesn’t go fine enough
Review Description: Let me start out by saying this is a beautiful machine with great design BUT the grinder does not let you go to a true espresso corse level. If you plan on making espresso out of only a pressurized filter that’s great but what’s the point of putting in a high end burr grinder if you don’t let it flourish 6 settings really and another thing that makes me very upset for a machine of this caliber and price it needs to include a non pressurized filter period end of story. I returned this machine and purchased the breville barista express.... its to bad cause that autotamping station was so nice  and clean and the machine again looked better then the barista or even then the Silvia

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Bought this in JUNE - its quit.  Got notification to Descale so set it up to do it - the thing would not stop sending water and making noises.  Finally turned off power in back and unplugged.  Now the descale light stays on with the emergency triangle and wont work at all.  Called DeLongi and will have to send unit in for repair but in the interim I had to buy another smaller espresso machine which works 10 times better at 2/3 the cost!!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought this for my husband in November 2020. It is now March 2021. It's made 1-3 cups of coffee every day since purchase, and has given wonderful results. My husband, the coffee snob, has really enjoyed it.But then it broke. Condensation collected in the pressure window, and even when unplugged, the pressure needle is stuck at optimal zone. The machine is un-useable.It was a really good buy, and I'll adjust my review if customer service comes thru and resolves the issue. Will update later.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Love this machine,My wife and I have about 4cups each per day.I was very surprised at how quiet this Machine is compared to my old one I had.It also steams the milk in no time.Also the heat up time on this machine is pretty much non existent, by the time the beans are ground the machine is ready to brew.In the beginning i was worried since there are some not so great reviews but I figured that it has a 3 year warranty, for myself I figure even if it only lasts 3 years that it will still be worth every penny with the amount of coffee I drink, it is still a lot cheaper than getting coffee out.Pros:Ease of useBean grinderVery solid feelVery impressed on how easy it is to clean the wand (compared to my older machine)3 year warrantyCons:Can’t remove coffee bean hopper unless empty ( you can remove it but you will spill beans everywhere)Water tank should be a little larger (doesn’t hold a lot of water)I am very pleased with my purchase

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Good Expresso maker for home use.
Review Description: After using this machine for a month, here are some of my thoughts on the product:- I can not get the pressure of extraction rise up to the middle or higher end of the “optimum zone” even with the finest grinding setting.  The only way I can get higher pressure is to fill portfilter to a level slightly higher than the horizontal line but, if you filled it too high you won’t be able to close it.- The Drip tray fills up very quickly and you need to remember to empty it or you will have water on your counter.  There is a rubber floater that is supposed to indicate high water level but it was not discussed in the manual.- The perforated screen inside the portfilter should be pulled out for cleaning but it is difficult  to remove.-  overall the machine is easy to use with all the indicators in the front panel.  It is nice that you don’t need separate grinder and tamper which saves a lot of counter space. Making Expresso is easy but  I am still working on my latte skills.  Sometimes I get a blob of foam on the top and other times I get no foams.A note after two months of use:  I am really happy with the purchase I made.  The expresso taste very good after I adjusted the water temperature to high and the double walled glass helps keep the drink hot longer.  Fixed a cup of latte macchiato every morning to start my day off.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Makes a great latte, Americano or cappuccino but has limitations.This is from Delonghi:  Please be advised any Delonghi espresso units do not work with non-pressurized baskets. We have designed and tested them to run only with pressurized baskets, even the La Specialista.Works well as designed.  Good milk frothing.Limited by the grinder fineness.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This product gives me mixed feelings weekly.Pros: Easy to use, good shots, good Americanos.Cons: Every week or two, inexplicably, without warning, the thing completely empties its water reservoir onto my countertop, into the drawers, on the floor, everywhere. You’ll walk up to the machine and notice that everything is wet, the reservoir is empty, the water collection tray is overflowed. No noise, no other issues, just every now and then, it floods your kitchen.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This machine is quite an investment, but it is a great looking machine that brews consistent delicious espresso shots (and more) very quickly and very cleanly (thanks to the built in grinder and tamper). It takes a few cups to get the grind and quantity settings just right, but after that it's very quick and easy to use.It is a large machine (I have to remove the lid from the bean hopper to be able to slide it out from under my kitchen cabinets to refill the water reservoir) so make sure you take note of the dimensions.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: So far so good.  I've only had this machine for a couple weeks.
Review Description: So far so good.  I've only had this machine for a couple weeks but I like it!  It was a bit complicated to me to figure out how to use it at first, but once I did, it's very easy to use.  I just watched some YouTube videos and figured it out pretty quickly!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought this as a Father’s Day gift for my husband. The best gift ever since I get to use it too! Haha We love our de’longhi coffee maker! It wasn’t easy to figure out how to use it, we had to read the manual a few times, but once we figured it out and got all the settings where we want them it’s a quick cup of coffee every morning. I love how clean it is! There is no mess! The all in one grinder and tamper makes it so easy and mess free! Highly recommend this amazing machine!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We moved from Oregon to the east coast and went into bad coffee shock. They actually think Dunkin is a palatable morning drink. Then Starbucks is literally your only other option. I was in coffee hell. Then after adding what my husband and I spend in a year on espresso it made sense to just buy a decent machine and make our own. We went with this one due to cost and abilities. I could not be happier with this purchase, I had read a review that said to make sure and buy to go cups, lids, straws, flavors, milk, and I went one more step and got clear glass espresso cups that are perfect to see your beautiful finished delicious espresso.
