Review Description: This machine failed 9 months after purchase. I had another Delinghi espresso machine for years and I expected similar quality. I am very disappointed this isn’t the case. The first problem I found was the steam. It was malfunctioning intermittently. Then the grinder failed.  Finally just last week I had a general system fault. I wish I could get a refund and find another brand.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Got this espresso machine for Christmas been using it for about one week give or take. But I came home from work and the whole kitchen counter had water everywhere. It leaked called De Longhi and was told I would have to send it back! However I would have to show proof of purchase which was fine however, rep didn’t tell me website was down for maintain everything till January 6! Than goodness amazon let me exchange it for a new one wish me luck!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: this was a Christmas gift. when it was opened it was dented had coffee grounds in it and in the box. none of the accessories were in the box. this was a used defective item not what we ordered. tried to return reorder would not let us at that time. so started the return and reordered a week later. it came it was a new item that did not work. we called manufacture they shipped us a new grinder part which solved the problem and it now works. so now im billed $811 for the first and $811 for the second one. when i check on my return status its says they will apply credit within 7 days of the return. it shipped out ups on 12/11/20. so it works good if your willing to put up with all the problems and pay for it twice.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I am not writing a negative recommendation. Quite the opposite. But, if you are looking for exceptional taste and ease of use, you need to choose one or the other. This machine is extremely specific in its purpose and operation. This also means that you will need to take good care and proper maintenance in its use. If you do, you will LOVE IT! We are extremely satisfied with our La Specialista.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Received it new from the box on a Saturday, broken and wont work by Friday. General Warning sign, expresso features wont work. Most annoying thing is I would normally just ask for a return and replace. Defective products happen. But amazon will not allow for a return and replace with this same product and I am not going to waste my time and money sending this product off at my own cost to be repaired by the warranty. So I am returning it and getting my refund and I intend to use my refund to purchase the comparable model of expresso machine from Breville.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Disappointed on the quality for a brand new equipment out of the box
Review Description: No steam out of the box. I just bought it and after following instructions I get the vapor sign flashing for some minutes and then the call service red triangle simbol steady.  Coffy grinder and browser works ok

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is an additional brewing machine for our home.  Quality and workmanship is superior.  Very user friendly.  Worth every penny

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: If you have $800 and you want to spend 200 per month on coffee, buy this machine. I spend hours on the phone with the customer "support" and after waiting 1 month, this malfunctioning machine is still sitting idle on the countertop. It's a shame that companies are manufacturing low-quality products, charge a lot, and give ZERO support, simply because they can.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Excellent product!  Easy to learn  to use and does a great job making espresso and lattes!  Highly recommended!  May update this later to comment on durability, but so far, this thing runs strong!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: First machine came from Amazon with a defect. Steam wand had zero pressure and no steam. Returned to Delonghi in Jew Jersey. They sent replacement straight from factory.  Its perfect.  I dont know if amazon is selling refurbished units but given the level of quality control at Delonghi, I find it hard to believe a unit with no pressure to build steam, made it out of their factory.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Good machine but bad after sale service.
Review Description: The product itself was good for about 2 months then it won’t work. We called de’longhi. They said it need service and will issued a box and label in one week. They have never arrived. It has been a battle just to get it ship back for a service. It is Just still There on my counter. I would say the product is good but after sale service is super sad. Think again if you will buy with this company.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This item broke on the 3rd espresso made - I paid $722 for this. I returned the item BEFORE the date suggested & I have the claim ticket for proof. I didn't get my refund until a month AFTER I returned it, and only got $555 of the $722. Horrible! If I could give a negative on the product and the company, I would!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: It works great.... when it works!
Review Description: We went through 2 of these in just a few months.  The first machine’s grinder stopped working and the second machine’s steam wand stopped working.  We troubleshooted and watched many videos/tutorials to try to fix the problems with no success.  We have given up.  Maybe they were defective machines or maybe the machine that does it all.. has more that can go wrong!We have now purchased a Breville instead.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Buyer beware.  Expensive espresso machine worked for less than 60 days.  De"Longhi refuses to repair or replace because they said it came from an unapproved seller.  It came from Amazon...

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Love this machine once I figured it out lol
Review Description: It took me a while but I figured it out and now I’m in love. So far best espresso

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great espresso maker, along with making a regular cup of coffee.
Review Description: Great machine, commercial grade!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: After much research and deliberation, I got the Delonghi La Specialista. After a week of use, it was absolutely money well spent. Not only is it very easy to use, but it makes perfect espresso every time. The milk frothing is also super consistent and easy for non-baristas to use effectively. I couldn’t be more pleased with it. I only wish I ordered it sooner. Two thumbs way up!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Coffee grinder and frothed don’t work
Review Description: The coffee maker came with two broken features. It did not grind coffee properly (just ground coffee beans into large chunks, and never changed based on various settings, just spit out large chunks. Second, the milk frothed steamer didn’t work.Waste of money and effort trying to get it to work.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great machine but the squealing noise at the start of each shot is disappointing
Review Description: Support said the squealing would go away, but eight months later it hasn’t. They also said it doesn’t imply a technical problem, and that seems right. It seems it is just a known design flaw. Otherwise the machine is great, with the tamping station an ingenious way to reduce mess. The two settings on the frothing wand don’t seem to differ much, but it still works well.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: DO NOT BUY!!!!  CHEAPLY MADE, MULTIPLE THINGS BROKE WITHIN FIRST WEEK!
Review Description: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!..HAD FOR 1 WEEK AND HAD MULTIPLE ISSUES... GRINDER BROKE INSTANTLY, ESPRESSO STOPPED WORKING,FROTHER DIDN'T WORK RIGHT... SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Thought I was a coffee pro - think again!!
Review Description: I have experience with coffee machines, but my partner does not. I chose this machine because of the pressure gauge and the self-tamping mechanism so that he could use it too. I am really glad I did, because I wasn’t as good at making coffee as I thought... I did have to learn to readjust the settings and watch the pressure gauge for each type of bean I put into it. I think with proper cleaning, this will last me years.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This is easily the best espresso maker we have owned. It makes great espresso and other beverages, is quiet, clean and efficient. It’s not complex, in the sense that it’s not automated with a timer and auto brew, etc., it’s fairly manual, only makes one or two cups at a time, so if you want to make a pot of coffee, this Is not your machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I like this machine, but leaking has been a big problem for me. Also, it doesn't make foam for cappuccino. They are a good espresso machine, but this one has been like a nightmare for me :(

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: The grind is not working, the water pump is not working, and the water heat is not working.
Review Description: Got the coffee machine in a week, then set it up, and not working. I thought I didn't put the system right. I check again and lock everything up, but still wasn't work. I was so frustrated and get up. I returned to get back my refund. It is not a friendly and the machine is not cheap.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Best espresso ever I no longer ho to Starbucks.
Review Description: The flavor is so good the milk frother works perfectly coffe taste excellent

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: An excellent coffee machine. I bought it for my class and everyone loves it. So easy that even the class dunce has no problems, the taste is excellent, and the learning curve hardly is even there. 10/10

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Purchased Used From Amazon, Love It
Review Description: We purchased a used model in "acceptable" condition, was sent an essentially new almost untouched machine. Makes espresso super fast, looks great, tons of features, great build quality, list goes on.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Love this machine for its simplicity and performance.  Best frother out there, too.  Have owned two of them and De'Longhi support is commendable as well.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Amazing machine, love it, but the grinder isn't very powerful. Sometimes gets jammed and I have to vacuum out the beans. Not a good design either, can't remove the bean hopper without spilling out all the beans.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: It took about two days to get used to using this machine.  Since then the coffee is terrific and each cup is a pleasure to make.  Fun to use and a wide choice of types and flavors.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have been using this espresso machine for 5 months now and I love it!  I wouldn't want to be without it. We mostly use it to make Americano coffee and cappuccino.  It is constructed with high quality materials.  The la specialista is very easy to use but periodic cleaning and descaling do take some effort.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought the same product twice and I have problem with the machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Don't buy this machine - worst customer service ever!
Review Description: After only a few months of use - the cage that holds the basket broke.  We tried to get De'Longhi to replace it and they were awful.  Worst customer service ever.  Machine worked well up to that point and we loved it but I could never recommend it to anyone now.  Wish I could have the money back and get something else.  Shame...as if they took better care of their customers my opinion could be drastically different!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: So far I love it. The built in concealed tamper eliminates mess. Basic brewing is straight forward.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We were really looking forward to using this machine till I received the box and opened it to notice that we received a used machine with scratches, sticky and all dirty.  Very disappointed in De'Longhi!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Machine works good for two days. After that grinder would grind too much coffee even when I turned the adjustment all the way to least amount

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: ordered this item two times for both boxes to be completely destroyed. the machine previously used. the machine all scratched up. water damage to the manual. it is listed as a new item but is definitely used.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Highly recommend if you love espresso!
Review Description: Super easy to use!  Amazing coffee every time as long as you care for the machine and clean as specified. It does need de-scaling often though which is additional cost we were unaware of at time of purchase.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The grinder on the first machine broke after only two weeks. I thought it was a fluke so I bought a second machine and it arrived with a broken grinder.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The grinder stopped working after a few weeks of use.  I went through the hassle of convincing them there was a problem.  I returned the machine, and after several weeks they repaired it and sent it back.  That was three months ago.  now the grinder is doing the same thing - not grinding.  At all.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I would not suggest this machine to anyone.  It's a lot of money for a machine that is always having problems.  Simple things like the light flashes indicating that it needs water but the water tank is full and installed properly so it won't make coffee.  Look else where.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The grinder does not work again, regardless following all instructions. I  do not have the time to return it, fix it or wait to be fixed. My wife insisted on this brand because she thought that if it is this expensive it would work perfectly, but now we are both so disappointed. NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Perfect cup of coffee every time!
Review Description: We purchased this for our family Christmas. We never need to visit a coffee shop again. The coffee is delicious,  machine is easy to operate and clean. Worth every penny.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The first coffee maker was a lemon. The pressure gauge was not working. Amazon replaced it. It broke after first descale cycle. Delonghi is impossible to get on hold off, customer service has been shut down.Stay away from this brand.

The first problem I found was the steam. It was malfunctioning intermittently. Then the grinder failed.  Finally just last week I had a general system fault. I wish I could get a refund and find another brand.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Got this espresso machine for Christmas been using it for about one week give or take. But I came home from work and the whole kitchen counter had water everywhere. It leaked called De Longhi and was told I would have to send it back! However I would have to show proof of purchase which was fine however, rep didn’t tell me website was down for maintain everything till January 6! Than goodness amazon let me exchange it for a new one wish me luck!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I like this machine, but leaking has been a big problem for me. Also, it doesn't make foam for cappuccino. They are a good espresso machine, but this one has been like a nightmare for me :(

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: The grind is not working, the water pump is not working, and the water heat is not working.
Review Description: Got the coffee machine in a week, then set it up, and not working. I thought I didn't put the system right. I check again and lock everything up, but still wasn't work. I was so frustrated and get up. I returned to get back my refund. It is not a friendly and the machine is not cheap.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Best espresso ever I no longer ho to Starbucks.
Review Description: The flavor is so good the milk frother works perfectly coffe taste excellent

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: An excellent coffee machine. I bought it for my class and everyone loves it. So easy that even the class dunce has no problems, the taste is excellent, and the learning curve hardly is even there. 10/10

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Purchased Used From Amazon, Love It
Review Description: We purchased a used model in "acceptable" condition, was sent an essentially new almost untouched machine. Makes espresso super fast, looks great, tons of features, great build quality, list goes on.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Love this machine for its simplicity and performance.  Best frother out there, too.  Have owned two of them and De'Longhi support is commendable as well.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Amazing machine, love it, but the grinder isn't very powerful. Sometimes gets jammed and I have to vacuum out the beans. Not a good design either, can't remove the bean hopper without spilling out all the beans.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: It took about two days to get used to using this machine.  Since then the coffee is terrific and each cup is a pleasure to make.  Fun to use and a wide choice of types and flavors.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have been using this espresso machine for 5 months now and I love it!  I wouldn't want to be without it. We mostly use it to make Americano coffee and cappuccino.  It is constructed with high quality materials.  The la specialista is very easy to use but periodic cleaning and descaling do take some effort.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I bought the same product twice and I have problem with the machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Don't buy this machine - worst customer service ever!
Review Description: After only a few months of use - the cage that holds the basket broke.  We tried to get De'Longhi to replace it and they were awful.  Worst customer service ever.  Machine worked well up to that point and we loved it but I could never recommend it to anyone now.  Wish I could have the money back and get something else.  Shame...as if they took better care of their customers my opinion could be drastically different!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: So far I love it. The built in concealed tamper eliminates mess. Basic brewing is straight forward.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We were really looking forward to using this machine till I received the box and opened it to notice that we received a used machine with scratches, sticky and all dirty.  Very disappointed in De'Longhi!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Machine works good for two days. After that grinder would grind too much coffee even when I turned the adjustment all the way to least amount

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: ordered this item two times for both boxes to be completely destroyed. the machine previously used. the machine all scratched up. water damage to the manual. it is listed as a new item but is definitely used.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Highly recommend if you love espresso!
Review Description: Super easy to use!  Amazing coffee every time as long as you care for the machine and clean as specified. It does need de-scaling often though which is additional cost we were unaware of at time of purchase.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The grinder on the first machine broke after only two weeks. I thought it was a fluke so I bought a second machine and it arrived with a broken grinder.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The grinder stopped working after a few weeks of use.  I went through the hassle of convincing them there was a problem.  I returned the machine, and after several weeks they repaired it and sent it back.  That was three months ago.  now the grinder is doing the same thing - not grinding.  At all.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I would not suggest this machine to anyone.  It's a lot of money for a machine that is always having problems.  Simple things like the light flashes indicating that it needs water but the water tank is full and installed properly so it won't make coffee.  Look else where.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The grinder does not work again, regardless following all instructions. I  do not have the time to return it, fix it or wait to be fixed. My wife insisted on this brand because she thought that if it is this expensive it would work perfectly, but now we are both so disappointed. NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Water overflows from the drip tray after each use.
Review Description: While the espresso / coffee the machine delivers is pretty good, there seems to be a fundamental flaw in the design of the coffee machine. Water leaks and overflows from the drip tray after each use - well after the machine has been switched off.Beware of electrical shortages due to water leakage on the table from the coffee machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: impossible to get support  for the slightest  elementary problem
Review Description: unless there is FULL support one is better off buying this machine at a local shop.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great looking machine short on quality.
Review Description: Great product.  Amazing looking machine.  Froather works really well.  It biggest issue with the machine was the burr didnt work after throughly cleaning it even after reading the manual 3 or 4 times.  Another minus was the grinder setting only went to 6.  Unfortunately the product was returned.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I am satisfied

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I love this machine! Only complaint is that it was supposed to have the latte art wand and it came with a regular steam/frothing wand instead. For the price that was a major disappointment but not worth boxing it up and sending back. Only gave 4 stars for that reason.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Problems and no one at mfgr could help.
Review Description: Liked the machine, but constat problems and migration customer service not very helpful. Bought and sent back 2 machines. Won't order 3rd one.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Excelente experiencia para los amantes del café. Recomendada 100%

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I love my espresso maker. First big purchase I made on an espresso maker and it was well worth it. I read many reviews before I chose the one I did.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Best espresso machine for the value
Review Description: I bought this as a gift for my “coffee lover”. It actually produces amazing espresso. It’s very easy to use and looks very professional. I bought it after reading tons of reviews on the different machines in this price range and I settled on this one because of its functionality. We’ve had it 4 months now with regular daily use and it has been great.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Leaks water BUY ANOTHER MODEL OR BRAND
Review Description: Machine started leaking out of the bottom only after 60 days.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I haven't missed a day of coffee since it arrived.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Thanks

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: When you do double shot espresso sometimes the coffee container does not not fit and you have to remove a thin layer of coffee powder and then re insert.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Arrive after goods, always show the coffee bean box did not install, how to re-install, always flashing. Trouble to use.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Very good but, can take many attempts to get an espresso right
Review Description: Beautiful and well built.The built in tapper takes a lot of error out and the steamer is amazing.However, this is not that easy for anyone who has not made their own espressos before.  Can take several attempts to get the combination of grind and fill right.  Then you have to start over again with a different bean.  Or even the same bean but a new bag.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Very nice looking machine but needs a few tweaks to make it desirable
Review Description: Water didn’t get as hot as we would likeCoffee bean container not removable unless the canister is emptied.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Overall very satisfied with quality of the machine. A 9 out 10!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We love having quality espresso and cappuccinos every day. There is a learning curve to using it but the manual is very helpful and it becomes second nature. Well worth it!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: No way to tell when water tank is almost empty. Brewing stops mid cup when water is out.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: so far love it. It is much better then Krups, dont buy KRUPS!!!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Beautiful Design but make sure it fits under your countertops if that's where you want it
Review Description: I was so looking forward to this expresso but when I realized it didn't fit under the cabinets I was really disappointed.  Didn't get a chance to use it so now I'm looking for something else that is not quite so tall.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Ase meses no la puedo usar , me prende la luz que no tiene café y está llena , no me muele el café , casi no la podido usar

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Easy and traditional way of making coffee. The quality of the coffee is great.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: The ease of making an expresso type drink.
Review Description: A larger water tank would be nice.  The design is straight forward and easy to use.But the best feature: it has auto shutoff.  Prevents leaving the unit on when I leave home.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Did not work.  Any part of the machine would work.  Never filled up with water. The machine would run like it was trying to fill with water, but didn’t work

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: OMG this machine is the best!  Worth the money!  No more buying lattes and cappuccinos make them at home in less time!  It will pay for itself in no time.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have really loved having this sleek and efficient machine in my kitchen. Makes great espresso and lattes and was easy to learn. Important to use the flush Water button regularly to keep it running smoothly. Bought Feb 2020 and no complaints!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Was Charged Branding New Unit price. Received used one..
Review Description: Bad experience. I am planning for my family member's birthday. Unfortunately I received used one. Paid Branding New Unit price. It is rediculace.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: i love everything about the DE'LONGHI ESPRESSO  machine  the construction of the machine is prefect and beautiful is easy to use easy to clean a perfect coffee if you have the right setup (is on the manual) bottom line i like it.  D E L I Z I O S O.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This machine is a terrible idea.  Took it out of the box and it leaked cold water over the counter during first flush cycle.  Can’t reach customer support so will return this immediately.  Do not waste your time or money!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Excellent unit. Easy to use and froths milk well.  Great americano.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: It breaks and they won't replace it
Review Description: Apparently, Amazon lets anyone sell these, and even though it's under warranty, Delonghi won't help because it's "not an authorized dealer". Get the other brand straight from the website, not Amazon.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I have owned this machine for a total of 17 days and today it started leaking water around the drip chamber. I am extremely disappointed after spending 800 on a machine for it to fail with then the first couple weeks

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: About a month into our new coffee machine and really like it so far  I do wish it came with more detailed directions on getting psi pressure up for espresso and cleaning. Makes great coffees.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The product looks good，Ｉ haven't to try. A little problem is no invoice with the product when Ｉgot it. Ｉ need one in case something happen on machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Nothing so far so good

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: The machine broke within the fist 30 days. Overall it’s the best Desing I’ve seen and used but internally it may seamed like they used cheap parts.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great product! Could be better if...
Review Description: The only dislike is that IF you fill the bean hopper, you have to grind them all before switching to a different flavored bean or you will make a huge mess!  Wish there was a way to push a tab and close off hopper to change out beans if you decided to swap mid week.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Wish it made larger cup of American coffee.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: This machine is not too hard to setup, there is 1-800 support to assist. It is REALLY easy to use. LOVE IT!!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We like the machine, except now it just broke after four months. We need to wait for a box to be delivered to us, Pack it up send it back, wait for the repair and hope for the best. Not happy about that. They will not send us a new one.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Our first espresso machine.  Picked it for ease of use.  Snd it’s just that!  Solid espresso with no fusd

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I Love it!, Used to strong Caribbean coffee, this machine in dual grinding mode, makes an excellent strong coffee,smart tamper to perfection, homogeneous brewing : )

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: I am coffee drnker I love this machine
Review Description: the best coffee

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Still loving it after using it for 4 months.
Review Description: I haven't using it for 4 months.  It is easy to use.  The espresso is very good. I have been using it daily for America is and cappuccino s on the weekends.  I would recommend it for anyone looking for a automatic Expresso machine.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Grt machine their is a learning curve but once you learn the machine it’s grt. Should only take 1 or 2 times.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: I don’t need to purchase coffee from any where else

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I'm still getting used to this De'Longhi La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine, but so far so good. What is easy about this machine is that there is no mess or muss w the grinds spilling out, or wondering if i'm tamping with the adequate pressure or if i'm tamping at an angle, etc... since most of those variables are accounted for and taken out of the picture with the automated grind/tamp system in this machine. I think this machine allows aspiring amateurs like myself to get a better espresso with control over a few variables such as general heat, broad grind size, and water amount, without having to be an expert at grind preparation and tamping, controlling pressure directly or having an exact PID temperature controller. Altho this machine has a secondary milk heating system, it is not a true dual boiler, since you can't froth and pull a shot at the same time. But the delay is a bit shorter between shot and milk heat up with this machine. The plus with the ease of using this machine is that even my espresso-machine-phobic husband was willing to move the portafilter from the grind area to the group head and press the "ok" button to get a shot.The pics show me using the single shot (they provide the non-pressurized only) basket, and dark roasted (big box store) Guatemalan Arabica beans on the "2" fine grind level w a dosage dialed to the line in the tamped filter, and a 2 "bar" out of 3 heat setting.  I tried to use the instruction manual's suggested 1 bar heat setting and a "5" grind coarseness for dark roast coffees originally, but this gave me a weak and runny espresso.Although not shown, i also used a timer scale for a few pulls, just to check out what I was getting out. What I'm finding is that, at least with the beans I'm currently using, I can fit about 13g of coffee in the basket, and i'm getting about 35 g espresso out in a fast 12 seconds, w the pressure guage going to about the 11 o'clock region at the height. I tried to slow this down by using more coffee and a finer grind, but that did not work as well (basket got stuck, espresso did not taste as good)....so, i'm kinda wondering if i'm doing something wrong, but, "2" grind level as is, and 12 seconds tastes pretty good. i'll mess around with this more when i get to a different bean. I recently had also read about "turbo" shots that provide better extraction at relatively coarser grinds and faster speeds - such as my 12 sec, at a 1:2 or 1:3 grinds to espresso ratio being ideal for extraction, but that's a whole other controversy apparently. All I can say is that my espresso through this machine at the settings noted is flavorful, not bitter, bright tasting and yummy in general.I am having a big learning curve with the 3 hole milk frother wand tho, and it's been kinda challenging in comparison to the 1 hole wand i'm used to. Still, I made a decent looking froth at least for the pics shown.Overall, I'm liking this machine because I have some control of my espresso results, but my  non-caring-about-making-espresso-just-wanna-drink-it-now-can-u-just-make-it-for-me husband can pretty much make one too.  The resulting espresso is really tasty, and ultimately, that's what an espresso machine is for, i figure.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: The Mercedes of home coffee/espresso makers
Review Description: Let's start with how GORGEOUS the De'Longhi La Specialista looks on my cabinet. It just upped the class of the whole room. My poor fridge has already developed an inferiority complex, and let's not even talk about my cheap drip coffeemaker!The machine was packaged really well in the large box. I was glad two of us were there to pull the lighter-weight box out of the heavyweight box, because it fit so snugly. I was also glad two of us were there to pull the styrofoam-encased machine out, and I was glad one of us (not me) was strong enough to feel confident taking it out and placing it on the countertop. This thing is quite heavy, because it's made out of lots of metal components that, from what I can tell, are high quality.While the espresso maker would fit underneath my cabinets, I wouldn't be able to fill the bean hopper there. We'll keep it where it is now, near the edge of the countertop. If I need that space, I could move it underneath the cabinet when I'm not filling the bean hopper, but like I said, it's heavy. You could scoot it, but do you want to?This is my first espresso maker, so I honestly didn't know what I was doing. The Quick Start Guide is slick and would probably work pretty well for someone who has used espresso makers before. However, I was glad to see that De'Longhi has a YouTube channel. It has plenty of good videos on it. Just search "De'Longhi La Specialista" (plus any additional search terms like "latte" or "cleaning.") Look for the videos put out by "De'Longhi How-To." So far, I've found these videos to be helpful:-Setting up La Specialista for the first time-Making espresso for the first time-Making a Caffe Latte-Regular cleaning procedures of La SpecialistaI really wish the item had come with a full instruction manual. I like to have actual paper to flip through when I'm figuring out a new machine! I found the full instruction manual on De'Longhi's website. It was about 20 pages long, so I printed it out. Between that and the YouTube videos, I was in good shape.When I was setting up the machine, there was a red, bean-shaped, blinking light. I looked it up and realized I hadn't positioned the hopper correctly. The instruction manual helped me there. To properly position the hopper, place it in the machine (you'll be able to feel what position works), and twist to the left until it clicks. The lock icon on the hopper will line up with the arrow below. I wasn't twisting hard enough at first. (See photo for proper positioning.)Take the time to follow the instructions in the set-up video to prime your machine. Then take the time to follow the instructions in the espresso video to get your bean dosage and grind size correct. This all takes a while, but it's worth it! You'll probably end up wasting some grounds when you're getting the bean dosage correct. I saved mine in a plastic container to use in our regular drip coffeemaker later. By the way, to get enough grounds, I had to turn the dial for bean dosage further to the right than I expected; it's on the third mark.The cleaning video helped me. I hadn't realized the single and double filters (the ones that go inside the portafilter) each have a little part inside in the bottom that can be removed. If you look, you can see a little tab on the rubber gasket portion of the filter. Mine were placed in there so tightly, I had to use needle-nosed pliers to get that part off! It's supposed to be removed for cleaning. (See photo.) I hope that as I use it more, the part will loosen up a bit, but for now, I'm keeping pliers in the drawer below the machine.I LOVE the Smart Tamping lever! It's so easy to properly tamp down the grinds down! (See photo.)The accessories for this machine are generally heavy, which I love. The portafilter is heavy. The milk frothing jug is heavy. Even the water container feels like nice, thick plastic. The bean hopper feels lightweight, but it has a nice, metal lid.Clean-up will take some time, but there's no getting around that. It's really not too bad, and if you're making multiple drinks, you don't have to clean everything in between. (For instance, you can wait to clean the drip tray and milk steaming/frothing nozzle until you're done making drinks for your appreciative family and friends.)I made three tasty lattes, including one with almond milk, and my family members are already fans. I feel confident that, using this machine, I can make drinks rivaling the $5 ones I buy at Starbucks. I'm even going to try to learn to do some latte art, because why not?All in all, are there cheaper espresso makers out there? Absolutely. Many people, understandably, don't want to pay this much for a machine that makes coffee drinks. Having experienced the quality of this machine, I'm confident I'll enjoy the beverage-creation process more than I would with a more lightweight, budget-friendly machine. If you're getting an espresso maker because you want to save money instead of buying coffee shop drinks, you'll have to make a whole lot of drinks to break even on this machine! If you're getting an espresso maker because you enjoy the process of making your own drinks at home, and you put a high monetary value on quality and the pleasure of using well-made tools, this may be just the right choice for you.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: I'm still getting used to this De'Longhi La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine, but so far so good. What is easy about this machine is that there is no mess or muss w the grinds spilling out, or wondering if i'm tamping with the adequate pressure or if i'm tamping at an angle, etc... since most of those variables are accounted for and taken out of the picture with the automated grind/tamp system in this machine. I think this machine allows aspiring amateurs like myself to get a better espresso with control over a few variables such as general heat, broad grind size, and water amount, without having to be an expert at grind preparation and tamping, controlling pressure directly or having an exact PID temperature controller. Altho this machine has a secondary milk heating system, it is not a true dual boiler, since you can't froth and pull a shot at the same time. But the delay is a bit shorter between shot and milk heat up with this machine. The plus with the ease of using this machine is that even my espresso-machine-phobic husband was willing to move the portafilter from the grind area to the group head and press the "ok" button to get a shot.The pics show me using the single shot (they provide the non-pressurized only) basket, and dark roasted (big box store) Guatemalan Arabica beans on the "2" fine grind level w a dosage dialed to the line in the tamped filter, and a 2 "bar" out of 3 heat setting.  I tried to use the instruction manual's suggested 1 bar heat setting and a "5" grind coarseness for dark roast coffees originally, but this gave me a weak and runny espresso.Although not shown, i also used a timer scale for a few pulls, just to check out what I was getting out. What I'm finding is that, at least with the beans I'm currently using, I can fit about 13g of coffee in the basket, and i'm getting about 35 g espresso out in a fast 12 seconds, w the pressure guage going to about the 11 o'clock region at the height. I tried to slow this down by using more coffee and a finer grind, but that did not work as well (basket got stuck, espresso did not taste as good)....so, i'm kinda wondering if i'm doing something wrong, but, "2" grind level as is, and 12 seconds tastes pretty good. i'll mess around with this more when i get to a different bean. I recently had also read about "turbo" shots that provide better extraction at relatively coarser grinds and faster speeds - such as my 12 sec, at a 1:2 or 1:3 grinds to espresso ratio being ideal for extraction, but that's a whole other controversy apparently. All I can say is that my espresso through this machine at the settings noted is flavorful, not bitter, bright tasting and yummy in general.I am having a big learning curve with the 3 hole milk frother wand tho, and it's been kinda challenging in comparison to the 1 hole wand i'm used to. Still, I made a decent looking froth at least for the pics shown.Overall, I'm liking this machine because I have some control of my espresso results, but my  non-caring-about-making-espresso-just-wanna-drink-it-now-can-u-just-make-it-for-me husband can pretty much make one too.  The resulting espresso is really tasty, and ultimately, that's what an espresso machine is for, i figure.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: The Mercedes of home coffee/espresso makers
Review Description: Let's start with how GORGEOUS the De'Longhi La Specialista looks on my cabinet. It just upped the class of the whole room. My poor fridge has already developed an inferiority complex, and let's not even talk about my cheap drip coffeemaker!The machine was packaged really well in the large box. I was glad two of us were there to pull the lighter-weight box out of the heavyweight box, because it fit so snugly. I was also glad two of us were there to pull the styrofoam-encased machine out, and I was glad one of us (not me) was strong enough to feel confident taking it out and placing it on the countertop. This thing is quite heavy, because it's made out of lots of metal components that, from what I can tell, are high quality.While the espresso maker would fit underneath my cabinets, I wouldn't be able to fill the bean hopper there. We'll keep it where it is now, near the edge of the countertop. If I need that space, I could move it underneath the cabinet when I'm not filling the bean hopper, but like I said, it's heavy. You could scoot it, but do you want to?This is my first espresso maker, so I honestly didn't know what I was doing. The Quick Start Guide is slick and would probably work pretty well for someone who has used espresso makers before. However, I was glad to see that De'Longhi has a YouTube channel. It has plenty of good videos on it. Just search "De'Longhi La Specialista" (plus any additional search terms like "latte" or "cleaning.") Look for the videos put out by "De'Longhi How-To." So far, I've found these videos to be helpful:-Setting up La Specialista for the first time-Making espresso for the first time-Making a Caffe Latte-Regular cleaning procedures of La SpecialistaI really wish the item had come with a full instruction manual. I like to have actual paper to flip through when I'm figuring out a new machine! I found the full instruction manual on De'Longhi's website. It was about 20 pages long, so I printed it out. Between that and the YouTube videos, I was in good shape.When I was setting up the machine, there was a red, bean-shaped, blinking light. I looked it up and realized I hadn't positioned the hopper correctly. The instruction manual helped me there. To properly position the hopper, place it in the machine (you'll be able to feel what position works), and twist to the left until it clicks. The lock icon on the hopper will line up with the arrow below. I wasn't twisting hard enough at first. (See photo for proper positioning.)Take the time to follow the instructions in the set-up video to prime your machine. Then take the time to follow the instructions in the espresso video to get your bean dosage and grind size correct. This all takes a while, but it's worth it! You'll probably end up wasting some grounds when you're getting the bean dosage correct. I saved mine in a plastic container to use in our regular drip coffeemaker later. By the way, to get enough grounds, I had to turn the dial for bean dosage further to the right than I expected; it's on the third mark.The cleaning video helped me. I hadn't realized the single and double filters (the ones that go inside the portafilter) each have a little part inside in the bottom that can be removed. If you look, you can see a little tab on the rubber gasket portion of the filter. Mine were placed in there so tightly, I had to use needle-nosed pliers to get that part off! It's supposed to be removed for cleaning. (See photo.) I hope that as I use it more, the part will loosen up a bit, but for now, I'm keeping pliers in the drawer below the machine.I LOVE the Smart Tamping lever! It's so easy to properly tamp down the grinds down! (See photo.)The accessories for this machine are generally heavy, which I love. The portafilter is heavy. The milk frothing jug is heavy. Even the water container feels like nice, thick plastic. The bean hopper feels lightweight, but it has a nice, metal lid.Clean-up will take some time, but there's no getting around that. It's really not too bad, and if you're making multiple drinks, you don't have to clean everything in between. (For instance, you can wait to clean the drip tray and milk steaming/frothing nozzle until you're done making drinks for your appreciative family and friends.)I made three tasty lattes, including one with almond milk, and my family members are already fans. I feel confident that, using this machine, I can make drinks rivaling the $5 ones I buy at Starbucks. I'm even going to try to learn to do some latte art, because why not?All in all, are there cheaper espresso makers out there? Absolutely. Many people, understandably, don't want to pay this much for a machine that makes coffee drinks. Having experienced the quality of this machine, I'm confident I'll enjoy the beverage-creation process more than I would with a more lightweight, budget-friendly machine. If you're getting an espresso maker because you want to save money instead of buying coffee shop drinks, you'll have to make a whole lot of drinks to break even on this machine! If you're getting an espresso maker because you enjoy the process of making your own drinks at home, and you put a high monetary value on quality and the pleasure of using well-made tools, this may be just the right choice for you.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: We are big-time espresso drinkers and have worked to get the best home coffee for quite some time.  We have found it with this De’Longhi.  I have a Nespresso Innissa for quick espressos and a Barista-style espresso machine I got on Amazon, but the De’Longhi sails far above either of those machines.  And so it should at this price point, but I do believe this machine would be hard to beat in the sub-$1000 category of home espresso machines.  A fantastic feature that really makes a difference is the built-in tamper.  Tamping usually makes a mess on the counter but this machine with the pull of handle on the side does it before you remove the portafilter.  I got lucky to set the grind right the second time so that the coffee, once tamped, was right at the level line indicated to get a great brew.  I set my grind to #4 for my coffee beans and that seemed to work well also.  Another excellent feature of the De’Longhi is the pull down tray to place your cup(s) on.  Keeping your cup close to the drip also aids in getting the best crema on your espresso.  I ran a cup through both of my espresso machines using the same beans and you could really taste the difference the De’Longhi made.  The coffee (same coffee) actually tasted better!  I think it goes to show the technology in these higher-end machines and the superior extraction process.  I know this isn’t a cheap decision but if you are going up to that sub-$1000 price range, I don’t think you can beat this machine.  I will also add that it is just gorgeous looking in terms of design and really impresses on the kitchen countertop!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: De'Longhi Espresso Machine with Built In Burr Grinder
Review Description: This arrived just in time for a visit from family, someone who actually owns and uses an espresso machine, and who loves espresso coffee. My husband loves espresso, but orders from a local restaurant when he's in the mood and he is no barista.I'm a tea drinker, so yeah, what do I know. For the review I can tell you this, husband and visitor loved the results from the first shot. The beans ground in moments (just the right amount, automatically), the tamper is built in and tamps just right, the coffee brewed beautifully, and had the nice crema that apparently espresso drinkers appreciate for a silky touch.So I can't talk to the taste, but I can say that this is a well built machine and heavy, although there is some plastic involved. Still, it's a high quality appliance. The controls are self-explanatory (although reading the manual would be helpful for the uninitiated).This appliance will be much appreciated in our New England home by the visitors who are accustomed to a daily jolt or two of Cafe Cubano. We're ready.UPDATE Aug 13 2022: And on this day the grinder died. An hour spent cleaning the hopper and grinder parts and no luck. Downgraded to three stars and those remain because it really does make great coffee I'm told, and it still brews.But turns out it's a complicated process even for some people who know how to use an espresso maker, impossible for those who haven't without the instructions and no one bothers with instructions, they just barrel ahead.Be prepared to be the sole barista when guests arrive.FURTHER UPDATE: We sent it to an authorized repair company and they fixed it. From now on if someone wants an espresso they can wait until we prepare it for them.Still three stars. Five for the delicious coffee, so sayeth the coffee drinkers who have enjoyed a pour.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Best home espresso I have had
Review Description: I have spent a lot of time and money in pursuit of the best coffee I can make at home.  I have machines and accessories for just about every way of preparing coffee, to include 3 espresso machines, and a stove top (Mokka).  For the past few years we have been using a Phillips Saeco machine.  It is very easy, and also very good, but it does consistently pour a little water into the cup before it dispenses coffee... so it is good, but less than ideal.Some years ago I read on Coffee Geek that your grinder can make as much of a difference as your machine/ method of preparation.  I went through half a dozen grinders before I found one which lasted for more than a month or two past warranty (and there were several expensive grinders from well known companies).  The machine which lasted, the one we still use 6 or 7 years later, is a De'Longhi.  I also have a toaster oven from De'Longhi in my garage.  We used it for over 20 years, replacing it only this year with an air fryer, but held onto the De'Longhi in case that gives out.  All that said, I know that De'Longhi makes solid equipment which performs well and is reliable.  In fact, I sent my son a De'Longhi espresso machine when he graduated from college and then got stranded in California, by the shut downs.  Sensibly the next machine I would look at would be a De'Longhi.This machine does take more effort than the one we had been using, but it is an all in one machine.  It has a conical burr grinder which dispenses into the portafilter.  There is also a built in tamper.  The portafilter is then moved to where the water is expressed.  You can adjust the coarseness/ fineness of the grind and the amount of coffee ground/ dispensed as well as the amount of water and temperature.  A chart is provided with suggestions based on the roast.  There are also options with respect to how much froth is produced.This machine provides a lot more control than the Saeco and the amount of water, speed, heat are determined based on grind and dose settings.  The end result was espresso which was much better than I have been able to make with the other machines I have had.While the machine is not automatic, everything you need is provided, with recommendations for getting the best from each type of roast, but you can choose the grind and amount based on personal preferences, and store some of those choices with the "my" button.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Very impressive. It’s all stainless steel and is ready for decades of use because the stainless will look good for the life of the espresso machine without rusting away like other materials would have. And with all the other pieces and parts fitting perfectly well and made to last just like the stainless it can and will be passed on hopefully to another espresso lover just like myself. The instructions were informative and easy to read and understand and the pictures helped me immediately with setup and use. It grinds the beans to exacting specifications for this machines use. It does the tampering to required pressure as well with just a push of a button. I’m getting better and faster everyday in its use and with it doing most of the work for me with probably one hundred percent more accuracy than me. Each and every espresso I let it make for us is the perfect cup every time, all the time. It does get noticed immediately sitting on our counter the moment eyes set on it as it’s brilliant brightness and ultimate quality stands out against every other appliance we have. Definitely starts many a conversations. I’m fully satisfied with the quality of and the functionality it provides us daily. Update (24 December 2021) added a picture of the pressure dial getting into the optimal zone. Once dialed in we were rewarded with a great tasting five star experience!! Update (17 February 2022) We definitely are still enjoying the espresso machine and it’s ease of use but when it needs to be descaled everything comes to a screeching halt for 45 minutes. I turned it on this morning to prepare it for our drinks and we are just sitting around now waiting for it to descale. Maybe a switch so it’s not always need descaling at the critical time we need it the most. But still 5 stars. Five Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!! Update (March 7 2022) I stand corrected, as long as the knob is in any other position other than the descaling mode when the light comes on it will still continue to make espressos until AFTER the morning rush and can be descaled at our leisure later that day or night. We are still happy with the daily operation of the machine!!  Still 5 Stars. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: De'Longhi La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine, Stainless SteelMy husband has been wanting a good espresso machine, so we went ahead and got this when it was offered. After using it 2 or 3 times a day for the past two weeks, I can say without any exaggeration that it looks and performs exactly like a professional espresso machine and has everything you need to make espresso drinks that taste *exactly* as good as the best coffee houses. Although I could write a full report detailing why I believe it is an outstanding machine, I'll limit this to a just-the-facts paragraph. First off, it is fast, and you can have a double-espresso latte made within 5 minutes of turning it on. It is also the cleanest real espresso machine that I've ever used; the grinder doesn't leave coffee grounds anywhere and any small amounts of powder from the tamper collect straight down into the drip tray. The tamper is connected to the tamping lever with a spring which ensures that you don't over- or under-tamp the basket. The brewing has a perfect amount of automation, by which I mean that you still have a good control of the coarseness of the grind and the brewing temperature. One thing that really stands out to me is that it has a gauge that gives you feedback on the brewing pressure which gives you direct feedback to use for adjusting the grind coarseness for the specific beans that you're using. Selecting between a single or double shot is as easy as pressing a button and switching between espresso, Americano, or single serving of regular coffee in just a turn of a knob. For the Americano, it even automatically adds the right amount of hot water. The steam wand is really impressive because the control knob activates a pump that pulses water into the steam chamber which eliminates having to drain the wand of condensate and also ensures that there is the right amount of steam pressure. I could easily go on about this machine but suffice it to say that it really is that impressive! Highly recommend!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Best Expresso Machine on the Market
Review Description: A friend of mine owns this espresso machine and always has the coffee ever at his house. For the longest time I still couldn’t justify spending this much on a coffee machine, however I’m here to say that the D’longhi Specialista is worth every penny plus some. Aesthetically, this machine looks excellent on your countertops. Performance wise, this expresso machine is impressive and makes some of the best coffee you will ever have. The grinder on the top is great so that I don’t have to use my extra coffee grinder and the coffee is always super fresh. It portions out the exact amount needed for a cup of expresso based on your selection. It is a bit tricky to get the hang of initially, but the instructions are clear (plus their are videos online) and once you get the hang of it, it’s not complicated at all. It’s just going from a Keuirg to a fancy machine like this takes a bit of practice. I can make a double shot of expresso and foam/ steam my milk and no longer need to make a coffee run to get the coffee I desire. You can even pick the temperature that you want which is nice. Machine is tall, so if you have an older 1950’s home with shorter cabinets you will need to measure to be sure it fits under cabinet. We are not done renovating yet so cabinets are still short and I have to remove grinder accessory to push it so it sits flush under cabinet.Overall, I would highly recommend this. It is an expresso machine that you will get your money’s worth out of and the quality is top notch.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Personal note: I like coffee, and love espresso. But some in my household are absolute coffee fanatics. My wife and my daughter have the knowledge and are the real critics. One daughter works as a barista in a private high end coffee shop and is used to expensive equipment. That said...We all think this is a great machine.Everything about it feels and looks like quality, it is well designed, and it works well.Unboxing and setting it up was fairly simple.  As is typical (I guess) it took a few days of tweaking to fine tune it to our coffee preferences, but even the trial and error "fails" were drinkable.A big plus is the tamping. It is manually done... sort of. Well, it's foolproof. Hand tamping can be a learned skill (that I never quite mastered), but this doesn't require that. There is a lever on the side of the machine (like a slot machine) which is mechanically set to tamp to the right density. Works great, even when I do it!The milk frother is the real deal (though I'm not the big user), and works well. We (they) can make just about any coffee drink known to man now.There are also auto settings for americanos and regular coffees, but we really stick to the double espresso setting.Love it! Highly recommend!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: More user friendly than our previous machine, doesn't fit under our cabinets just barely
Review Description: EASY TO USEWe have had our Gaggia espresso machine for years. In those years I have repeatedly tried to get good at making espresso (my partner is the espresso maker in our house).  Every time, I give up.Part of that is because it feels too easy to make a mistake and part of that is because its a huge mess. Particularly getting the grounds from the grinder, and then temping them down. I know that probably sounds finicky and whiny to folks who really love their espresso but I hate it and it led to our counters never feeling clean.The fact that grinding and tamping is in the machine is infinitely better. It keeps our counters cleaner but it also means that when we get new beans, my partner can do all the fiddling to get the exact right grind and dose and then we just leave it that way for me to make my own drinks. Despite using this machine for over a month, I still don't know the principles behind getting the perfect pull, and I am totally okay with that. I am making more espresso drinks now than I ever did with the Gaggia. I don't know if purists find that annoying, but the added features make it a lot more user friendly. I am even pretty confident if my mom came to visit, I could show her how to do it once and then she could just make her own drinks.SIZEBecause the photo I took has the Gaggia in front of the De'Longhi it makes the Gaggia look a bit bigger than it actually is. It is definitely narrower, but a tiny bit taller. It used to live under our cabinet and had a fairly small footprint on the counter. The De'Longhi is more substantial and can't fit under the counter. If you took off the lid to the bean hopper, you could totally put it under the counter but that would leave the beans unprotected from the air and they would go stale. If your cabinets are a bit taller you might be okay but I think they are generally hung at a standard height. Because of that, we have it half under the cabinet with the hopper sticking out. There's only one real place in our kitchen that it fits that way, which is right next to the sink. While I think I'd prefer to have it on the left side of the sink which is impossible to do, this is okay - not ideal but okay.OVERALLIn the end, this is a nice compromise for my partner and I. He's super into making espresso and getting things as perfect as possible. I'm not interested in that at all, I just want good coffee. This is an excellent way for both of us to have what we want without me having to bug him for every drink. I also use the hot water function for tea every morning which means I can put my kettle in the cabinet. There is a way to change how much water comes out with the hot water function I believe but I haven't fiddled with it yet.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Description: Have you ever been to a small, craft coffee shop and gawked at their machines that they use? Well...gawk no more.  This machine is it!  It will grind your beans, tamp your grounds, drip your brew, and froth your milk.  All this in a sleek, majestic exterior that is common to everything Delonghi sells.This is NOT a coffee maker for the average Joe.  As long as you understand that, you won’t waste your money here.You’ll have to practice to know what level of grind is best for different beans.  I keep track in Excel.The auto-tank feature is clutch.  I used to pack my own stainless steel Nespresso pods and has trouble producing consistently packed pods.  This machine automates all that.It looks super cool on your counter top.  And unlike Nespresso, no proprietary pods required.A masterpiece.

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Intimidating for newbies, but makes tasty coffee
Review Description: I have never had a machine like this before, and am a newbie when it comes to making the "perfect" cup of espresso, so full disclaimer, this review is written by someone that knows next to nothing about this.  Having said that, this machine is beautiful and looks very expensive (which, it is).  It does not have too many parts to keep track of so that's good, but it does have more bits then I'm used to having to maintain, so it is a bit of an adjustment for me.  Putting it together out of the box wasn't that bad.This draws a LOT of power.  I don't know too much about these things but I know it blew a breaker right away.  I had to move appliances around in my kitchen for sure.I watched the videos on You Tube on how to work this machine and was enjoying several lattes right right away (I wanted to practice).  What I'm not really understanding is how to get the espresso I'm making match the diagram of a "perfect" espresso.  According to the pictures, I'm "over-extracting".  I've followed the instructions on how to correct this but nothing I do seems to change the look of the espresso coming out of the machine.  I guess it's no big deal because whatever this is making is delicious and a billion times better then the coffee I was making before, and I'll watch more videos and try and figure it out.I don't love:You can't froth milk and make espresso at the same time.  I guess that makes sense but I wish you could.There is no clearance for a decent sized mug.  I know us Americans make giant coffees, but hey, this is being sold to Americans so please make it a little but taller.  You can't remove the grill to give more clearance and make the machine work.There isn't much clearance for the frothing wand and it doesn't really move that much.  I don't feel like I can froth that much milk at a time.So basically, my main complaints right now are that I want to make giant beverages and this machine forces me to have portion/quantity control, which all is a #firstworldproblem!

Product Title: De'Longhi EC9355M La Specialista Prestigio Espresso Machine
Review Title: Great espresso maker with a learning curve
Review Description: The De’Longhi La Specialista is a great espresso maker.  It had a bit of a learning curve, though. So first… The unpacking itself was impressive. The packaging was done so well I barely could get the tightly packed machine out of the attractive and well-designed box.  The machine and its parts were packed within some seriously dense foam and the smaller parts were packed within a much smaller well-designed box within the main box.  The machine and parts were wrapped in a plastic wrap that ensured that even a small blemish could not occur during packaging or shipping.  The box contained all the parts necessary to make all types of one- and two-shot drinks: 2 espresso filters to make a single or a double espresso, descaling tablets, a stainless-steel milk pitcher, and a cleaning brush, and single-use descaling solution.My friend and I removed the parts from the box and we began the very small amount of assembly and setting the unit up on my countertop.  I decided to fill the bean hopper before I installed it onto the top of the machine.  I lay out a cloth and filled the hopper and once I started to move the hopper to the top of the machine, beans fell out of the bottom of the hopper onto the countertop.  Yes, the bean hopper has an open bottom.  That made us realize that you cannot remove the bean hopper while there are beans in it and it is installed on the top of the machine because they will spill out over the top of the machine and onto your counter and floor.  The bean hopper must be visibly empty to remove it from the top of the machine or you must vacuum the beans out of the hopper before removal from the machine or later vacuum the beans off the counters and floor.After that fiasco, I decided I might want to refer to the Quick Start Guide for the remaining setup items.  If in doubt, read the manual/quick start guide. The Quick Start Guide is helpful but in no way takes the place of the full manual.  My initial test results were poor.  But, after reading the full manual and still getting less than optimal results in grinding and brewing, I decided that the full manual does not take the place of the many YouTube videos available to help with settings and operation of the machine.  After reviewing several YouTube videos, I got to action, made some adjustments, and had much better results.I really like the integrated grinder with Sensor Grinding Technology which provides consistent grinding and the Smart Tamping Station perfect pressure tamper.  It took some looking at YouTube videos for me to understand the grinding operation and how to adjust the grind to get the optimal grind for crema but once I tinkered with it and did several test grinds and test shots of espresso, I better understood the adjustment needed to get the optimal shot and crema with the coffee beans I was using.  I believe it will be easy to adjust the grind to suit any other coffee bean I might choose in the future should I decide to change the brand and type of bean.  Understanding and using the tamping mechanism was a breeze.My favorite part of the machine is the Immediate Start function.  Yes, you can power the machine on and start grinding immediately.  While you are grinding, the machine is readying itself for the brewing, preparing hot water for Americano and/or milk frothing.  It uses two independent heating systems so there is no waiting time between the espresso and the milk preparation.  The Advanced Latte System is super easy to use and I was able to make the perfect foam the very first time I tried.  There are two options for milk – foam and flat.  The only downside is I wish the stainless-steel milk frothing pitcher were larger.  It only holds enough for a small latte.  I will definitely be purchasing a larger pitcher.The overflow tray offers a warning by use of a piece of floating plastic that sticks up through the tray as the tray fills.  By the time this happens, the tray is difficult to remove and balance to get it to the sink to empty.  Since it is easy to remove and check for fullness, I would suggest you remove it and rinse it before it gets to this level.  Some of the buttons function to give water for rinsing and steam for other parts of the machine for cleaning.Overall, the great design of this espresso maker makes this piece of equipment fancy up my countertop.  It’s just a gorgeous amalgam of stainless steel that looks luxurious and professional at the same time.I do think some things could be better.  For one, the milk steamer pitcher is small – very small – only 12 oz.  That may sound big enough but it only holds enough milk and foam for a half-full mug of latte.  But that is an easy to resolve issue by purchasing a larger pitcher.  The bean hopper should have some type of mechanism that would allow it to be removed without losing all of the beans.  I would think some type of an operable lever that could close off the hopper might be a plus.  I also think the height of the bean hopper can be a problem with top cabinets that are not abnormally high.  Mine are about 17-1/2”, pretty close to new Cabinet standards, and the hopper lid does not fit on the hopper and fit under my cabinet.  It’s just a little too tall. I am using a small piece of plastic to cover the hopper when it is under the cabinet.  This could be a major problem for some because many cabinets are much lower than mine.  Also, the low upper cabinet might get in the way of operating the tamper lever.  In addition, the drip tray could use an early warning system instead of a “too late” system to notify the user that it is full.
